ea3thi7e49n_DJCw3fpGbw.text: really solid breakfast place! had their brisket sweet potato hash and it was fantastic! the brisket was well cooked and had lots of smokey flavors and then the sweet potato came in with a sweet touch! also great customer service really felt at home.

EkACJcrC8mUkMuyPFbToDw.text: My husband and I just got back from here. It's very cute little place. Quite small, but quaint and decorated very cute. It was slightly busy for lunch. Mostly takeout orders though.   We both got breakfast dishes, the brisket hash and the biscuits and gravy. I had read reviews that the portions were huge, but that must be the lunch/dinner dishes because ours were not that big. The people sitting next to us had lunch though (it was about 1pm) and their portions did look quite large. I enjoyed the sweet potato and brisket hash. My eggs (over easy) were just fine. I did enjoy the biscuit that came with it too, but the topping (savory crumbly topping of onion, poppyseed, etc) was good but there was quite a lot of it. That was kind of overkill for me. My husband's biscuits and gravy dish was very good, though seemed a little small.   Employees were nice, seemed to know what was going on. They've only been open a few days and I could hear some training going on behind the counter, but I didn't mind that. The wait for the food was a bit longer than we would have liked. They had a little dispenser out for water, though the water could have been colder and the glasses set out for it were on cloth so the glasses ended up with a little lint on them. I think a tray would have been a safer bet for cleanliness personally. I did consider it to be a bit pricey for the type of place it was (you order at the counter and they call your name to come get your food) and the portion sizes (but again, lunch/dinner portions looked bigger). Our total was $27 for two breakfast plates.

MWxNDxF-wOeoarVe-2VB8w.text: I've been waiting a while for this place to open. I live right around the corner and we definitely lack dining options in the vicinity. My husband and I have been there 3 times so far. The food is really good!  The staff is friendly and pleasant. We ordered the food take out twice.   The one time we ate there, the air was blowing on us too hard. And the layout of the restaurant is a little tight.  So I prefer our food to go. The price is fair and I hope they keep the quality of the food and staff at these levels.

fHyd43Tq81Um2_vnENbtDA.text: grew up in vegas..... have now found my new favorite restaurant, honestly didnt have high hopes, there food wins, best brisket sandwich ever.... love this food here, cant wait to eat more

UgxY0N5wSrOUNzHHirQ1uw.text: I've been looking for a place to get fried chicken for some time now I tried mama birds because it is close to my house I love their Fried Chicken but more than anything else I like the friendly service and the fact that people took the time to explain things on the menu I found the menu to be a bit confusing but once I sorted through my choices

k4_YdlHQqDtOwdRP180-nQ.text: We went to this quaint restaurant looking for good ribs.  It was a little crowded but well worth the wait for the food!  The food is sublimely delicious!  I went in for ribs and fell in love with the fried chicken.  They have fried boneless chicken thighs that has been seasoned and breaded so well it defied logic!  Forget about the Colonel!  This chicken must have been made by a Four...NAY, a Five Star General.  It is the best fried chicken I have eaten in Las Vegas by a country mile!  We also enjoyed the pimento cheese along with the Wicked deviled eggs.  The eggs had bacon as well as candied (yes candied) jalepenos.  I can't "crow" enough about Mama Bird!

9xIJbYqEZUe8a6R5FdUziQ.text: We had the Pecan Smoked Ribs and they were delicious. The Collard Greens and Coleslaw were great as well. We checked in with yelp and were given a cool and refreshing slice of watermelon with an original watermelon lime sherbet. Everything was home made and very good. The decor is very modern and charming. We met one of the owners who was really nice. Try it!!

Just like my last visit, the staff was beyond helpful and accommodating to our kids picky choices. The deviled eggs were so delicious, may even be better than my moms (don't tell her) serving size is big, so come hungry or even better, know you'll have leftovers for the next days lunch! Thank you Mama Bird, see you guys again soon!

azByZZG3P9c0GDi8eNxDJQ.text: I've been during this place since they've opened and I finally made my way tonight for a late dinner.  I ordered the brisket slider, small side of Mac n Cheese, small side of collard greens and 3 deviled eggs. 1 with bacon and 2 without.  I am impressed. I am from the south born and raised and I've been down talking Vegas soul food and bbq since I moved here 7 short months ago. I will now gladly recommend mama bird. Although I haven't had the chicken.. yet! I know it's going to be good.  I had to ask for bbq sauce for my slider, it was a little dry but I suppose that's because I came a hour before close. The brisket meat was a little charred and dry but I have faith that it was just this batch.  The EGGSSS are SOO GOOD! Reminds me of my granny's and I never compare her cooking to anybody because no one has ever been worthy. Lol The greens were good, they're meat filled which is nice and the levels of salt, sweet and Acid was done really well. The Mac n cheese could use a little love but I'd still order it again!  Overall, I'm satisfied and finally have a place to come when I'm feeling home sick

g4CLFzQm2uD8ZQvraSSYzg.text: First time visit today. Awesome food! Deviled eggs with bacon with  candied jalapenos are the best I've ever eaten and I've eaten tons of deviled eggs! Really good! The sausage gravy and biscuits were also the best I've had! Presentation and flavors are outstandingly well done here! The Pecan Smoked Baby Back Ribs just out of the smoker, so tender and delicious. We will definitely come back! Great job Mama Bird!!! Shout out to Ryan for his suggestions!

Z61vW__bqMQd2KhpKk7Szg.text: I give them credit for trying and a good decor and layout but the actual flow of the restaurant and (more importantly) the food is just not good. We ordered the biscuits and gravy and the biscuits were ok but that sausage gravy is an embarrassment. If you add a ton of pepper to it to give it some flavor maybe it's passable. But bland.  The scrambled eggs were dry to the bone. I didn't even eat those. Then I got the fried chicken and biscuit. The biscuits are ok but I could've used some jam. They don't have any jam. Apparently in the whole restaurant.   The chicken was a total miss. Way too much batter and no flavor. Even with hot sauce it just isn't good. It's really hard to find real authentic southern food in vegas and this is just a continuation of that trend. If you're going to do southern food, you need flavor and spice and to take some risks. This is none of those.  Lastly they should rethink the format. Ordering and  then sitting and then going back to the counter to get food for each portion is so silly. Either do a sit down restaurant or do numbers and being out the food as it's done. It's chaotic to walk back and forth for everything.

p0WTfxRNQT1yuytPtDGm4A.text: The food was fresh and prepared fast.  We ordered the Smoked Brisket Hash, Mama's Skillet and Wicked Deviled Eggs.  All were amazing.  The deviled eggs were sweet and delish.  The brisket had just enough heat and the skillet bacon was amazing.  The biscuits were flaky and just the right density.  All and all amazing food!

sf8pGrJjEZRbDuYqgq6_3g.text: Came here for brunch and tried the famous wicked deviled eggs and the pitmasters scramble. So one of the employees said that the wicked deviled eggs are a must try and I couldn't agree more. He also told us to eat the egg as if it was a shot (no problem here) which helped get the full flavor. Bacon of course makes everything delicious but along with the jalapeno, it was the best shot I think I've taken lol. We should have gotten 6 of them. The pitmasters scramble was so heavenly. Every bite was full of flavor. The brisket was amazingly sweet, the pork belly savory! I was a little concerned about cheese sauce being put on top....but I would have put that on everything it was soo good. Recommend this dish for sure. I have to come back ASAP to try other things on the menu. Service was good and everyone was friendly, but just know that you have to place your order at the cashier (I thought the waitress was going to serve us so we sat there looking silly).  5 stars!!

Next time I want the brisket grilled cheese.  The watermelon soft serve was so-so. Don't get me wrong, it was good just not what I was expecting.

I also like an old fashioned bone in fried chicken instead of the boneless one though I must admit the boneless taste good too. The collard green is among the best that I have tried. rXhdUjlq4LmzkGLTMkLCvQ.text: Just ate at mama bird & we're very disappointed. Their prices for the amount of food is terrible. We've eaten Texas brisket for 25 years, theirs was small portion, mostly fat. I had sausage and biscuits came out cool, salty to the taste. A gallant young man tried to make it right. But when you come hungry to eat, and food doesn't meet your expectations you can only say very disappointed, dissatisfied over our nearly $50 unsatisfactory meal. Go to metro cafe. Samuel

MSv2rKCRJFqwrH0YO9BBzg.text: This could become our favorite place for the family going forward. Super friendly staff. Ample seating areas to enjoy our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place to have dinner with the family.

j-T9ypHmDpyzcPwwg8MPDA.text: Overpriced, under seasoned, canned corn in the cream corn, really nice staff  Entrees - Fried Chicken Breast (2 stars, hard pass), Ribs (4 stars, great sauce)  Sides - Cream corn (2 stars), Mac and Cheese (3 stars)  This restaurant is really overpriced for what you get, but the service is really good for a fast casual restaurant.  I wanted some fried chicken, and we wanted to try this restaurant, so we gave it a try.  As to the fried chicken, the best fried chicken in Vegas is either at the Brooklyn Bowl or Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken (same owners).  The fried chicken at mama bird is not as good as fried chicken you can get at KFC.  First, Mama Bird does not season at every level.  The chicken itself is very bland.  The dredge is also very bland.  Second, MB uses boneless chicken breasts.  Third, the breading is large and clumpy and lacks the overall look and taste of what you would expect from fried chicken.    The ribs were good, but looked like they were frozen.  There is just a look that you know when you make ribs or order them from a BBQ restaurant.  The sauce was very good.  If you want awesome ribs, go to Culinary Dropout.    Finally, the sides....  What can I saw, you know canned corn when you see it.  MB would be better off using Del Frisco's recipe for cream corn that uses frozen corn, which is available online, but whatever.  This dish was meh.  The Mac N Cheese was okay if you like boxed Mac N Cheese.  It tasted like MB put processed cheese like Velveeta in its Mac N Cheese.  It tasted okay, but a restaurant should probably use an actual bechamel sauce as a base, especially at the prices charged by MB.    It was nice to try, but we won't be going back.

827RpgWy8bwEekAG_1ObaQ.text: I come here often with my friends and family and every time it's just as good as the first time, if not better. Everything on the menu is jaw dropping. The flavor and texture of everything makes this place work so well. I'd eat here for breakfast, lunch and dinner if I could. Please come here. It's a must.

CbwkkhDeJWPzZL089T33Hw.text: This is our new favorite place! The food here is AMAZING!! There are so many delish options it was hard to choose what we wanted to try!! Definitely check this place out!!!

7AU3JHE_HGezMbmkJKdMvA.text: I had the shrimp and grits; it was meh. The grits lacked flavor and the shrimp seemed to be an afterthought. Definitely not a True southern rendition which offers a lot more SOUL. The pimento cheese was really good and fun to eat. Could have used way more crackers - 8 saltines just didn't do it.

1EtFMcjHkzsczKPJBIWV9w.text: We came here this morning at 10:30 and didn't leave till 11:45 due to waiting for our food for 30 MINUTES!   I'm not sure why it took so long to make our food but very disappointing. Everyone around us was fed up with waiting as well. Never did we receive an apology either due to waiting 30 minutes. Never even a "your food is coming up shortly". Nothing. I told my husband if our food isn't here within 5 minutes we will ask for our money back and leave.   Someone should've come around and said "I'm so sorry for the delay, is there anything I can get you while you're waiting. Refills or anything" or better yet "so sorry for the delay we'd love to have you come back and try us out again another day and we'd be happy to comp one of your meals" nothing.   When we came in also we were never greeted when we entered. We stood around in the front bc we weren't sure if we seat ourselves or what. The cashier and chef both looked at us and never said "hi welcome in, look at the menus and then order up here". Nothing.  Very disappointed in the lack of customer service here. They need to work on that big time!   The food was just ok. The biscuits and gravy was probably one of the best ones I've had. My husband chicken and waffles wasn't very good and cold. So we will not be back. Very disappointed.

RUpNkWv7cJnEog3NAUiedA.text: What a cute little southern place, the food is amazing from the shrimp and grits to the chicken sandwiches  5 stars all the way! Did I almost forget to mention the super yummy non-alcohol ginger beer they have, oh my...my favorite is the strawberry one. Definitely would recommend this place to everyone!

4bIv8B3l-lGguyHF-MVGkg.text: So far I have been here 3 times and so far one of the best places in the southern highlands area. Twice was dine in and another to go.   I've eaten a variety of the items and the best things are the pork belly and the fried chicken breast. The thigh is good too but the breast is perfection. Very surprising since I love dark meat fried chicken everywhere else.   The Mac and cheese is also really good. Probably one of the best. It's been busy the times I dined in but not too long of a wait.   Hope they keep up the quality and looking forward to trying the rest of the menu

ZKIj8xDnw3EPdBKqq5-o1Q.text: Overpriced. Overpriced. Overpriced. Even though I'm rich and live in a luxury mansion and am really rich this place was still not worth it. It was good but I want fancier food.

RilPjpXsVFu9QbO7PmGDTw.text: Ordered the chicken sandwich with fries and the chicken and waffles meal.  Me, my husband, and 3 kids all shared the 2 meals because the prices were not in our budget.  We waited about 20 mins for our food, not too bad (but it gave me enough time to walk to smiths and buy a container of watermelon because I wasn't going to pay $4 for a slice for my kids). My expectations were not very high because I was already having big regrets for even walking in when I saw how expensive the menu was.  The chicken was fried pretty good and juicy!  Not much flavor but I dipped it in syrup so it was all good.  The waffles were...waffles (just whatever). But the butter!.... the butter was pretty good!  Not sure what they put in it (slightly oily, sweet, and some herb in it). The fries that came with the sandwich were good also, or was it the dipping sauce that made it good?  Yes, I really enjoyed the sauce!   -Im glad we gave it a try but I don't think we will ever go back.  Between the wait for a clean table, then the 20 min wait for our food, the cook that was yelling a little too loud, and the expensive fried chicken.  Maybe I will go back and buy a side of butter tho!

rFgrx35yoAr3dT9msEqSQw.text: The food is really good! I ordered the Mac and cheese waffle sandwich and it was definitely worth it! It looked like a lot of food but it was light and didn't leave me with a food coma. I will be back for sure!!

gl5iDacumkaBTbNjZ6hmfg.text: If you are in the mood for Southern food, such as BBQ ribs or fried chicken, I highly recommend. Try the ginger beer served in copper mugs (lime, strawberry, apricot, and jalapeno). The portions are generous and the people are friendly. I am very picky about macaroni and cheese... and ate a whole bowl by myself. We had 12 people in our party and everyone enjoyed at the food. Make sure you eat the watermelon soft serve for dessert- it is not an ice cream but made from real watermelon. If you have a large group, it is a good idea to call ahead.

aT8lnxTK8m7ujsBp6EjPNQ.text: The chicken and waffles were really good...especially topped with Mac and cheese. Took awhile to get it but it was worth the wait. I asked them not to put green onions in my food. They did it for one side dish but forgot and put it on other side dish. The lady who took our order seemed fluster and told me to stop in the middle of my order. Her tone and demeanor was very rude. This is like a self serve place where you order at the front, sit down and grab your food when they call your name. So I don't even know why I included gratuity...Have to get up for everything including to go boxes and refills.

kTo7KG1zXbgpORzySNgEhA.text: The aesthetic is wonderful here. It's just rustic enough but very updated and sleek at the same time.  My husband got the fried bologna with the north/south friend and he enjoyed it. The sandwich had a bit too much cheese overall and the "southern" fries (the sweet potato fries) were pretty good but needed a little more seasoning. I got the biscuits and gravy with eggs which was definitely a different type of biscuit and gravy I had ever had. The everything biscuits were really good, and this is coming from someone who doesn't like everything bagels. The gravy was good but was lacking in the sausage which could definitely give it some of the flavor it was missing.   The watermelon lemonade itself is worth the trip over here in my opinion. They do watermelon lemonade right! I think next time I'll try the fried chicken, I saw it come out for someone else and wished I had room to try it this time!  Edit: The watermelon soft serve is the star of the show!

8wbvc_MYLemzE85nnI0kRg.text: The food whether something simple like the deviled eggs or a full meal like the fried chicken you can't go wrong! Each bite was full of flavor the fried chicken flavor is so savory, I have to keep bringing friends when they come from out of town!

rzk_GgSL8Gyh7kX4zG1nKw.text: Incrediable!  Started out with the pimento and cheese app, this jewel came with saltines, bacon jam, and pickled jalapenos. Omg was sooooo delicous. Get this!  Next we tried the cornmeal chicken and waffle. The butter they give you to put on the waffle is unique and savory. The crunchy chicken was moist and was amazing with the green table hot sauce on it. The servings are huge here so come hungry!  Also I noticed you get a free watermelon soft serve with Yelp review so get to it!   I may come back here tommorow just to try that fried bologna sammy! Yum

0ParHW8COEdTFL8K81TsSg.text: This is my first time dining in for mama bird and it's a chaotic  experience. Here is what you need to know: -the food is pretty good and they have cool watermelon inspired treats. -great for take out  -not great for dining in : okay customer service, the people are sweet, and might just be understaffed. Chaotic, self seating and self serving which can be cool in a bigger space.  When we had takeout we did dinner items greens, chicken and it was delicious and pretty hot considering we used postmates. When we dined in we had brunch : chicken and waffle, biscuits and gravy, shrimp and grits. The flavor for everything was delicious, but pretty cold. If we had a better dine in experience with hot food and less chaos I would give it 5 stars. The food was a 4 and the service a 2.5 so I would give it a 3.5 if I could.  Hopefully next time will be better!

cyMlRUwAW3CEcMSc7DaTrQ.text: The food here is amazing!!!!! I was shocked that they weren't that busy but this place has the BEST fried chicken in Las Vegas.  We tried a little of everything from the mac n cheese, chicken sandwich, deviled eggs and waffles.  The staff were so great and seemed generally happy to work there.   To Serenity, Kathi and the kitchen crew thank you for the amazing food and hospitality!  We will be back many more times.

MkAgf_hnKj6xKAdnPQQaTw.text: This place earns all five of these stars!  From the ambiance, to the service we received, to the AMAZING food.. this is one of the best places we've tried in Vegas thus far! It was our first time here and Coleen was so helpful. She told us all of the dishes she personally recommends, along with customers favorites, and all the staffs favorites. We were checked on by three of their staff members throughout our time here and everyone was very friendly.  The food was absolutely delicious! We ordered the deviled eggs, chicken & waffle, and the 3 piece breast with a side of Sweet Cream Corn. Their fried chicken was easily one of the BEST fried chicken dishes we have ever had. Not to mention, the great balance of flavors on the deviled eggs and sweet cream corn. The waffle was the perfect balance of crispy and soft. I can go on and on about how great this place was but all I can say is I definitely recommend this!   For your enjoyment, I've attached pictures of our food.

LUo5Tx6OnmdmUgGeLSc2Ag.text: Really enjoyed the meal my family shared here! We got the Meat & Greet that had ribs, brisket, chicken, and 3 sides. We also got appetizers and desserts. We spent about $120 for the four of us and our drinks. The watermelon lemonade was delicious and the deviled eggs were pretty good. The food was plentiful as well seasoned, the brisket wasn't fatty and the ribs were tender. They make their own BBQ sauce that was good, and the sides were all well done. We got white cheddar grits, creamed corn, and coleslaw.   We had a slight issue with missing an item from our order and they rectified the issue immediately. The food was good but I do wish more of the sides came with the meal, we ran out quick and pretty much had a meat fest. I also wish they had free refills on drinks, the food is mouthwatering good, but still- biscuits and no drink is a recipe for disaster.

There was a long wait and they gave us a complimentary Spicy Fried Green Beans and I can definitely say, that I'm going to order that again when I come back. They were delicious. What mal it even better, is that we didn't even waited that long.   Thanks Mama Bird

d9h4-xixXniLfZRUNxYGRQ.text: Delicious! Our new go to spot right outside of Las Vegas. The breakfast biscuit was great. I suggest getting 2! The gravy was delicious (and a bit heavy, as you would expect). The watermelon has honey and lime drizzled on top and the watermelon lemonade hits the spot on a hot day.

Xblg3EOBc5oJG4QxMVoP2A.text: It was such an awesome dining experience during my Vegas trip this past weekend! I can't even name a favorite since everything here was so good!!  . Going clockwise: - deviled eggs  (bacon and candied jalapeno on top. Ate it as a whole in one bite to taste all the flavors). - Mac n Cheese fried chicken sandwich  (huge portion and great deal for the price!). - fried chicken + waffle  (can't go wrong with this! Fried chicken was so crispy ). - pecan smoked baby back ribs  and smoked brisket  with a side of gooey mac n cheese (so tender and flavorful even without the sauce!! The biscuit was also so buttery and yummy!). - non alcoholic strawberry ginger beer in a mug  (fun, fruity, and refreshing taste) . A sweet treat! - watermelon soft serve  (so refreshing and perfect sweetness level to end the meal) . Definitely one of the places you wanna visit in Vegas!  See more of the pics on my IG: @foodxeater

-dcbHpnZMI9sSKDUqvBhZA.text: Southern food. If you are vegetarian or vegan probably not a great choice. It is definitely different style Of food. Customer service was great. Eggs were a little runny and biscuit was dry. The main course was good. The meat is super!

DvGGClg2oSDO_7tti_A6Zw.text: I'd been to this restaurant once before but the second visit is where they hit rock bottom for me. First, my omelette had hair in it. Obviously, I returned it and asked they remake it. Not a refund just a remake.  It took a ridiculous amount of time to get my food the second time around. While my family finished their food at the restaurant I walked to Smiths to pick up a prescription and back only to notice my new omelette still hadn't reached the table. I then watched a group of 5 that came in well after my plate was sent back  to the kitchen receive their meals before my to-go box of food came out. The icing on the cake was getting to the car only to find they didn't even make my omelette properly. It wasn't what I'd originally ordered. I also had a chicken tender on my original plate that wasn't  in the to-go box either. Long story short I definitely got my money back but only because I asked for it. They didn't seem to care that my food had hair in it and demonstrated no sense of urgency in rectifying situation...they actually didn't even pay attention to what was on the plate that I sent back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mama&#39;s Fry Pan Breakfast

xJzZ1FdEDw8-mYlh8vzqIQ.text: Saw my friend's post on Instagram about this place and because they're less than 10 minutes from my house...why not?! So we went on a Sunday afternoon. Not too busy as it was around 5pm when we got there.   Super cute decor. Definitely aesthetically pleasing. You can immediately order as you walk in - as the cashier station is right there. It was a bit confusing when I got in because while I stood in line to order, they were also entering a phone order from my side of the booth, not inside. But it was cool as the staff was friendly. They took our order and we waited for about 15 minutes til we got our order. I got chicken and waffles and my husband got the brisket with creamed corn. My chicken was really good! Crispy on the outside but the batter was still a bit raw inside---I'm just glad the chicken was fully cooked! Not sure why the batter was still a bit wet though. Oh wells. Tasted my husbands brisket and it was juicy and flavorful. Not dry like many bbq briskets I've had before. The creamed corn was alright. I've had better. I was hoping it'd taste just like the one I've had in Texas but it didn't.   I'll give it a few more months til we go back to give them a chance to improve on what needs to be improved as they are fairly new. Goodluck!

DuwWyzqzNJYJowBicYimaQ.text: Went to check this place out! It's such a cute restaurant with great food! We got the deviled eggs, brisket slider, and chicken & waffles, it was so good!

FsuKTLlEX1Y5X4Zk82RENQ.text: Found this place after a gymnastics meet for my daughter.   About 9 of us was looking for  something good to eat outside of the smokey casino.  Walked into this nice and cozy place based on Yelp reviews.  Not disappointed at all. The chicken was had by all and all was great.  Service was great, people had the best personality and they made us feel at home. The fried chicken was amazing.  The greens we great, I highly recommend.  I also had the cheesy grits,  1 brisket slider made with there soft  biscuit.  My wife has the mac and cheese .  There was not one thing that I would not recommend. I also ordered a  note of their housemade Apricot Ginger and it was really good.  My daughter lived there watermelon drink too.  The crew Lrwady said that we are coming back here the next time we are in town.

9-UfyXrfRSpKis8oPt7Qew.text: We finally made it in and I'm mad at myself for not coming in sooner. The atmosphere is great, the. food is awesome and everyone was so nice. Make sure you try the chicken and waffles, they were perfect!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid approved
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the Chicken and Waffles!

28pJBO1iqdYp41azD8S6Ww.text: This is some real comforting southern comfort food! The deviled eggs are amazing and the chicken tenders are so juicy and well cooked. Dont get me started on how great the mac-n-cheese is too.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TW-y6KK_NcORXCUXILoxFA.text: We stumbled onto Mama bird by accident. We wanted to order food to go at a place nearby. We saw the reviews and we decided to try it--- what a great decision! Service was good and the food was amazing! We had the shrimp and grits, fried chicken with collard greens and pecan ribs with corn. We love the person touch on the boxes!   We didn't get to take photos because the food tasted so amazing!!!   We are definitely coming back to dine in!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jrJZNMg1P2M-HoslbXClVQ.text: The food here is great and the portions are large. The chicken with the chicken and waffles and watermelon lemonade were delicious!  Four of us came in for breakfast and left happy.

cMN928pfIPYUEf2WcZjHOw.text: Went there a couple of weeks ago.  Wanted to bring my girlfriend here since I was there a couple of months back and had great service and food.  We placed our order for the chicken & waffles and the special brisket  with mac and cheese.  Right after that a order for one of the online food service delivery's came in.  The driver registered the order.  We sat down and waited for our order.  Something happened with our order as well as the drivers pickup order.  We were both waiting there for over an hour.  The wait staff realized something was going amiss when they walked passed us and saw our order number.  They had a computer glitch that dropped our order.  They apologized and gave us a free appetizer and desert.  Other than the computer issued, the food was great.  Bring an appetite.  The wait staff was hustling to get orders out and tables bussed and clean.   To avoid headaches,  go when its not peak times.  The first time I went was before peak times.  I will go back just not during high traffic times.

AZqBDrDwKix2abNp4yrLSw.text: WOW! This place has the best fried chicken and greens!! Great customer service too! I cannot wait to go back and try more items off the menu! I will definitely recommend Mama Bird to all my friends and family! You definitely have to give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken and greens!
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs!
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and gravy!

j6POI0LocOYtsSmIWNykvQ.text: Pork Belly & Grits Shrimp & Grits 6 Deviled eggs 1 sweet tea  Gabrielle cooked our food to perfection. Ah! Comfort food at it's best.  Grits were very nicely done and very flavorful. Shrimp & Grits was the best we've had in Vegas. EAT and Metro Diner have a thing to learn about simplicity and flavorful.  Pork belly had a good sear and very tender. A nice alternative to the mundane steak and eggs.  Where there are so many breakfast joints in Southern Highlands, Mama Bird shines the brightest! We wish Zack and his partner every success.   FYI...they do have straws! Just ask.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full slab of ribs, mac&amp;cheese, coleslaw &amp; collard greens. Excellent! Great smokey flavor. Meat was soft &amp; juicy, &amp; stayed on the bone.
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits, Smoke Pork Belly &amp; Grits, Watermelon Lemonade and Sweet Tea. All done to perfection! What a way to start breakfast.
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Straws do exist here!

ysflz-kA3FBVY1hiYiyW5A.text: Great southern style food! The deviled eggs are amazing and it sets the tone of what's to come, everything we ordered was delicious and on point. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs

nKuEuQY8m4FB1sBl_wPU-A.text: Food was good! Friendly staff, kinda short staffed and got frazzled when more customers came in, but disappointed that I asked for the watermelon ice cream and this is what they gave me. No watermelon!! What?! Brag about watermelon but then don't give us any? More then likely won't come back..

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon ice cream. No watermelon!

IjsmtrzlHjoDhVuNJpaz9g.text: Stunning and DELICIOUS! What an beautiful place, very friendly and helpful staff, very very clean. We ordered the family style chicken dinner and both jarred desserts (Red Oreo Velvet and Hummingbird cake) OMG our entire dinner was delicious, worth every dime and fast excellent service. Dying to try the biscuits and gravy next.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tjHKEsu5ovOt-n22u6R1Kg.text: Colleen was our cashier/server she is very nice and helpful. Nice cool spot in southern highlands. Who doesn't like chicken and waffles ??? The spot itself is pretty small (sucks to come on a busy day). Service is good. Food is humongous SHARE SHARE SHARE !!!!! Everything is seasoned and taste great. Some items came out cold that's the only reason I can't give full 5. But who cares it still got ate. Self seating but you do have to order at the register. Oh yes if you don't eat pork beware the greens have pork in them :(

Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breast chicken &amp; waffles . Soft scramble eggs with cheese

IL46-lyp06mSBt001wdarg.text: I order from them a lot  mostly to go and grub hub but when I come in to eat the employees are so sweet and helpful. The food is delicious  this has become me favorite restaurant near my house.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the decoration

pMvezNYYfq1NYYeRMvmOTA.text: Every time I go here it's a long wait the food is never cooked right in someway if they find to cheat you like not even filling up your macaroni and cheese all the way after you pay five dollars for it I hate this place and will never go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You pay five dollars for this and they give you one scoop don&#39;t even fill it up.

SfAfJTcu3syK3bh7DXGmDQ.text: Very home like feel and very welcoming. As soon as you walk in your ready for southern home cooking. We had the everything biscuit w/side of mac and cheese, the chicken sandwich w/fries mixture of regular and sweet potatoes, chicken tenders and 2 piece chicken thighs with the apple Dixie Cole slaw. The apple slaw had some pineapple which gave it a light airy taste was a very good compliment for the perfectly fried chicken thighs. The mac and cheese had a cheddar taste which was only present as an after taste. I wish it had more cheesy taste this is the only reason it has 4 stars.

yMx_yEQcEKcMO0q8sBYxeA.text: We were looking for a restaurant nearby that served breakfast all day & came across Mama Bird. We ended up ordering the fried chicken & smoked pork belly. The pork belly was one of the best I've ever had! The chicken was so moist and crispy. We also got the strawberry ginger beer and I honestly want to just buy a whole bottle of that and keep it in my fridge. Plus our server Raheem was very nice. Overall, great southern food and southern hospitality! Definitely coming back!

p3LaTRIxb7Kdl803MOk0UQ.text: We tried the restaurant for the first time. Initial opinion was good. We were greeted immediately and were given suggestions on what to order. Cashier was friendly and helpful. Then a quick downhill after this. As we waited for food we went to get a glass of water only to find it empty. Food arrived. Chicken waffle sandwiches and a two piece thigh plate. Waffle sandwiches were ok warm not hot. Next the thigh plate. Cutting into the chicken it was greasy, warm and under cooked. Mostly breading. The chicken skin was thicker than the chicken. And not fully cooked. The biscuit was hard as if it had sat in the air a long time. Next the water was refilled and we eagerly filled our glasses only to taste warm tap water. Really disappointed in the quality and the price. Our 3 meals with ice tea was over $50. Sorry to say we will not return.

9mmO8BsAEECBmVTzqkUgzA.text: This place is the best southern place. from the food to the people, i dropped my chicken and he straight up made me a new one  i'll be back .. super good food

wA0N_HvpvWvW0PMNpq0bbg.text: My husband and I LOVE this place!! Friendly staff and great food!  The chicken is so tender, you can cut it with your fork and the watermelon lemonade is delicious and refreshing!  We are so happy this spot is close to home--we have been here twice in 3 weeks!

uKr0gAqYlAzcHA1obZlzuQ.text: Just ordered food to go and it's really good. I was pleasantly surprised at how big the tenders are. Nice and juicy!! The bbq sauce is a perfect sweet and spicy combo.

aUzHY47h2WB8agbrmgfXzg.text: Excellent food! Ordered the biscuits and gravy meal which was a large portion. The everything biscuit was one of the best biscuits I've ever had. Customer service was top notch and the restaurant was clean. Will definitely be coming back to try more of the menu

KHzna3xCPz2gzxr-F8PXSw.text: We ordered Mama Bird takeout and loved everything we got! Kids loved it, we loved it, and we can't wait to explore more of the menu. We got a boneless fried breast meal, boneless thigh meal, fried bologna and cheese sandwich, deviled egg salad, the house made ginger beer, and the Oreo red velvet cake! Everything was absolutely amazing! We ate all of it! I definitely want to try the breakfast or ribs next. We will definitely definitely order again!!!!!

W9fZM3-rY5BmhNJ0vKV2rg.text: Bomb food. Gotta try the watermelon soft serve! Excellent service and Bryan is the man.

tAZNY80mtUdcqASws8N7kg.text: Great food! Definitley try the white cheddar grits and salt and pepper smoked brisket. Very friendly staff and nice atmosphere.

pLlfP6ue1DR9nbQfX6g5_A.text: Amazing, cute new restaurant located in the Southern Highlands Marketplace! Full review coming soon - hopefully Mama Bird paves the way for chef driven independent restaurants in this upscale community. We need an Atelier Crenn please...

uckKa0hnEIjnVwI2jM4kSQ.text: Unbelievable ribs and biscuits are amazing! Needed a quick bite after visiting the lion habitat in Henderson on my way back to the strip. Mama birds was an amazing find in a strip mall. For delicious Southern BBQ come and get it! Casual ambience and quiet on a Sunday afternoon but the food really hit the spot. Need to come back to try the brisket and chicken plus all the sides I didn't have room for, I am sure they are great too!

308uTNX5wf60g_4vAT2wQQ.text: Where's the chicken??!!! All crust, no meat. Collard greens and coleslaw were fine but I was dismayed to find there was hardly any chicken to eat under all that fried crust. Too bad as the options are few in this neighborhood.

ssJVsbgzgeS12dwwePN7Uw.text: I received excellent food and excellent service from Mama Bird this past weekend when I catered my twin sons' 21st birthday party at my house.  The ribs, brisket and collard greens received the highest praise from my guests.  Their food portions are generous so I had plenty of food. I feel like the value for the money was very fair. The service was top notch...delivered to my home on time with the chaffing dishes and all.  I will definitely cater from Mamma Bird in the future.  It's good to have really good Southern cooking so close to my home.

44uFnvL2Nqy9G9nD9WbdUg.text: Food was really great, service is a complete mess. Ordered a chicken waffle salad and a bologna sandwich with a side of macaroni and cheese. Food took a little while to be served, and did not receive the Mac and cheese. Told the counter we did not receive the side and they said they would bring right out. 15 mins later no Mac and cheese. Go back to counter to remind them. The hostess then takes the Mac and cheese to the wrong table and gives them 2 jars of dessert as an apology. We go back to the counter and say still haven't gotten. When she realized she took it to wrong table she said omg let me get my manager. Didn't even explain to her manager what happened. And all the place did was give us the cost of the Mac and cheese back, but the wrong table got dessert on top of it all. Again, good food but not worth the complete lack of service.

j-s7voPghLwfYxfzUHho8A.text: This place is criminal. Just when I thought it couldn't get any better the next bite would blow my mind. Damn near the best bbq I've ever had for a great price! My boyfriend and I split the brisket and ribs combo, and it was perfect for both of us. Great customer service, clean bathrooms, great food. This place is a must try! Bring your appetite.

SOKJ4XA_0mI6o4KnFqTlaQ.text: This chicken will make you believe in God and bless America. You KNOW I like my chicken fried, and the mac is pretty bomb too.

ar-fmbUzkUSF5XiNZHBkug.text: We just finished breakfast and the Fried Chicken and Waffle was amazing.  The chicken was hot and crispy and we loved the cornmeal batter.  The waffle was light and fluffy.   We also had Pecan Smoked Pork Ribs, which literally fell off the bone.  They had three sauces to try, and we really liked their traditional, which was not too sweet and not to spicy - just the right amount of both for this Midwesterner!  And they had a green verde sauce with tomatillos and peppers which was unique and went well with everything...the chicken, ribs and collards.  3 outdoor tables and chairs were just added yesterday, which makes it a perfect place for a relaxing Sunday morning breakfast spot!

cq_qReIQ5m6Hs6N6LcC9lA.text: Amazing. I got the 5 piece Tenders. So much chicken and very tender. My wife got the Brisket sandwich, I stole a bite and was even better. Will be back.

FeYbCIWBnRVqQfC5Gy3Q-w.text: Staff not very friendly...The biscuits were hard and dry and the over easy eggs I was given had broken yolks.  On a positive note - The ice tea was good!

HdimX4AtblqtgLQZT5H6Rg.text: Best brisket I've had anywhere. Super friendly and the food is phenomenal. The everything biscuit is awesome! This is our new favorite place and we look forward to many more visits!

m3DkMoB7-OR5aipWNFEwog.text: Found this restaurant by accident a couple of weeks ago when we came to Smith's to get some last minute things needed for Thanksgiving. To say this is a hidden gem is an understatement. My husband ordered the chicken fried with fries, I ordered the brisket with collard greens, our kids had chicken tenders one with fries and other with Mac and cheese. EVERYTHING was amazing and delicious. We loved the homemade biscuits, sweet tea, and great hospitality. We live all the way in Anthem Highlands and are willing to drive all the way to Southern Highlands for this place.

Wf9PjWnXEfvSc1UTLQXDwA.text: I got my Thanksgiving dinner, and it was amazing! They said it would feed 4-5. And it would have fed at least 7. I will get my holiday meals here from now on

xp5Q7mYA_-UiKS8P1R54hQ.text: Will definitely be back to this adorable restaurant! Ryan greeted us as we came in and talked us through the menu and brought a glass of the delicious watermelon lemonade complete with  a huge slice of watermelon!  Ordered the Wicked Deviled Eggs, Salt and Pepper Brisket Grilled Cheese Sandwich and the Brisket platter with grits! All DELICIOUS!!

plKQnGfGqiY33G2mQ6ThjA.text: Great tasting food, but the front end needs to organize itself in terms of communicating with customers and with other staff. We ordered deviled eggs, green beans, fried chicken, brisket, grits and mac and cheese. All tasty and the meat is juicy. But the drinks took forever to get. Great concept, but again organized staff would made the experience better.

5dCWQMXsfYmDY_DvWGHB5w.text: Awesome place! Love coming here. Brisket is the best and the customer service is always on point. Would recommend to anyone who loves BBQ!

ysqA5nnCSUtllHT3ztLczw.text: This is our first time here and we will definitely be back. Delicious food with a great atmosphere.  Thank you Ashley for the great service.

mKEHlVAckbi92b2gUTST3w.text: Staff is super friendly and great menu! Sweet tea is delicious :) They offer some really good sounding craft sodas and Ginger Beers as well. Great atmosphere too.

83jX28LG3qakBScRvpv6JQ.text: Amazing comfort food with real southern appeal. One of my go to places. The chicken is amazing, brisket and ribs are some of the best I have had and the ginger beer is a great change to the blah of standard soda offerings.

hbaFM2OQaSuZXsbq8lL08Q.text: Super good sweet tea and fried chicken was super yummy and perfectly cooked. The everything biscuits are also delicious.

4TfPpllMzINUTVt1OPp1TA.text: The food was bursting w flavor! Prep and delivery time was great! The meal was filling and I will definitely be eating here w the family again

KvErqMjk7868Wbv8lZoUQA.text: Limited menu.  Expensive for what you received.  I ate breakfast there.  I thought the menu was rather limited for me.  Not a big soul food Southern-style eating.  Decor was very cute.  If you like grits, fried chicken and waffles this is the place for you!

-XnnjaE_p1EfAPRuoWVVuQ.text: My new favorite restaurant! Home cooked southern comfort food! Watermelon sorbet! Candied jalapeno deviled eggs! Definitely will be a best of las vegas! Oh and watermelon lemonade!

7Y4S2HPRL2CSUBSLyTTv6A.text: This place is AMAZING!! You won't find food like it anywhere else in Vegas. Since it opened I cannot stop coming- their everything biscuits & gravy and chicken & waffles are TO DIE FOR! Pricing is very reasonable, portions are HUGE and quality is phenomenal!

y726asZ684_fvql__jDBNA.text: Super cool eatery in Southern Highlands! A must try! Interesting and yummy menu items!

0rVSlS1i5yFFfg5nOpscpw.text: Really cute atmosphere and friendly employees. We got the brisket and ribs plate with Mac n cheese and cole slaw. It was plenty of food for my husband son and I with a little leftover and it was delish!! Really great ribs! BBQ sauce was really good. We will be back!

SrK6k49zlEfPKGuNZU6Xag.text: I love everything here ! We usually order delivery but decided to come in this afternoon and the food was just as good and the customer service was even better it's such a nice atmosphere and clean ! Their food is so good everything has their own little twist on items & watermelon is always a must and always so juicy and fresh !!

M5KPNR2W4yUAH0czCa2Dsg.text: So excited to finally try this new local spot! Ribs, deviled eggs and Mac and cheese so delicious:) Ryan so awesome!

81h1eioQeVRZOBmGzM1opA.text: On our way home from Las Vegas and found this gem. The chicken tenders for kids meals and the fried chicken and waffles were definitely worth the short drive from the freeway. The batter was so light and crispy and crumbled in your mouth with the juicy chicken. The watermelon lemonade and soft serve are also a must!

WYP_1aottSA1tINuhdIP5Q.text: First time having Mama Bird and it was amazing! The service and food were excellent hands down some of the best southern food I have had out here. The collard greens were mouth watering!!! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves southern cooking !!'

WkzxWWOjX6z1b8Kj2KRDOw.text: Delicious food! Nice addition to the Southern Highlands community.  Highly recommend the grilled cheese w/ smoked brisket!

Rr8DslPFyYl8K5WJljROjA.text: My 10 year old daughter gives Mama bird a 5 stars for there delicious brisket and macaroni &cheese . It's a must see

ynuFJ-5xG4tUsS7593-TOg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place! Stumbled upon it after leaving the grocery store. I'm visiting Vegas for a couple of days and this is definitely a place to visit again and again!! I had the chicken thighs with a side of Mac and yum-me! Hubby got the pecan smoked spare ribs - so tender. If you've never been here, get here!!!!!! We're only here for a couple of days but we're already hooked. My chicken is CRUNCHY on the outside and juicy on the inside. Oh, and I forgot to mention the collards. They're so good. Food is fresh, so there's a little bit of a wait after ordering but that's how you can tell quality. Totally worth every second. After paying the bill, we came back to buy a bottle of the strawberry ginger and the jalapeno ginger drink. Can't wait to use them as mixers. Very refreshing even without alcohol.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 Slab Pecan Smoked Spare Ribs and Mac with Everything Biscuit with Honey Butter.
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Collard Greens. So deliciously flavorful!!!!
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another pic of the Boneless Thigh Chicken Plate

StnogxLHhCxJT-eB3JeCIQ.text: EAT HERE!!!!! My husband and I ate here for breakfast. Got the chicken and waffles, and pit master scramble. Very good. For me though, star of the show, the chicken wings! Only served three days a week, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday you have the opportunity to taste wings at their best! Marinated, smoked, and battered in delicious goodness. They're served with sauces, but truly do not need a drop. They are beautifully smoked with the perfect amount of spices, and fried to crispy perfection. Don't miss out! Can't wait to go back to try a plate of barbecue! Hats off to the pit master!

ydvngSamd-dml8K-XufZQQ.text: I'm sitting in this restaurant right now. My lunch was so ridiculously good that I felt compelled to write a review immediately... and I haven't written a review in ages. I got the brisket grilled cheese and LAWDY. Order it. Just order it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m9mqfFAUpEWW-YPxiQr6Mg.text: Mama Bird was DELICIOUS! Tried it for the first time yesterday and tried literally about everything. We had the chicken two piece plate with a side of coleslaw, the coleslaw was so fresh and had apples in it (so good), the deviled eggs (with bacon, and pickled jalapenos), fried green beans, pimento cheese, biscuits, and we also had their waffled chicken sandwich with Mac and cheese (incredible).  For drinks we had their homemade ginger beer, again DELICIOUS!   Before I forget if you want real fried chicken, this is the place to go!

aptlfdpVpHhHGorL0LDuFQ.text: Has been on my "go to" list for awhile. Glad we decided to!  Staff was very friendly and helpful, cute decor and amazing food. We saw additional flyers about their chicken wing specials and waffles. We definitely want to go back for breakfast and see how their country friend steak is.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy grits
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet cream corn and Mac and cheese
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boneless fried chicken (breast and thigh)

Ej44r-oVFIOCGb8xsw-yyA.text: Great food.  Big portions.  I'll be back for sure.  Chicken was delicious.  The deviled eggs were yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J70ZRk-SvHvmhbyodk3ZmQ.text: Secret gem you would never expect to have such amazing food. Located in the Southern Highland plaza, you'll find an amazing restaurant called Mama Bird.  Southern-styled menu, they have everything from Ginger Flavored Beers, Ribs, Fried Chicken, Brisket and awesome drink and appetizers. The portions are amazing, you definitely get what you pay for and then some! Was not disappointed whatsoever. && to finish it off, from them being a Southern-Styled Restaurant, they definitely have that Southern Hospitality!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs &amp; Brisket Plate w/ Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled Eggs!

NIHltHhuR5P2xoQsV2uq5Q.text: Good ol home cooking here.  Get the biscuit, mac & cheese, and chicken.  Had to travel here from the northwest.

LDtJ2k3Je8xZgk98W2AMFg.text: My coworkers and I have been waiting for this place to open since we work in the same plaza as Mama Bird. Excited to have an option other than burritos and tacos to eat in the plaza.  Of course they were busy on opening day but from the time I ordered to the time I picked up was very fast and the food was fresh. They also give discount if you work in the same shopping center! Decor is cute and staff were friendly/welcoming. As well as the owner.  First time I ordered the chicken thigh meal. Second time, I ordered chicken and waffles. The chicken was nice and crisp on the outside, juicy inside and not too greasy but I feel it needed more flavor. The mac n cheese was cheesy and creamy but needed more flavor as well. Coworker also agrees. The third time I went, I ordered shrimp and grits which was pretty good but very small portion for the price. Overall everything was good.   Their menu is a little on the pricey side. But I will continue to be a customer whenever i'm craving :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Thigh Meal w/biscuit &amp; Mac n Cheese
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

HOJnPqTey17qYfp_ItySoA.text: Absolute best and most creative BBQ spot in the Las Vegas metro area. Food is phenomenal, atmosphere is fantastic. Zach provides an an amazing overall experience. Definite must try!

Wd4y7KlWEknB5CuW7Ie-8w.text: Excellent food!!  Great service!! Mac n cheese to die for!  Good southern food and friendly staff make this a cute but wotrhy place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent food!! Great service!!

T8QClqV1Xgwcg5pLP4ydGg.text: This was an awesome find.  The chicken tenders were the best I have ever had and big.  The breading is light and delicious.  The deviled eggs were very tasty as well.  A very friendly and personable staff.  I will definitely go back when we return.

60-2U_sYI7gaLP8C-Rfq5w.text: Best Brisket West of New York! My new favorite BBQ in town. Great job Liam and team! The Southern Hospitality was not forgotten.

kiQ_y8lGdIXjJBzO6tg3Kw.text: What a great place!  Went for breakfast and enjoyed every aspect.  The food and service were both amazing.  We had the biscuits and gravy and the chicken and waffles. Highly recommend both.  Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4GWl86pCr2d5_S0rKG43Pg.text: The ambiance is very nice and welcoming. Had the chicken and waffles which were very good and very filling. Eggs were also cooked perfectly. Great size portion for someone who is really hungry. Service was also attentive and friendly right when you walk in the door. Will come back if Im in Vegas again!

S6aATGVMhIKbvYzwzLCCLA.text: So first off, this place has the best Mac & cheese I've ever had at a restaurant. I've tried the ribs, fried chicken breast, fried chicken thighs, greens, mac & cheese, everything biscuit, jalapeno ginger beer, & their red velvet cake jar. This is my new favorite food splurge! I got a wrong delivery once from Door Dash, & they personally brought me my order.   Reasons it's so great: -authentic BBQ -smoked ribs  -spice on the fried chicken batter  -flaky biscuits with honey butter! -THE BEST MAC & CHEESE   Plus it's in the neighborhood I grew up in!  Try it out!

S6nj43RydGmdE5NMewj3og.text: This place is amazing! Food and service is top notch. The everything biscuits ARE everything. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BIY_XLxwM9d_Fm04Xp1tFw.text: O.M.G. This place is amazing. The food is incredible and the people are friendly. I highly recommend the watermelon soft serve to wrap up your meal.

LgiypvWBKw4zfbt13OBc3Q.text: This is probably my favorite breakfast, southern style restaurant of all time. My girlfriend Shay agrees. Small but service great and food was amazing.

Dyvb98u9aNTS2lRXCY-fsQ.text: Based on what I had,  the deviled eggs will be a lot better if it was served with crispy, hot bacon.  Instead It came with soft soggy bacon.  The chicken and waffles I had was delicious.  The chicken was crunchy, moist and juicy.  Cooked perfectly.  The waffles were made to my preference which is lightly crisp on the exterior with a light and fluffy interior.  All in all.  Pretty good.  Service was kinda slow and the woman working the tables came off a bit rude.  Don't expect customers to tip when you have a shitty personality as the face interacting with your customers.

2F6H9de81ovLgrWfa0lSgw.text: I went in intrigued by the sign for watermelon soft serve. Kids were with me and already had lunch but wanted something so I ordered a plain grilled cheese/fries meal. It's supposed to be brisket grilled cheese but I have picky eaters. I'm just shocked I paid $6.95 (plus tip) for half of a grilled cheese and about 10 fries. Watermelon soft serve was ok. The menu looks so good and I had planned on going back to sit down for a meal but now I just think it's way overpriced.  In response to the owner comment. My point was I didn't even get the brisket so maybe make a full sandwich or charge less? The staff was friendly but could have recognized this and accommodated.  I greatly appreciate your understanding. That's honestly all I wanted. I will look forward to dining in and trying some menu options.

FKb-7hRgIqAApOCsYL2qxQ.text: So...First time here.  Had the pleasure to meet the owner and his girlfriend, Zach and Krista, spelled wrong I am sure!  The place was clean, comfortable and smelled amazing!     Wood burning smell.   ahhh..  The wait staff was also super friendly, MJ and Sabrina were their names and I think Ryan was the cook...   All very friendly...   So, Im trying to lose weight so I can meet my fave actress in a few weeks and Im pretty unhappy with my looks--I have lost 19 pounds so I asked for no meat with my mama's pan fried breakfast--Just eggs, hashbrowns and a biscuit and I also got a watermelon lemonade.  Delicious all around!        They also were able to give me extra eggs instead of the meat, The hash is amazing, its veggies like lima beans, peppers and corn with perfectly cooked potatoes..  the lemonade comes with a nice piece of watermelon and is cool and refreshing.     The biscuit is AMAZING...It comes with butter than I didnt even need to use!   So flavorful..  My ex took me there because I do not have a car and wanted to try it, I got him a lemonade as well which he loved and the hungry beef brisket, the ONLY reason I am giving them a 4 star review is because the HUNGRY brisket is only 4-5 pieces...Id be afraid of what the plenty brisket is--Be aware of that, its $22 for 5 pieces...and a small side of mac & cheese...  We usually go to Big B's and for the same price get a 3 meat combo w/2 sides and bread!     Portion sizes is actually making my ex run out to another place for a burger or something and we probably wont return even though it was good...    :/       I will be honest, my ex isnt HUGE, He is average and so are most of the people around and he is super hungry still, I would be too.   oh well, thanks for the experience!

Didn't even realize by the name and look of this place was an amazing hidden southern style gem !  Walking in also makes you wonder.. this place really serves deviled eggs and bbq brisket here !? Definitely a new meaning to a wow factor..   Ordered me the salt and pepper smoked brisket with a small side of sweet cream corn.. even though it was "small" it was a good enough portion for me and was well balanced with the brisket.. although I can eat.. i did have some of my wife's chicken and waffles.. which was also amazing!! But let's talk brisket.. soft as ever and ever so melting in my mouth meaning it was cooked perfectly for me.. it came with some bbq sauce and some butter.. and knowing how to eat southern food.. i put that butter on everything!! The onions and pickles on it was delicious!! (Wish they had put more!! - hint hint) and the bbq sauce just made it over the top!!   I can't wait to try out the other things they have on the menu..   ENJOY!

kQvH3gBmkANo_eJ7ujNi6Q.text: Cousins live not too far from here and told the story of the "wait."   They've been waiting for this place to open, open, OPEN! And when it finally did, cousins ended up coming through for the first time with GodNiece and I... 3 months later.  Walked in on a Friday lunch and my party of 4 were the only customers. Decor is new and modern, a nice southern homely feel to it. We were nicely greeted by the cashier and since it was all our first, he did a quick rundown on how it's done. (Order up front and food will be delivered at the table you choose.)   The deviled eggs is supposedly a must try, so we got a couple of orders of those. For an entree, I got the chicken fried steak (gravy served on the side) and a thigh (since we GOTTA try the bird, right?!)   Deviled eggs were okay. (Yes, JUST okay.) If anything, the bacon elevated the taste (as it would any dish) but mediocre at best.   The side of fried chicken thigh was much better. Crunchy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. The brine and batter is what really makes each bite. We all shared bites from this one piece and we collectively agreed we liked it. Definitely getting a chicken plate next time.   The chicken fried steak was bigger than I expected. (They did not go cheap on the meat.) The batter is similar (if not the same) as the chicken. Not necessarily a bad thing since it was still delicious. The gravy had perfect level of thickness and seasoning. The plate would have been close to perfect EXCEPT for the river of oil swimming on top of my eggs. It was a bit of a turnoff. I had to use my one napkin to wipe it off (see attached picture.)   FOOD: 3.5. Made to order is always a PLUS.  SERVICE: 4 VALUE: 5 PARKING: Shared with other businesses including a grocery store, but not an issue. You're bound to find plenty of spots open.  OVERALL: 4.   Great first run. Good recommendation by cuzzos!

BawXvYHtuycAXPFzLdVlLw.text: Came into Mama Bird with a group of friends looking to check out the new venue. Cute little place. Was set on getting the chicken thighs but then when they ran out on the order before me I was sad. I like dark meat so that's what I had been dreaming about ordering. Ended up ordering the 3 piece chicken tenders with a side of creamed corn. One of my other diners ordered the coleslaw & we shared. I am glad they ran out of the thighs! When I saw them be delivered to one of my dining mates I had to giggle as they were pretty small & the tenders I ended up with were enough for 2 meals. Everything biscuits were great. Loved the creamed corn. Felt the cloeslaw needed a bit of seasoning. The chicken was extremely tender & the batter just the right amount of crisp.   My only bit of concern was while I was waiting for other diners to arrive I watched the waitress wiping off tables but the wash bucket was sitting on the floor next to the cabinet where water glasses are kept & everyone walks past to get to the restrooms or the pop dispenser. While waiting I did get up to use the restroom & walked past the bucket & it was filthy water. I understand wanting to keep the bucket handy but maybe inside the cabinet is a better option so people don't throw things into the bucket as they pass or just in general things floating in the air don't drop into it. It's been awhile since I've been in there so hopefully this has been addressed.   Overall really liked this place & Zach did a great job keeping everything rolling while we were there & tending to other patrons as well as our group. Look forward to going back again!

mlzYS9W0aCwE9QdmfA6NWw.text: SUPER EXCITED about this place!  We grabbed quite a few things to try and nothing disappointed.   Watermelon lemonade and sweet tea are delicious.  Chicken was seasoned and perfectly cooked.  Collard greens and Mac n cheese were yum!  Seriously no complaints.    I'm also that person that doesn't like smoked things so I was hesitant to try the wings.  But being a wing lover, I had to do it.  They're delicious and probably the only smoked things I've ever loved!   Excited to come back and try all the things.

CthQvo134sgOYG079v4WFw.text: Super cute local spot.love the rustic country theme with a little corky chic flair. Small but just enough seating and they have a cute little private booth in the back for like 6-8 small adults.   The menu is so intriguing I want to eat everything.  From Pimento cheese, chicken and waffle with Mac and cheese sandwich to ribs and shrimp and grits.   Momma Bird has all the comfort food to hit all the right spots!   Devil eggs were bomb and the candies jalapenos was really good. Bacon is not super crispy but very good.  Gravy and Everything biscuits with the side of honey butter and smoked sea salt was unexpectedly mind blowing. The gravy was killer had a thick yet runny texture which is hard to describe you just need to taste it to know what I'm talking about and the flavor Yummmm! The biscuit tho flaky buttery not just PERFECT!   The fried chicken and waffles is one of the best that I've had. Waffles were cool right with great density.  The dill ranch is so bomb was not sure about it but it's thick and it's good.   But what really stole the show for my was the Brisket Grill cheese we got off the kids menu. I had to steal that from my 3 year old. It was eyes roll to the. Ack of your head good.   All in all everything is finger licking good and like I said the food here hits all the right spots!!!

QkCPX2TE4ArLM17dY7F7-g.text: 5 stars all around from the moment we walked through the doors...we were greeted asked if we dined with them before and given a menu, we were advised of the menu and what are favorites for customers, I loved the decor (I'm big on vibes and this place definitely has it!) we ordered the deviled eggs (let me just say I've never had candied jalapeno and it was good) I ordered the chicken and waffles (I couldn't even finish due to the plate being so filling) with a side of Mac n cheese (I always have to try Mac n cheese where ever I go) and it was delicious!  My husband had the brisket hash with eggs and a biscuit... everything was delicious and definitely served on time...when in Vegas do try out Mama Bird you will not be disappointed

7Njwn6Ios_Eg3IeSkXyd-A.text: From the Southern places I've been to in Vegas, this place blows them out of the water. I really feel like I'm not exaggerating by calling this the best Southern food I've had out here by quite a wide margin.   Food: 5/5  Can we give it up for them for having Cheerwine? I haven't seen this anywhere in years! It was like running into an old friend, catching up on years past, and introducing it to my husband. His response was that he wouldn't drink any other soda if given the opportunity.   We had greens and cheese grits for sides. Both are fantastic! Clearly someone from the South made these sides. Sure enough, she was from New Orleans. When I wanted to decide which side, they let me sample the greens. There was pride handed to me with those greens, and there should have been.    The fried chicken is fantastic! Clearly on another level from most restaurants.... and let me not leave out the fact that they were nice enough to let us sample the sauces. All of them are great. My husband said that the Mama's Comeback reminded him of restaurant quality version of Cane's sauce. Hot Damn is made with ghost peppers, but it wasn't super hot to me. BBQ was solid. The Sweet Heat was my surprise pick for something I didn't think I'd like but did. The ranch is on another level here. Clearly made in house as they all are, but it's the first time I started to understand the ranch hype. Wow!  It was like "Oh, this is what ranch is supposed to taste like."  The biscuit and maple butter was great! But the red velvet Oreo cake in a jar was amazing. Easily added to my favorite desserts in Vegas top 3.   Service: 5/5 They were so nice and accommodating!   Cleanliness: 5/5  When we were here, it was very clean, and tables were cleared quickly.  Decor: 5/5 Very homey feel, which I feel fits. It's more home cooking than restaurant-y. It's like your auntie that can cook made the food more than a chef. If that your idea of good eats, you'll love it.

gYRS2h9yrUs308bjMU_ZgQ.text: Ok, I have a strict rule to not give a location a Yelp review if they ask for it.  But this is the ONE time I'm making an exception.  (And no, I did NOT take the feee ice cream bribe.) We started with the deviled eggs.  They should be called "Slap-Your-Grandma-Amazing eggs"!  Incredible!  I had the chicken sandwich with fries. The chicken was so well seasoned and oh so juicy!  My wife had the brisket grilled cheese, and she really enjoyed it!  The fries (perfectly fried and a mixture of crinkle-cut and sweet potato) had the most delectable seasoning!  And the dipping sauce?  YES PLEASE!  The sun tea and watermelon lemonade were also a real hit!  The price leaned toward the too pricey side of things, but the decor was homey and cute, the service was fantastic, and the food was incredible!  Go check it out!

0sF00Vn74ZN6g7eBR9Jn-g.text: I don't write a lot of reviews, when I do it really means something triggered me, not necessarily in the positive way. First of all I got setoff of how our order was taking, the waitress rudely stopped taking my order half way and turn her face away to her trainee, spoke to her for like 2 min explaining how things works, just left me stood there. 2ndly, we ordered coffees, it took them 15min brought out the coffee, after me reminding them at least that's what we could have whiling awaiting our food, but it came the worst part, 3 and half cups of cold coffee, literally! I asked the trainee is that how they typically serve breakfast coffee, she said sorry and she did not know coffee was cold, unbelievable.   After a while they realized I got pissed off and start to stop by to check things. All I am saying is it's a 4 and half stars place, it could have been way better than that for its service. No complain at all against the food, I hope my review helps to ones plan to stop by this place.

Their deviled eggs are awesome and the sausage gravy for the biscuits and chicken fried steak is Divine. Speaking of the chicken fried, the chicken is moist and tasty, while the breading is nice and crispy. Will need to definitely plan more stops here to eat my way through the menu

MVNcDGbXFx_nYNKIztIbJA.text: Our first time trying out Mama Bird, I think it was their fifth official day opened. It's a quick service so you order up front and a couple tables inside that you can seat at. We ordered the 3 chicken tenders with a side of cream corn and the brisket with a side of mac and cheese. The chicken tenders were tasty the breading had lots of flavor but the breading was a tad too thick maybe that it kept crumbling off the chicken, I still ate the crumbles off my plate though it was that good so I won't dock any stars for that. The cream corn was amazing I think it's my favorite dish. My husband had the brisket, that was melt in your mouth like butter, I kept stealing bites of his plate. The mac and cheese was good, it didn't blow my mind but it was a great side for the brisket. Now the everything biscuit is where we get serious - this is the best biscuit I've ever had, it has everything seasoning on it and the biscuit had cheese in it and it is huge! I did like the honest butter that came with it but I wish the honey was in butter so I would get an even ratio of both again this is just me nitpicking so I'm not taking off any stars for this neither. For dessert we got the watermelon soft serve, it was so refreshing and great for summer especially in this heat! We also got the Oreo red velvet cake in a jar, it was good but a little too rich for me, but my husband who loves sweets finished it all so that's that. Good price point for southern food, we will be back to try the ribs next time!

FWVNemJWS4NSzm8i0k3Ggw.text: First impression's are everything. I've never been a fan of walking into an establishment and seeing employees sitting at tables on their phones.  I was to quick to recognize it wasn't just an employee but I'm assuming a manager of some kind due to the fact he was telling employees as they walked in to get clocked in and sign in.   With that aside the food was ok, not great but ok. It was ready pretty fast but just really lacked flavor. Defiantly not worth the prices that are reflected on the menu.
