2geVlrQ8d96EV__MeQNgKA.text: It's always when I enter with high expectations that I'm disappointed...  Mama Bird is adorable. It reminds me of the vibe of Truffles n Bacon. It's a small restaurant that could easily be found in Brooklyn. They're counter service only, and the service each dish as it's ready.  I decided to try the Mac and cheese chicken tender waffle sandwich. The Mac and cheese was easily the best part of this dish. If I had ordered just that, I would have been happy. I was extremely disappointed when the sandwich was ready and I noticed some sort of sauce on it. I don't like almost any condiments, and this was not in the sandwich description. This meant that I had to wipe off parts of the sandwich and take it apart. The chicken was okay. It tasted a little like Cane's. The waffle was super bland. I didn't even eat it.  I also ordered the biscuit, which was okay, but I wouldn't order it again. It needs to be a little fluffier and have more flavor. The butter on the side is really just butter with a drizzle of honey on it, not True honey butter.  My dining companion ordered the brisket grilled cheese. She loved it. Again, we didn't realize that the brisket was barbecued with sauce. I took a bite and instantly regretted it. She loves barbecue sauce, so she was happy. The bread on this sandwich was great!  Overall, I left feeling unsatisfied. I can't say I'll be back, but it might be a good place for some.

PIEoGMDZHwd4kTiFNiTOtg.text: This place blew me away with its amazing customer service and amazing break down of the menu items.  I had the Deviled Eggs, Brisket Sliders and MAC and cheese!  I couldn't be more full and content, the side of Mac and cheese was the icing on top of the cake and is a must. I will be returning to give the chicken wings that are marinated and smoked in house a shot!

csXVuvQ5UrWN8lbB-keWnQ.text: If you live local to this place and aren't yet a regular, you must not have tried it.   I had the bologna sandwich which was very good. The cheese kind of overpowered it and I was expecting the taste of the meat to come through more. Other than those small items, yummy.   Great friendly staff. Nice selection in the entrees, sides, and even drinks (I highly recommend the watermelon lemonade).

32rljyX_AU1JlDS1lmbvkA.text: Don't waste your time with this place, they don't care about customers in their building, they only care about their grub hub clientele. I was told my eggs were being prepared and then saw my eggs be given to a grub hub driver. Waste of time. Edit: It had nothing to do with "not fast enough for my liking", The guy told me he was getting my eggs ready and he did indeed get eggs ready and then gave them to the grub hub driver. My food was sitting right there, he put me aside for the grub hub and that's not the first time this happened at this establishment. Last time was about six months ago, I was sitting there dining In, my food took over forty minutes to get to me while I watched drivers walk in and out with their food, same driver different orders. Mama bird needs a kitchen JUST for grub hub take out, you may wait for nearly an hour while grub hub orders get filled. I tried it again today, as take out and I see it does not matter, Mama birds priority is not customers In the building, it's grub hub. Waste of time.

eYkEYNSuUkTSUIuoCfzoSw.text: Delicious food! Loved the ribs, wings, ans the waffle chicken mac n cheese sandwich. Friendly staff & clean restaurant.

CuSYgrJrSQ8o5AbC4Z8-Ow.text: Amazing service, and even better food! I had the chicken and waffles which was delicious. Everyone loved their food. Definitely try the biscuits, I never liked biscuits before until I tried them here (not pictured)!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken and Waffle Breakfast Platter Mac N&#39; Cheese Chicken Tender Waffle Sandwich

kDQ725rYlsFc5Z-3RK_neQ.text: It's been awhile since I lived in Las Vegas and I always loved supporting and going to local eateries. The last time I went to Vegas I had heard about a new local spot serving up southern comfort food. I made my way to Mama Bird, just a short 15 minutes from the Strip in Southern Highlands. Great for lunch after a long night of drinking or just to come and get a big meal. Portions are big and definitely order a few items to share and the staff is super friendly providing that southern hospitality.  We ordered the Salt & Pepper Brisket Grilled Cheese Sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich is served on Texas toast with pimento cheese and they don't skimp on the cheese, brisket or flavor! and the dipping sauce that comes with it is awesome. We also ordered the 2 piece friend chicken plate (you can get it with tenders, thigh meat or breast meat) and it comes with an everything buttermilk biscuit and your choice of side (we got the apple dixie cole slaw, although next time I want to try the Mac n cheese or white cheddar grits). The chicken was moist and the batter wasn't too thick as it is on other fried chicken I've had. For dessert you have to get the watermelon soft serve which is served between a watermelon slice.   Mama Bird is a great addition to the local flavor in Vegas. They also make their own hot sauces, teas and ginger beers. Will definitely have to try their BBQ plate next time I am in town. If you live in Vegas or just visiting, definitely check out Mama Bird for some down home southern comfort food. And if you don't feel like driving there, you can always get it delivered!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon soft serve
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 piece fried chicken plate with cole slaw
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt &amp; Pepper Brikset Grilled Cheese Sandwich with sweet potato fries

ROVGdwTAg2e8Byutrr2w-w.text: This place is awesomely delicious! Small but unique and very fulfilling plates! Can not wait to come back here and try something new. The deviled eggs were divine and the Mac and cheese chicken sandwich was perfectly presented.

3dSB4QUDPdGcYS8P8IKe1g.text: This has got to be the one of the best Boutique home style cooking & BBQ in Vegas.   I was told this is a must try so I wandered over to a part of town I don't usually Visit to take a crack at it.  We came hungry and that was a good thing and a bad thing because everything on the menu looked amazing because the place smelled amazing.  My GF and I decided to ask what they suggested and I'm glad we went with their suggestions so I would like to thank the staff about that.   The Hardest part was eating things in the traditional order of appetizer, main course then desert so I'm going to skip that part.  1. Wicked Deviled Eggs W/Candied jalapeno & Bacon:  The Candied Toppings are out of this world.  Ask them how much time they spend doing this and you will appreciate it that much more.   Next time I'm Ordering 6 instead of 4.  2. Mac N' Cheese Chicken Tender Waffle Sandwich & Side Of North & South Fries: ENORMOUS.  My GF loves anything Mac N' Cheese.  The Waffle part just added to it.   This was my favorite part of the meal as it was so large and my GF just went all in.  How she finished it all I have no idea.   3. Salt & Pepper Brisket Grilled Cheese Sandwich & a side of sliced Watermelon Soft Serve:  I can never turn down anything With Brisket And this is no exception.  It was Perfect balance of not to much salt fat or butter.  It was amazing.  If you enjoy Brisket you would love this but next time I may try the 12oz Brisket plate so I can enjoy even more of this tender cut of meat!  The Watermelon side I couldn't stay away from so I was having a bite off and on during my meal.  The Side Of Mac N' Cheese was so good.  I'm glad I ordered it so I could try it as my GF wouldn't share hers.  4. Liam's (Non-Alcoholic) Ginger Beer:  Ironically Liam was there so how could I say no to the guy in charge of creating the perfectly balanced and not to sweet or overpowering ginger beer beverage on a hot day.  His story on how he got it on the menu is great so if he's there feel free to ask.   I got the strawberry flavor so my GF could also enjoy so I got the large bottle to take home.  Next time I'm going with his favorite the jalapeno flavor! *You Get $1 off your next bottle if you return the Original Large Bottle  5. Hummingbird Cake Jar (Banana + Pineapple + Pecan + Coconut + Cream cheese Frosting): I'm so happy these are small because I couldn't stop eating it.  Not to sweet but sweet enough to satisfy my sweet tooth.    6. Oreo Red Velvet Cake Jar (Oreos + Chocolate Chips + Cream Cheese Frosting):  This was my GF's favorite part of the Meal that she devoured before we ate, talked or received our meal *Which Took about 5min. To get. (I purchased an extra one to take home, when you return the jar you get $.50 off the next purchase)  I can't wait To go back and try different Items.   100% worth the drive.  If you come here and have something that's a must try please let me know.  The place was extremely clean front to back including the restrooms.  It made me think this restaurant had just opened even though it has been open for a while.   Thanks again can't wait to return!  PS:  What I loved the most was the fact they don't use a lot of salt and nothing I ate was too overpowering.  I was full when I left but I felt fine, as I was expecting to be in a painful food coma because I ate so much.  Simply amazing for this type of food!!!

The deviled eggs were a suprise how tasty they were with the pickled jalapeno and bacon piece. We all order a different meal and they were all delicious. Great presentation and had plenty of leftovers.  I stongly recommend this place to anyone that loves southern food. We live on the North side of Las Vegas, but it was definitely worth the drive.

So it's been a few months since my last review and still nothing has changed. Nevertheless, I won't go back again. I've always given them 5 stars on the food and customer service, but this time my food was mediocre at best. I ordered the half slab of ribs and they were over cooked. I couldn't eat all of it because the meat was too tough. I waited about 55 mins for a pick up order and the fried green beans were lukewarm just like I suspected them to be. I did ask if my order had been sitting for a while, and I was reassured that it wasn't, but my food should have been a lot warmer considering that I only live 2 minutes away. I love the concept of this restaurant given that I'm southern and it's hard to find quality souther restaurants. Unfortunately, I've been let down too many times.

E5yttOHVK5ptswCSEySrKg.text: Amazing southern comfort food with great service! This quaint farm house style restaurant serves a variety of southern favorites including fried chicken, chicken & waffles, mac & cheese, brisket, ribs, and sandwiches. We stopped in for brunch today and as we walked in, we were immediately greeted by the friendly staff at the counter. I ordered the chicken & waffles with scrambled eggs and my boyfriend ordered the smoked brisket hash with over easy eggs. In addition, we ordered a small mac & cheese and an everything biscuit with honey butter to share. The restaurant is set up so that you order at the counter and seat yourself. Once we sat down, we were surprised how fast our food came out. We didn't even wait long at all. What also impressed us was the food. The portions are huge! We found everything to be extremely delicious and flavorful. I especially loved how the fried chicken was juicy yet crispy on the outside. My boyfriend also enjoyed his brisket hash.   I definitely have to agree that this place lives up to its Yelp reviews with their delicious food. The staff are courteous and always greets you with a smile. We will be back to try their other items on the menu.

f0MKrT84u4fHuJRdMjHrDg.text: Well two experiences. The first was when I went for dinner at the apparently very late hour of 8:15 only to find they were closed. 8 PM really? As ridiculous as that is I thought to try again. This time at the crazy late dinner time of 7:00 PM. Eager to try both the chicken and ribs I have heard good things about, I placed my rib order only to be told "we are all out of ribs and brisket". A proclaimed "Southern Kitchen" that's out of ribs and brisket?!?! Clearly these folks have never been to the south.  I hope to update my review once I can actually get food- I do hear it's tasty. Maybe on a weekend at noon.

YaC5Z2I2KaBZtXKtE98-fg.text: This was our first time here.  The fried chicken was nice and tender inside and crispy on the outside and tasted good. The waffle tasted good but it wasn't fluffy  and was a little soggy with just a slight crisp on the outside. The everything biscuit was very raw on the inside. We sent it back and it took so long for us to get a new one that it came back after we had already finished our breakfast and while we were eating our dessert so we took it to go.  The red velvet dessert was dry and tasted maybe like they use box cake mix but I could be wrong. The staff was very friendly. I would go back for the fried chicken.

DbGHdJmqyBxUwyj0JGGDqg.text: Wow what a breath of fresh air. Super cute, great atmosphere. The breakfast was so good we ordered lunch to go for a picnic later. My biscuits and gravy were excellent. My mom really enjoyed the apricot non alcoholic ginger beer.

IOgvnP7GYpyM0JMMP_GsKA.text: Well it's like coming home to mama's everything is homemade the whole restaurant is family owned they go out of their way to make it a wonderful experience and I truly truly love speaking with the owner I love hearing the back story of a restaurant I love to know how they struggled and had a dream to habit come True they really take their time on the food they really stick with down home recipes absolutely love the sweet tea thoroughly enjoyed having sweet tea again which is hard to find in this town.

UwmhpuwFVRRYmYX53G1XSw.text: Fantastic eatery; everything is made in-house and delicious. Some of the best fried chicken and mac and cheese I have had in a long time! But if you go, make sure to try the fried green beans; you won't regret it! They also have a great staff that provides friendly service.  Furthermore, I contracted Ma'ma Birds to cater my mother's wedding rehearsal dinner. They did an impeccable job. Food was the same high-standard as though we were eating in its dining room, delivery was right on time (plus or minus a minute), and it even gave us two complementary jugs of ginger beer. Staff assisted in the buffet setup and ensured we were satisfied with the product before leaving.   I would highly recommend their catering to anyone in the need thereof.

xb9PDHq9t8l5yfJR_udvxA.text: I had so many pretentious ways to start this review but In the end I'm just going to tell anyone who reads this that Mama Bird is the breakfast place you're looking for: large portions, crazy flavors, excellent service, and a pit master who brings you brisket chicharrons because he's cool like that.   Chicken fried steak is the measuring stick for a breakfast spot and they nailed it, gravy not too thick but still sumptuous and the thin steak breaded to perfection but not overly bready and dry. Smoked pork belly and a thin waffle to rival roscoes we're just some of the other options we took down today and everything was tremendously satisfying. I'm a very large man, the boy can eat, and I am STUFFED.   Get the sweet tea. Leave a review and get the free dessert cuz that's bomb too. Like everything is for real delicious. Southern cooking that's better than my own.

yFurivE61cdpgbhh0QNx9g.text: Mama Bird marks the third breakfast establishment to enter into the Southern Highlands area.  The reigning champ, Rise and Shine, is still King.   Mama Bird is order at the counter fast casual featuring southern comfort food.    Beautifully appointed in Southern Charm, but it lacked in flavor and is highest priced of all the breakfast places nearby.  Starting a restaurant isn't easy.  Having sold into the industry for a few years, I'm familiar with the operational side and the complexities of scouting locations and making a competitive bid for your breakfast dollar.    I don't think the owners thought it thAny other location and Mama Bird would have seen better success.  We ordered the chicken fried steak and the chicken in waffles.  I ordered my eggs over easy.  Bland gravy.  The chicken fried steak was poorly cooked and over done.  And it arrived without toast for the eggs.  I had to add it to the order for $2.71.  Two piece of toast for nearly $3.00, folks.  Let that sink in.  Here's something else - iHop chicken fried steak is much much better.  IHOP is better.  The chicken and waffles arrived with an over cooked waffle.  The waffle was hard.  For the overall cost of $45 including tip, it wasn't definitely not worth the cost or the experience.  Update:  Ok, so I just read Zach's response and I have to admit that it explains much.  The menu assumes a lot in understanding Southern cuisine - now it makes sense - mea maxima mea culpa.  Furthermore, it also takes a standup guy to respond to a critical review.  Hats off to you Zach, I always try for an honest review.  When I come back, I'll coordinate with you so you can walk me through the highlights.

nhQJVz9ddMVdQBR5sjUfPQ.text: Talk about straight LEGIT and tasty Southern food. I have been meaning to check this place out for sometime. The more pictures see the more items want all get in. I made sure brought my appetite post workout so could get in as much of the menu. Just me impressed waitress got it all in. Lol.  My first impression was for small restaurant the place has personality. The counter area soon as walk in interesting cause first think more of ramen/noodle shop. When look all around screams southern style from the tables and the interior decor. Counter area cool got to see magic happen with the food. The chefs in the back were friendly asking about food and engaging. Lot of times opposite. That area blessing cause when the place gets packed happens quick cause hold less 30 maybe. I liked all these jars on counter from desserts, signature candied jalapeno, or even sell dog treats. The lemonades and sweet teas fresh everyday. The watermelon lemonade was refreshing!  Food I ordered the Salt Pepper Brisket Grilled cheese sandwich. Also add fried egg off waitress recommendation. OMG. Not only was that great call. By far the best and creative grilled cheese sandwich ever! Not only did it have all of things love about grilled cheese sandwich. The brisket had ton of flavor, moist, and easy could have bowl of brisket be happy. U get some of that cream yolk porn perfect compliment all the flavors. The bread they use nice thick cuts. So so so good. The fries got mention combination sweet and crinkle cut beautiful. The dipping sauce addicting. Also got order Devil Eggs. The combination of savory bacon, candy jalapeno, filling, and perfect boiled egg. Seriously FULL yolk porn. Lol! Absolutely the best Devil Eggs in Vegas!!!!  The service five stars!! The moment walked in warm welcome, whole staff engaging, and True southern hospitality!

kZOdm8SQNbt25EEfQnJdTg.text: Yes, yes, yes. This is how you run a restaurant folks, other local restaurants take note.   Every detail here from the decor, staff, menu and of course the food, the delicious food was spot on!   This a casual spot where you sit anywhere you'd like, order and pay at the counter and they bring the food out to you when it's ready. There's a water station where you grab a glass and fill up your own water. We ordered way too much because everything looked so good and the prices were approachable.  The only teenie, tiny mistake here was lipstick on one of the water glasses but I know from working in restaurants and also wearing lipstick that this happens from time to time. Staff just needs to check for this when setting out the glasses.   But seriously everything else was awesome. Here's what we ordered and how we felt about it.   Deviled Eggs w/ candied jalapenos & bacon- A, will order again Spicy Green Beans- A- fried perfectly, not too spicy, good dipping sauce on the side, likely order again Collared Greens side- B+ good, I mean they're greens so if you feel like you need veggies in your life, get them, if not, order an extra biscuit instead Biscuit- A- homemade, baked perfectly, delicious, will order again Mac & Cheese- B+, cheesy, good, didn't blow me away but still good Pecan Smoked Ribs-A - delicious! The bbq sauce was also awesome.   P.s. we've ordered take out from here twice since dining in and the food holds up! So good.

QQkTcspaaYX1Os-m3zoAkQ.text: Holy WOW!!! I actually ordered takeout from Mama Bird the other day and let me tell you it was phenomenal! I ordered the shrimp and grits which were perfection, the brisket grilled cheese sandwich, again it was mouthwatering good, the delicious fried green beans and the chicken tender salad. Everything was superb!! Having family in the south, I know southern food and mama bird does it right!

yd_bE6d5Bs02_OxokKm3MA.text: Born and raised in the South, it's hard to get my fix when craving homemade southern food living in Vegas. Mama Bird is clear across town but has a large menu with a lot of great dishes from barbecue to fried chicken, and they also promote their catering. Love the vibes here, hoping they eventually expand for another, closer location.  PROS: This cafe is super cute, love the homey aesthetic. Menu has a lot of my favorites, and food was tasty- brisket grilled cheese and mac and cheese were good, as is the shrimp and grits. Food tastes authentic to southern cuisine, some portions are fairly large (sandwiches), making this a good spot to share a few dishes with a friend. On both visits, I was checked on by staff. They also sell Liam's ginger beer that I'll eventually try, along with pimento cheese.   CONS:  Pricing is kind of all over the place. Portions for sandwiches are sharable, so $15 with with fries is fair but the shrimp and grits was tiny for the $8.50 price- wish they offered this as a larger entree topped with blackened shrimp for $12-15. Pricing could come down for the deviled egg app and biscuit, too. Friends  decided against ordering the fried chicken when they realized it was boneless, which we found odd. Tables on both visits sat needing to be cleared longer than expected.   This spot is quite a drive for me but I have recommended it to friends who live closer. Come in to share a few things, and don't forget to use the Yelp check-in offer for the free watermelon sorbet!

JMWMOfDc_SrgTpkaomyjVA.text: A multigenerational child of the south, I cannot tell y'all how excited I was to finally try this place! A long drive for us, we decided our daughter's 14th bday was the perfect day to go. We got there just before 11am and was a bit surprised by the lack of customers on a Saturday morning. We had a choice of tables and chose one outside which, despite the heat, offered a nice breeze thru the walkway just down from Albertsons, between an Aveda's and a smoke shop.   My southern DNA demands "if you can't say something nice, don't say anything at all!!" However, I was raised to be honest. So, in that spirit, my single biscuit was amazing. Do not expect a basket of them (found in every southern restaurant I've ever eaten in) because they charge $2.50 each!!! Think a Red Lobster Cheddar Bay biscuit (with extra cheese) topped with Trader Joe's Everything But the Bagel seasoning. Absolutely loved it but will NOT make the 45 minute trip just to eat one...  Our birthday girl's chicken tenders and mac n cheese were liked by her with the latter being the favorite of the two. She did question the crunched up saltines on top though. Lol.   I'm glad I wasn't hardly hungry a bit so the tiny little bowl of shrimp and cheddar grits were just right. The big lumps in the grits reminded me of mama's! (Mama wasn't known for her culinary skills)  My husband is a Yankee and his most favorite breakfast is biscuits and gravy. Having sampled both Northern and Southern varieties, he said he had tasted worse but had never been served biscuits and gravy soup before today.   We tried the watermelon lemonade. Adults not impressed at all. The one watermelon item we especially drove all this way for - the watermelon soft serve - was, well, let's just say the soft serve machine was having a bad day. Not fortuitous in July. In Las Vegas.   All in all, we could have spent a whole lot less, gotten better value and enjoyed the food even more at Cracker Barrel - except for that biscuit. Maybe it's just my southern embedded thriftiness but spending almost $70 on breakfast for the three of us with the only stand out a little biscuit?  Service? Almost as slow as Christmas seems coming to a selfish child. Don't wait for menus, silverware, water or salt and pepper. Y'all are expected, but not told, to wait on your own darn self.   One last thing - don't expect a single, solitary drop of southern charm or hospitality - which was a cryin' shame. Like my southern grandma always said: you never get a second chance to make a first impression..."

gppIjn8B07CZkztx5TT3ZA.text: Finally, another breakfast spot, other than Rise in Shine in our neighborhood. Not that I don't love Rise and Shine but, it's nice to have options lol  Love the vibes in there but, fairly small space.  My friends group of 4 plus baby fit snug in the corner but, love for the food made up for the tight space.   I got the fried green beans (I'm in a green bean phase at the moment) and ginger beer. Friends got the country fried steak and chicken and waffles. I didn't get to sample their food but, they thoroughly enjoyed their food. Saying the chicken was moist and there was a good tasting breading in the chicken. My girlfriend found their chicken fried steak to be her new fave with a nice gravy that goes with it.  I, actually, really loved the fried green beans. It came with a ranch sauce but didn't need it as the breading on it was enough flavor. It was perfect amount for me to much on, reminded me of fries :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken n waffles
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special fried green beans. Yum.

bo-YiMXU2FeYou8bgkNw_A.text: The food here was incredible. 5/5 stars hands down. I had the 5 chicken tenders with mac & cheese on the side. The chicken had just a perfect layer of crispy skin, not too breaded or oily. The insides were sooooo juicy. One bite and I already knew it was the best fried chicken I've ever had. The mac & cheese was delectable and I can venture to say it was also one of the best mac & cheese I've ever tasted. The portion for the chicken tenders was exceptionally generous. 5 pieces..? looked more like the whole damn chicken!   We also ordered other items like the pit master scramble. I judged a book by its cover and when it came out I thought it looked like your typical scramble mush -- throw some cool ingredients together and hope for the best. nope! The flavors went together perfectly and the pork belly was cooked to perfection.   Now, with such a sterling review on the food...why am I giving it 3 stars? I judge a restaurant by the whole experience and not just the food.I was very dissatisfied with the service although every waiter was very courteous. They just have a broken process (can't rly blame the waiter for that ...or can you?)   TLDR: long wait despite half empty restaurant, served wrong food, forgot to serve us appetizer til we were done, came to this restaurant specifically for their watermelon boat/soft serve (was served without a boat bc "we were taking it to go" -- which we NEVER said....did not re-serve it correctly)  I would come back again despite the lackluster service. The food was outstanding, I will give them a second chance to hopefully redeem themselves.

0ztOGwUYuMuvcJHBgCRItg.text: The quality of the food is on point, but given the prices, the portions are quite small.  I've ordered food from here on more than one occasion and both times I was disappointed by either missing items, undercooked eggs, and sometimes both.    I'd recommend Rise & Shine, which is owned by the same family!  The food is fresh, flavorful, and never disappoints!  Moreover, they're prices are MUCH more reasonable and the portions are very generous!  Bottom line...Mama Bird and Rise & Shine (owned and run by the same family) offer delicious food, made with LOVE.  Support your local, small business and give them a try.  You will NOT be disappointed, unless your country fried steak arrives ketchup instead of their HOMEMADE sausage gravy...or you didn't get the AMAZING "pot of bread" you ordered...or your eggs aren't fully cooked - but you can't deny that undercooked won't stop you from eating them.    Stop in and enjoy.  They are a family oriented business that treats their customers like family.  They aren't always perfect, but no one is.  Just give them a heads up if something is missing.  ;)  Meanwhile, I stand by my review.  You can now send an instant message across the planet through social media, so I have a difficult time understanding what happens when an order that is relayed (within the few feet of distance) between the dining area and kitchen is made incorrectly.

E00TfHVymIhFKF1i8LjgXg.text: Loved coming here for breakfast and lunch. You won't lose weight doing it, but it's a good time. Smoked brisket hash, chicken and waffles, ribs, mac and cheese expertly made, ginger beer and watermelon lemonade. The food is slap-you-in-the-face amazing, the staff is good-natured and efficient. Wish I could take this place to LA with me!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DdP8K1sxL0n6CGY0BaAd8Q.text: The definition of great hospitality and service.  I should start off by saying that there actually was a problem with my order, but their response more than made up for it. They were quick to fix their miss, immediately offered me a free appetizer for my wait and were very attentive. Really proper hospitality.   Also, and I was surprised, but the wings are probably the best I've had in Vegas. Smoked then battered then fried. And you got to love a place who respects their wings enough to *only* serve sauce on the side!  I will definitely be back.

BSGUbNR9oLP-7KuEqZOZOw.text: Very trendy place! It's small but the decor in modern and the food is tasty. There is a limited menu, especially for smaller kids, but it was a fun experience. I brought my friend with me to try this place. She loves to eat like me, but she's a very picky eater. We both ordered the Fried Chicken Tenders with potato salad. I also ordered a ginger beer. I couldn't eat the potato salad because of the poppy seeds and onions--I looked like the picky eater that day! The chicken was tender and flavorful, but there was a little too much batter for me. I ate the meat and left some of the fried batter on the plate. I gave the biscuit to my friend to take home and finished the ginger beer. Needless to say, I left somewhat hungry. I'll have to try something else from the menu next time.

4hqjgdMSJGtK53FOgMhnaw.text: Boneless fried chicken breast and waffles.... nom nom nom  After spending 20 minutes looking for decent parking to eat somewhere on the strip, we gave up and decided to start heading home. A quick yelp search, and "Mama Bird" popped up. It about a 5 minute drive south of the strip so we decided to give it a try. Parking was amazingly spacious since it's in a shopping center, and free.  The workers are all friendly, the atmosphere is welcoming and the food... is phenomenal.  This trip to Vegas I was apparently on a chicken and waffles vibe and this has to be up there with the best I've ever had.  Cornmeal waffles, great. Eggs and watermelon, check. Deliciously fried chicken breast, yum. Sweetened sun tea to wash it all down, refreshing.  Fast and friendly service, doesn't get any better.  If you need somewhere to eat and you don't mind a short drive away from all the headache of the Vegas strip, try Mama Bird out, they're rated 4.5-5 stars for a reason and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boneless Chicken Breast and Cornmeal Waffles, nom nom nom

U7ktv1aJUOWX4OJFP4zHaw.text: Good ole southern cooking! This place is pretty good. Wife and I walked in and the place was close to packed, but then again it has a small seating area. The decor leads to an Instagram feel, but not overwhelming cliche either.  Any southern cooking restaurant should know how to make sweet tea. I speak from more than a two decade experience in the South and I tip my hat to Mama Bird for that sweet tea. One sip brought me back home.  I will give them props on the portion sizes, but that may be because I chose a monstrosity of a plate, the fried chicken mac and cheese waffle sandwich. It was delicious. The chicken was seasoned really well and the mac and cheese was tasty too. The waffle didn't stand a chance though. I attempted, but it broke after the second bite. My wife got the fried chicken salad which was served in a colander. See what I mean about the Instagram feel? She said the same about the chicken.  We also got an order of pimento cheese, bacon jam, and their deviled eggs. Even though they pride themselves on the deviled eggs, I was less than impressed. What I do want more of is that bacon jam! Get in my belly!

5DiShPGnmPDX8T1u0PDFRA.text: I thought their service was great and their Mac and cheese is to die for!! Overall, I love their service and macaroni and cheese!! I highly recommend getting their large size too!!

x-YmeDFZfkjPNpMZY082Ag.text: Awesome service and the food is amazing(: Very pleased! I ordered the biscuit sandwich, it was only $4.75 and was super filling.

vd6wDKrzAnjdh26Ia8Kn0A.text: Great breakfast spot! Portions are huge and flavor is delicious. Must try the watermelon soft serve!

WqYYlzRSDcLQHEsRCpPVkA.text: This spot in So Highlands is excellent. Great southern food including delicious chicken and more. The creamed corn is to die for and the service has always been excellent.

ziJ-cnJI2AH6S8YyKpHkEw.text: Delicious! Would def suggest coming in and having the fried chicken sandwich. Watermelon galore,

K7MhmmF74ZrGWgQZpgcGrA.text: Being from South Carolina, I knew it was just a matter of time until I'd find a local restaurant that could satisfy my southern cuisine cravings...  Mama Bird is definitely a spot I can proudly recommend. I ordered the 2-piece boneless thigh plate, which came with an Everything Biscuit plus one "small" side of my choice. First comment to make--small is misleading. The serving of mac and cheese was *too* generous, but at least that means I have leftovers!   The Everything Biscuit is good, but even better with the complimentary honey butter. The fried boneless thighs were juicy and fantastic--unlike dried pieces that I've had from other establishments.   I decided to order a Watermelon Lemonade and have no regrets. It's the perfect summer beverage without being too sweet! They also offer hand-crafted ginger beers (non-alcoholic) in three flavors, but that will have to be for another visit.   To finish things off, I enjoyed a unique Watermelon Soft Serve! Don't know where else I can get this!  Props to the friendly staff for providing all this satisfying food. I'm really glad this place opened and can't wait to visit again!

Also it's loud and a lot of yelling from the kitchen which is ok if they just turn down the music when it does reach capacity.

oG6BOBMzdwXo5HHMZbxssw.text: Delicious meal from Mama Bird. Everyone was full and happy in our family. Dropped 1 star because it would have been nice to have waiter service for the price.

E1cCK4ce_5JQdMVM22vUCw.text: I Iove this place, the salt and pepper grilled cheese brisket sandwich is amazing!!! Ryan is awesome and the atmosphere is cute. A new staple in southern highlands!

IZtiLD_gWXs7-vdEDw5NrQ.text: I'm a southern boy and this place nails it. Incredible food and awesome staff. Do not pass it up.

2O4poMzmjkoIJKr4YOwbaw.text: I was a little nervous coming in to the restaurant, because we have a 2 1/2 year old, and a 1 year old, but since the reviews said "kid friendly" I thought we'd give it ago. I was extremely pleased with the relaxed atmosphere. Our kids behaved, but it was just nice that we could enjoy our food! I feel that this is very family friendly, and each staff member that we came in contact with, was very friendly and accommodating! The kids' menu is only 2 items- chicken tenders with macaroni and cheese or chicken tenders with French fries. But honestly, sometimes restaurants over complicate kids' menus. It was nice, because we just got one of each for our kids. I expected like an "easy Mac" version of macaroni, with it being the kids menu, and all, but it was amazing, homestyle macaroni, that my picky son devoured! My daughter loved it, too! He also LOVED the chicken tenders. My husband has the mac n cheese chicken tender waffle sandwich (I had a bite...oh my yum!) and I had the brisket sweet potato hash! The biscuit and specialty butter that came with are the items that put that dish over the top in my book!   I also stole a few bites of my kids' chicken tenders (you know, for quality control purposes ) and my son asked for some ranch. I believe I spoke to a manager (he was the one that came out and asked how we were doing- a younger guy, with glasses...very nice!) and he said they have a house made dill ranch. It's not your traditional runny, store bought Ranch, so my son wasn't a fan, but I had it and I wish I could put that on everything!   Finally, we had the watermelon soft serve for dessert. I had read about it, and thought it was going to be overly sweet like most sorbets are. But this was not the case at all! It was light, simple, and satisfying! 3 ingredients that make it taste so fresh, and not overcomplicated!   This restaurant focuses on True flavor, and bringing out delicious flavors with fresh ingredients to compliment some amazing recipes.  We will definitely be back, because there are a few other items on the menu that I would like to try, and I NEED to try the ginger beer when I come back!   I didn't catch anyone's names, unfortunately, but everyone gave stellar service! Thank you all!

Ll99DIH0Osjsobo4_PEvjw.text: This is actually our second time eating here. First time we got it to go and this time we came in and ate. The service was out of this world and he food was amazing. Coming from Texas and being a southern girl this speaks a lot since southern is their thing. We will be coming back!!!

9V_D-oYTZ_M2SK0Qw4VBrw.text: Very good place. Authentic flavors. Can definitely tell they use from scratch recipes. Normally when places do from scratch theres to much seasoning, but not Mama bird it's just right you enjoy the flavor of the food. Ladies up front are great, and very friendly. Will definitely come back. I'm a chef myself and it's hard to find places I enjoy cause I think I'm the best lol but Mama bird has it figured out. Everything biscuits and gravy ( just do it) words can't describe. My wife was pregnant and it's hard to please her palate right now and she cleaned the bowl then came for my waffles great place . Coming back for the ribs and brisket next. To be continued.

SQp6zrYDzlQKOua6MR4GDQ.text: Had a scrumptious dinner in this warm and welcoming new spot! Truly Southern hospitality..loved the lime ginger beer in the copper mug and the amazingly delectable crusty warm biscuit with honey butter..omg. Did I mention the fab mac and cheese and the melt in your mouth brisket? The barbecue sauce is tangy and sweetly delish. No need for a knife..perfectly seasoned meat that cuts with a fork..succulent! Can't wait to try the fried chicken, ribs, and creamed corn. Bye bye diet...hello happiness!

5qA7WHpMZhwXAS2J10ZXtg.text: Oh my goodness, this place is AMAZING! Everyone is super friendly and the food is out of this world. My husband got the biscuits and gravy breakfast and I had the smoked pork belly and grits. The gravy was perfection and the biscuits come with everything seasoning on them - so super tasty. The grits were cheesy and smooth, not at all dry like you get in some restaurants. Try them with the red hot sauce that's on the tables! The watermelon soft serve is a must-order, too! It's delicious! So happy to have this place in the neighborhood. We'll definitely be back.

-9fM36AsA8eyIh_PCWmGRg.text: Visiting from out of town and came across this little gem of a restaurant. We tried the fried chicken thighs, cheddar grits and smoked pork belly. Everything was delicious. Along with the friendly service, lots of reasons to drop by again before heading back home.

XmkU3xIcWsg37MwNSPA8RA.text: Excellent excellent excellent fried chicken ! Also the Mac & cheese with the saltine cracker on top is absolutely amazing .. great customer service & fantastic food ! All around an amazing experience!!! Highly recommend

6X-Od7TZzrwnRPzi80CnbQ.text: Visiting in Las Vegas region and didnt want to do a chain restaurant  breakfast and found this little gem on Yelp..try it, wont be disappointed.

c2fKKQr8EDwxed1lqZlJ4w.text: I was displeased as the pricing was very high and you don't get very much for your money.  The breakfast options are very minimal and for the price you pay, it's not worth it ($50 for 2 plates!).  I got the Country Fried Steak "breakfast plate" and it came fried chicken, two eggs, and the gravy on the side with a slice of watermelon. I had to order the everything biscuits separately ( which were very dry and honey butter very little to help it) - no potatoes or anything.  The taste was ok - nothing great.  Also got the chicken and waffles.  Waffle not thick or fluffy at all - and the chicken on top was mostly breaded.    You pick up the food yourself from where you ordered the food ( no table service) and when there is a line to order, it's very crowded ( as it's a small place).  You have to reach over other people with these huge plates to get your food and bring to the table.  They only serve Instant Coffee which they have you make yourself - very disappointed and with this experience I do not want to return to even try the other food options.

tnXXjBAET3G-cm1FWYxr8w.text: The food was good but the wait was not. I understand that they make some items to order but we had our sides after the main part of the meal was finished. It was also a little expensive for a fried chicken joint (which are customarily cheap)

w8j6pw-YVtSOTkEEM7C-MA.text: If I could give this restaurant more than five stars I would!!!! From the service to the food.  The food is amazing.  Great place to eat with your family. Five stars for customer service the vibes alone in this place you CAN'T get anywhere else. We definitely will be back. The service you will receive here is incomparable to anywhere else in vegas.

Ik7aNjwXxpgW2WUMBaR8LA.text: Wow! This place is amazing! We ordered multiple items off their menu and everything was GREAT. Not only was the food GREAT, they had great customer service and all the employees seemed to enjoy their job! I think we found a new spot to call home for our comfort food needs and wants!

ZwdhyigCdmYeYEgjtfMGMg.text: Wow!  This is seriously good food.  You know when a place is just a few steps above the rest and this is one of them.  So happy to have this place in the neighborhood! We went last week and going back again today.  The fried chicken is so good as was everything we had.  Mac & cheese, Coleslaw and Biscuits were all so good I could have licked the plate. I can't wait to try the breakfast there.

dkgQRv1FVtbKTGdg0ibhow.text: Had chicken and waffles, brisket hash, salt and pepper brisket plate. Everything was spot on. Not as heavy as we were expecting, well done!   Self service style keeps things simple. Open kitchen and hearing the staff interact was fun.

CQtkaAIPdtVT0vOgMGppEQ.text: Thank you for coming to Southern Highlands!   The best hearty breakfast/brunch when we want a good comfort food meal!

OdvgK2yOOK2jBmifsEW9ow.text: Fresh down home cooking. Super friendly staff. Must have the the Big ol ' watermelon wedge with honey and lime.

dlybdI9h353xMnONLVkMiw.text: This is some of the best southern fried chicken I have had in a while. The portions are huge and the sides are traditional and delicious, reminds me of my grandmother's cooking. My wife said that the sweet tea was what sweet tea is supposed to be. The watermelon soft serve dessert is so fresh. Overall great experience, the service was welcoming and polite and food was hearty and filling.

G80sQl2P4Z-Yz3F7-OjrPw.text: The interior aesthetic is rustic and the soundtrack is eclectic. Service is really helpful for a first timer.  It got super busy. Good biscuit. Better gravy. Bomb chicken and Mac.

Inn05QdhFAjO_NwvhZstCg.text: This place is so cute, and the menu is so unique! The Watermelon Lemonade is delicious, and not overly sweet, and the ribs are so flavorful and smoky. It's the real deal if you're looking for southern comfort food.

BbhdWVkIPG3ZxYxbRbm-yA.text: The food is sooooo good here. We love it. Try the white cheddar grits yum!! We are breakfast people so it's perfect. We always say we're gonna try a sandy next time but then we see the biscuits and we have breakfast lol!!!

GtTzVUwOCsEJsVWOKPfMLw.text: Great customer service and such a cute place. Mac & cheese was the whole table's favorite!

qlpCesGBCEDCDKcfkIOFtA.text: Food was great. And being close by I think we will be regulars here! The atmosphere is inviting and clean. Great addition to the area!

v824Hi_4RrtWFwNFw8gJfA.text: Pretty amazing chicken mac and cheese and biscuits. Place was busy but all employees upbeat and extremely nice! It was very clean, especially considering how absolutely swamped they were.....I would suggest take out as not a real comfortable place to eat, with people standing in line next to you..(reason for 4stars) fast food atmosphere, reality of Home cooking! Price is Worth it....

Q7rv5Q9MteWDC7fvE_f6ZA.text: The best southern fried chicken I ever had. Same goes for the biscuit! I'm from Hawaii. I come to Las Vegas twice a year. This will definitely be must stop every trip!

jEDP7DRKu9B3jV4Kb3n7eA.text: Very bland fried chicken with the breading not cooked all the way through.  Very soggy and not crispy.  The creamed corn was just gross.  The muffins were not good either.  The grits were excellent though.  But it's very bad "southern" food and it's highly overpriced.   Save yourself the experience and try somewhere else.

Jos_BJW54LgP5Np5rPQg5A.text: This place has amazing flavor and soulful dishes I can't wait to try all that the menu offers. Great service and friendly people don't wait stop in and get fed!!!!

P3iDdMH8ECbGQjsOwXqxCQ.text: Great ambience, welcoming staff, good food, and big servings! They have a lot on the menu and is very aesthetically appealing.

WH09tIMnLtF65N8knVfFkg.text: I would just like to say the service was great. I just was not a fan of Southern Style Food. That being said, they do appeal to those who like that type of food. I wish them all the best of luck. I am happy to see another option in our neighborhood regardless of my fussy taste.

uLSy9Cxn5b3TL9Ei3OsI6g.text: This country-feel, rustic restaurant ended up being more than what I expected from first glance. With the space they were given, they were able to plan their theme accordingly and not make the place feel congested. Customer service was great and the employees were able to provide personal favorites as well as accommodate to our preference in food. The boneless thigh was great and the collard greens left me reminiscing about my childhood. Overall a great place to be in and dine.

GVbGWto11NXI3CCLp4TFxA.text: Ordered chicken and waffle to go took  30mins for my daughter to get up and ask where's our order at!!! NO CUSTOMER SERVICE WHATSOEVER..never again

cVq3J6BEiIN1BEMSexzHjA.text: I'm excited to see all the restaurants coming to Southern Highlands. I am especially excited that this restaurant is one of them. I've never been inside, only ordered on Postmates. However, everything that we've had thus far has been delicious. We usually get the fried chicken with a side and then we order another side as well. The chicken is amazing tender and juicy with the perfect amount of crisp on the outside. The macaroni is a new favorite of mine. The grits are full of flavor, I added butter and sugar to mine. I personally think the prices are reasonable. My husband and I get two pieces of chicken and two sides for about $20. It's a delicious easy option for us on nights would where we are both too tired to cook but want a home style meal.

T7FvHFkr08NL4CRTht0Uzg.text: Food is very good and the portions are huge. I will certainly be back soon  we have the chicken fingers, ribs, fried green beans, mac & cheese, wicked deviled eggs, collard greens and the watermelon lemonade. Everything was amazing!

rzU7oT67x-r5j3E97890ZQ.text: Chicken was great...perfectly seasoned, crispy and tender.  Also tried the brisket which was well smoked, very tender, and moist.  The biscuits are wonderful but would prefer regular butter instead of honey butter. Mac and Cheese....just get it....topped with saltines. Yummy!  We will be back!

vwGHaM6ToVUeVYtNzb565Q.text: Taylor, his cooking and staff are phenomenal!!! My boyfriend and I were coming from Cali to go to Vegas and yelped Mama Bird and man it is the best little gem you'll ever eat at. The interior feels very warm and homey, it's wonderful.The food is made to order, and man is it worth it! We both had the Smoked Brisket Hash the flavors were electric and Taylor picked the way the eggs were made for me sunny side up. The textures in the hash really made the dish. Man the biscuits with cheese inside that came with it are legit!! This place is a must stop. The dairy free watermelon soft serve tastes like a real watermelon...holy schnozberries! Looking for delish southern food this it!

G2YRF6dbSF_n1Sc3SRE0OQ.text: Great food! Very welcoming. Some of the best fried chicken I have ever had. The Mac and cheese was fantastic.

q8yHb6fZIXJx-tSrwr9tAw.text: Super cute place! First time here and I got the smoked brisket hash. It was made with sweet potatoes which was different but was actually really good! The spicy fried green beans are awesome too. I will definitely be back here again

QBkkxkbEKTxt85rzI7CRRw.text: This is by far the best southern style food in Las Vegas. I had the best Chicken fried steak and gravy I have ever had. Also had the brisket and ribs and they were outstanding. I would recommend everyone go here. Best southern food ever and I lived in the south for 25 years.

Zv9ti2usRSH6YplUHpjh0A.text: Soo yumm!! I had the boneless thigh chicken plate with the white cheddar grits.... BEST GRITS EVER!

xLLskQ3y6zMuWLLVaDSMOA.text: Being from the south, it's hard to find good southern food, let alone bbq in LV. This place hits the mark. Brisket and ribs are great by themselves, no sauce needed. The rub they used is great. Hands down the best bbq in LV.

s9P7g6kUr42c65LlYRD2rQ.text: This is a little oasis in the desert-- you could tell when you walk in and look at this terrific menu and comfortable atmosphere.    Upon a very kind greeting you feel the positive energy of the staff and chefs.  When I sat down you could hear people down the line saying "this is delicious!"  Nice portions and clever presentation.    Mama Bird is homestyle comfort-food featuring expertly-fried chicken and all kinds of customized, southern-inspired delicacies. This is the kind of place to make your family's weekly tradition for breakfast lunch or dinner.    We ordered the southern fried chicken sandwiches, the two-piece fried chicken, mac & cheese, cream corn and biscuits.  Don't forget the deviled eggs with candied jalapenos and bacon.  The watermelon dessert is divine and a refreshing compliment.  My wife loves the Oreo red velvet cake jar.    My compliments to this excellent family owned business.  We will be back.

fv-e4fNHlZBfp920YtBDkQ.text: Great place to eat in our Southern Highlands community. Better for take out than dine in due to it being so small inside. The food is really really good.

iLZY9aRpxXzNDT-ImYEl7g.text: Great place friendly and great customer service. Food is really good and unique dishes. Love it can't wait to come back and try something new!!!

hmIQLJMp9j5ZCcxjfUEYDA.text: AMAZING food!  We ordered take out but next time we're going to eat in., the place has a great vibe.  Don't miss out on this place!

N8oy2Wjk7HqUqw2vlEVUCA.text: This place is fantastic. Friendly service and amazing chicken. Love it. The chicken sandwich with the comeback sauce is fantastic. Watermelon lemonade is great.

-9vmaDhHXpxMCe3sA_E95w.text: First time here.....came due to high reviews and I totally agree. Ordered chicken and waffles and it was so good! Love their butter with the waffles. Great vibe here. Order first and pay then sit yourself. Friendly staff. Will definitely be back again. Compared to other similar restaurants i.e.egg works, this place has hours into the night which was very convenient.

BpIf4ACNdrUnAgJiXPCv4w.text: We tried different plates and we liked it! My favorite is the watermelon ice cream desert! Deviled eggs are also yum! Of course the fried chicken!!!

nRwQrl3IralyCymsxN17uw.text: So we checked this place out today.  Ordered an unsweet tea and a halfnhalf tea.  Not only is this the only place in Vegas that doesnt give refills of some .02 cent tea, they bring a 100% sweet tea to us of which we state we didnt order that and then the waitress proceeds to argue with us about it...a tea!!!!  Then she states we can just have that one so my partner is choking it down but my unsweet tea never comes.  So i get up and ask for it.  The rude waitress brings it and then takes back the one tea she said we can have.  Our whole table was like WTF!!! Concerning the food...its average at best.  They serve an everything biscuit at this Southern style place.  Ive been all throughout the south, never seen that, plus the biscuit was dry.  Not ever going back and dont recommend you do either.  First time since i moved here in 2006 i had a rude waitress.

u-Z_e1rUVsUdFVKtD50-Iw.text: We were looking for a away from big hotel place to eat for breakfast and we found the spot.  Awesome food!  This place is a gem.  A little small but o so good....

BIcD1aAz5z7bDGCC_fxwDQ.text: The food was disappointingly bland and the atmosphere was chaotic. One of the employees (manager maybe?) was way too loud. Yelling his greeting, telling jokes, singing , talking to the other employees, etc. I think he was trying to give the place a fun and friendly vibe, but it just made it a really unpleasant experience. We had a hard time ordering over him loudly greeting a new guest and singing to the music. We had to pause our conversation at our table several times to wait for him to be done speaking behind us. We got the biscuits and gravy and skillet. Both had really sterile, not at all "southern cooking" flavors. Pretty bland. I loaded the gravy up with pepper but it was still missing something. The biscuits were just okay. The skillet ridges made it really hard to eat that dish and it lacked flavor as well. The deviled eggs were good. We wouldn't go back.

O1iP2czhL7GJSjACbMvItA.text: Absolutely delicious. Had the mac n cheese and tender. Heaven. Will definitely be back. Taste just like home cooked food.

m-AFpJKoNlqy_Q-f7l7BUw.text: What a nice addition to our neighborhood!  I had a great first impression today when I was warmly greeted by the workers who seemed genuinely happy to be there.  The food is really good!  I had chicken strips (very large and tender) with a biscuit, and their spin on coleslaw which had a touch of apple to it, and their pie in a jar.  Everything they serve has their own signature added to it, so you don't feel like you are getting the same thing you can get at any other restaurant.  The food and restaurant definitely have that southern flair. The restaurant is nicely decorated too.  They are a little pricey, but you do get what you pay for.  I'll be back again.

96qkHZE7hLFAIDw-Hvkw_Q.text: Really great chicken and didrd. Surprisingly not too salty. Busy, doesnt seat very many, so plan your timing I'll be back.

6x3xpnuDMMJoN_xCbHIfog.text: This spot is amazing! I got the Mac'n Cheese chicken tender waffle sandwich, the chicken was sooo tender & for dessert the watermelon soft serve melted in mouth  Can't wait to come back for more!

nzOBV81nm6X3_53ZWhxXkw.text: Such a cute place! Southern girl approved. Staff was super friendly and helpful. My picky 7 year old loved the fried chicken. Everything was amazing. We will def come back. Everything had a cute down home feel that is warm and amazing.

PEOnPdpsuPiWZfhGiq_cyg.text: Dangerous for my waistline. This place is amazing!!! I definitely will keep coming back!

nSMNnFwgs7H02LgLPkRZcg.text: The food is way overpriced. There are no refills on drinks unless you want to get your own water. The floor was filthy and the tables are not cleaned very well. We had to clean our own table. The food itself was nothing special.

aF7DDqmRZuGUN-s2DGw1-g.text: Update: We still give this the same rating several months later. We thought at first they were going through growing pains so we have it another shot. This place has a case of lost identity. It's very small and limited choices so seems like a to-go place; however the first time we went it took 20 minutes and this time it took 30 minutes for our to-go order! We had groceries waiting in our car and it looked like they were fufilling catering orders. With chicken as 90% of the menu, they should have it down. Also they went on about the sauce for the chicken and then forgot to put it in the bag. The good news is that the chicken strips were huge but the bad news is the chicken and waffle was less food and more expensive. (Side note - B health rating also shows the place might not entirely have it together). We were so excited about this place but sadly won't be going back. We rewrite this review not to be rude but to give honest feedback in hopes the local business will fix these issues to stay around.

livbcgMMK09VCIEJBQNBIw.text: Southern Highlands has finally got some soul!!! Everything I had was seasoned to perfection. I ordered the fingers meal with a side and a biscuit. The gentleman behind the counter suggested the BBQ sauces as a dipping sauce. Great call! The collard green surprisingly has favor w/ just the right amount of kick. Like my mamas. Mac'n cheese a super easy dish to get wrong. They didn't.. The biscuit to die for. The Hummingbird "cup" cake. Yummy!!!  Can wait to try more items on the menu.  Support this restaurant. Let's not make Southern Highlands a place where restaurants come to die, but place they can thrive!!! Sorry no food porn pics it was down the hatch too quick.

vY4qZpBinL2UIJYMukM2hg.text: Honestly after me and my girlfriend went earlier today around 9:45 AM. We ordered our food, a couple came in a couple minutes later. Ordered basically almost the same thing as us, and for some reason they got the food first. I stayed quiet and didn't say anything. So when we finally get our order the cook or whatever she was said sorry it took so long, thank you for your patience, but the eggs took a while to get just right. I got mines over easy, and my girlfriend got hers over medium. They both were almost fully cooked, so I went and told them about the eggs, they fixed them supposably. The lady comes out and tells us one of the eggs broke, so I didn't want it to go to waste so she brought it out to us. Honestly I would never come back to this spot to eat, and I'm not the kind that will come to a business and put down negative comments based on them. But it's a straw free restaurant, overpriced for shitty quality their gravy is bagged up, the country fried chicken had too much flower or whatever. You have to get up order your food, serve yourself some water, go up to them and ask them if they can put ice in the cup. And when your food is ready they don't even bring it to you, you have to get up and pick it up yourself unless if they mess up on your eggs!

QGOuBHDHG2J1Pi8FkZ9xWA.text: The food here is excellent! I ordered the Fried Chicken and Waffle. It came with 2 eggs as well. They were cooked perfectly over-medium. The fried chicken was fantastic. The breading was very flavorful and crispy. Waffle was great, too. My girlfriend ordered the Smoked Pork Belly and Grits. The pork belly flavor was amazing and the grits were cooked perfectly along with her 2 over-medium eggs. We got an everything biscuit with honey butter to share. The biscuit was light and flaky and the honey butter was a perfect compliment. We also ordered LGB ginger beers which were awesome! They have different flavors to choose from. We ordered the strawberry and the original lime flavors. They came served in copper mugs. The only reason for 4 out of five stars is that I feel they should have someone bring your order out to your table when it's ready. Everything came out at different times which requires you to get up each time to go and retrieve your food. I don't mind ordering at the counter, but they should consider bringing it out to you. The staff was extremely friendly, however and very helpful. We'll definitely be back...

v5G6U3LVDUTrwp8QQjuqUQ.text: Visited this establishment for the first time the other day. As a person who was born and raised in the South, I can say what I ordered was decent. Vegetables and biscuit was good. Not sure about those seeds on top of a biscuit though! More importantly the fried chicken NEEDS TO BE CHANGED! Never in my life have I heard of a "Southern" restaurant serving all boneless chicken with an excessive amount of thin flaky buttermilk fry crust! In addition to that, there was absolutely no taste from this chicken! Please Mama Bird, learn to season and fry real chicken with bones! Fried chicken with no bones is not fried chicken. The bone gives chicken flavor! Otherwise, you're just eating some bland, flaky chicken tender that is basically bar food. With that being said, I will return to try the bbq ribs along with other items. But never those tasteless chicken tenders again until it changes to real Southern fried chicken! Thank you!

p2IRqi4NNfA7crCQepXGVA.text: Came here excited, wanting to support a newly opened restaurant that is literally within walking distance and with a big appetite, however I left with a big dent in my wallet and disappointment.   The great things about this restaurant:  1. Nice and cool AC 2. Friendly staff 3. Cute decor 4. Great Liam's Ginger Beer Soda  Sadly those were the only good points regarding the restaurant.   1. Appetizer/Snack      I ordered the "Big Ol' Watermelon Wedge" that comes somewhat precut, with honey-lime. If the kitchen is going to precut something, make sure it is actually so. The watermelon was scored on the side thinking it was cut, but when I tried to pick it up (and the other table that I shared my snack with), it was still stuck to the rind. With it being watermelon season, you would expect the watermelon to be sweet. This was not the case. The honey helped, but not by much. The acid from the lime wedge wasn't enough to elevate it, but by adding a sprinkling of salt provided on the table, it helped tie everything together. Also, the snack came after I was over 50% done with my entree didn't help matters either.  2. Entree      With the name Mama Bird, you would think I would order their specialty: chicken. By how the cashier talked up the salt and pepper smoked brisket, I chose to go with that. An entree comes with their everything biscuit and 1 small side. Going once again with the cashier's suggestions, I asked for their mac n' cheese. The brisket was tender, but not the most tender I've come across. It's hard to explain how once bite could come up with three different textures: tender, not so tender, dry. I've had brisket so tender, that not even the sharpest knife could provide a clean cut, but being they were even able to do should give proof that it is not as tender as it can be.       Everything Biscuit with a side of honey butter, was not the best example I've ever eaten. The outer part of the bottom of the biscuit was very was crisp, almost close to being burnt but not quite. I enjoyed the crispness, but the inside of said such biscuit was dry and not fluffy. Great flavor with the everything bagel spice that is on the top of the biscuit where it is sprinkled, I just wish it was also mixed into the dough itself. The saving grace is the honey butter, I just wish there was more of it.     Mac N' Cheese came out almost perfect! The sauce was smooth and velvety. It had great ratio of sauce and pasta. Also, the pasta was cooked perfectly. The downfall to this dish is the lack of seasoning. If I have to add salt and pepper to any dish in any restaurant, that shows me there was no seasoning done by the staff during the prep and cooking phase.  The crushed saltines wasn't enough to help with the seasoning either. Also, more would have helped out with texture.  3. Dessert       The Hummingbird Cake Jar was surprisingly decent, for the most part. The banana pineapple cake was moist but the overly sweet cream cheese icing over powered the dessert. I love sweet, don't get me wrong, but by fixing the ratio of icing to cake and this dish would be  enjoyable.  4. Staff     I'm sorry. I work in the industry as well, but I don't need to hear the staff arguing loud enough for the dining room to hear to "excuse me but I've been here since 6am" from someone working the line. With an open concept kitchen, these are the things you should avoid.  5. Lay Out     It is not their fault but the design could be improved upon. The ordering counter is basically steps away from the door, so when the restuarant gets busy for dine in and take out orders, it comes to a head right there at the counter. If the ordering was at the far end close to the only booth in the restaurant, then maybe that would help out that high traffic area for an easy pick up and take away.       For the amount I paid and the service that I got, I am in no rush to come back until things settle down. For $33+ (not including tip), I could have gotten more food at Big B's Barbecue. Next time I'll make the trek there but don't get me wrong, I am still going to give Mama Bird another try for the rest of their menu items.

kEIf8lr0GKib5r-45E7Y2g.text: You've got to love any restaurant whose idea of a chicken tender is literally a whole ass chicken breast filet. That's Mama Bird. The chicken is breaded in a thick, flavorful batter and cooked to perfection. It's served with a thick mac and cheese and even better, an everything biscuit, which was mashed up with Southern charm and NYC attitude and topped with honey butter.   Also worth an order are their deviled eggs, topped with a generous hunk of bacon and a few candied jalapenos for a bite that's simultaneously sweet, salty, smoky, unctuous, and spicy.

bQzEHk1UyMLphXDz3bSIIQ.text: Unique menu and very friendly staff. I recommend this place to anyone who loves breakfast.

zwWxFMnE9O0n6k7hbobL8w.text: Food was excellent!!!! Chicken was juicy.  Can't wait to be hungry again, service was also very good. We will definitely be back for more.

ZPxo46B9QJEHB9r2Zu8YSQ.text: To me, Popeye's has always set the standard on fried chicken. Whenever I eat fried chicken at other restaurants, I'm always disappointed and think "This is overpriced and not as good as Popeyes." But Mama Bird has definitely changed that for me.  The fried chicken itself deserves five stars. The breading was so good and flakey. It was perfectly seasoned and not too salty. I usually like eating my chicken with some type of sauce like ranch, but it was seasoned so well, I ate the whole thing by itself (and a little hot sauce for some kick, of course). The best part was that they had BONELESS thighs, which are unheard of(at least for me)! It was a lot less messy than eating regular thighs.  My friends and I also ordered the salt and pepper smoked brisket, which was great. The brisket itself was very tender and seasoned well. It had the right amount of fat and the bbq sauce was really good too.  We had the spicy fried green beans as an appetizer. The green beans had that nice crunch and the dill ranch was unique and complimented the dish really well. I just wish it had a little more kick to it. For sides, we had the sweet cream corn and the white cheddar grits. Both sides went well with our mains but I really enjoyed the grits a lot. Each dish also came with an everything biscuit, which was the only thing I didn't enjoy. The biscuit was too hard for me, but the honey butter that came with it, was really good.  The chef brought out their watermelon soft serve for us, which was funny cause that was what I came there for. And it did not disappoint! The soft serve had the right texture and wasn't too sweet. It was very refreshing.  Service was really good too. Even though Mama Bird isn't a full service restaurant, the workers and chef came by to check up on us frequently.  I definitely will be back again for the fried chicken and to try more stuff off their menu.

GB4NxqNLDkIHR93tDuc8GQ.text: Located next to Smith's in Southern Highlands is this gem which I had the pleasure of dining in.  We ordered the 8 piece meal with boneless thighs, collard greens, mac n' cheese, and everything biscuit with butter.  I have to say I was taken aback by the flavor of the chicken!  Fried and breaded to perfection!  The sides and biscuits were pretty good too!    They serve breakfast, lunch, and supper specializing in southern food.    Also, tried their watermelon lemonade and it was fresh and delicious, even came with a slice of watermelon.  Their sodas are craft and come in bottles, I found it to be classic.    Dining area and restroom is clean.  You'll constantly hear the sous chef and chef communicating which I find is a good thing.  Service was superb.

jafdM2mnS8aaKy30ooqeQA.text: We finally made it to Mama Bird. After reading a few reviews we had to have a taste of a few of the dishes. I don't normally order devil eggs but I will at this place. Next we tried the shrimp and grits- it was good and tasty! It was something to eat the one time but would have ordered more deviled eggs instead  I enjoyed the pork belly, eggs and grits. It was good, for the price and portion, I think I would have ordered something else... maybe more deviled eggs . My husband had the brisket hash because the person behind the counter recommended it. It was okay!  He said he would have ordered more deviled eggs .  Overall we enjoyed our meal and enjoyed it with the watermelon lemonade. Sweet, but it went well with our dishes.   For the person complaining about straws! They have straws!!  The people who worked there were all nice! They greeted us and asked how everything was multiple times. We definitely will be back to try the barbecue plates and the watermelon sorbet.

RcPYN-IGdt6Dr0XOCyCb2A.text: Went there about 545p on a Friday night and glad I did to beat the crowd... limited seating tables but wide open at the time.  You order at the register and they call your name.  When I waited for my food  it was getting busy and seemed like they could have used some extra help. The cashier couldn't keep up with the line order, deliveries, to go, and the phone..yikes!  Ordered the Mac nCheese Waffle Chicken Sandwich and fries which was $13.95. When it came I was like omg how am I gonna eat all of it.  When I ordered I asked the cashier if their was any mayo or sauces and she said no, so when it came with sauce on it I wasn't too happy.   It tasted like Big Mac sauce.   Had I she told me correctly I woulda said hold sauce.    Food was amazingly really good,  chicken nice size and crispy and juicy.  Waffle was good too!    I also ordered the watermelon soft serve...all I can say is fire!!!!!!! Omg so good.  If it wasn't for the sauce on my waffle sandwich this place would have got 5 stars.... will be back again and recommend!

D6Be2_EgcBz2WUeC1kEq5g.text: I've been waiting to try this place for awhile. I finally went with a group of friends on a Saturday around 11 am for brunch. The place is pretty small inside, but they do have outside tables which were perfect in the great weather. You have to place your order inside and then wait for your food. The staff is super friendly and welcoming. My friends and I always like to order multiple different things and share everything.   -I loved their watermelon lemonade. I could've had 3 more glasses while I was there.  -Their deviled eggs were delicious. I especially loved the candied jalapeno on top.  -The mac and cheese was creamy and delicious. -The chicken tenders were large, juicy and flavorful on their own, but next time I'm going to ask for some ranch that I saw others write about. -The pitmasters scramble was unlike other scrambles. It was filled with different vegetables, the cheese sauce was the perfect touch, and the meat was crispy and flavorful. -We ended with the oreo red velvet cakes. Those were good, but a touch dry. I wish we could've tried the hummingbird cake, but some in the group are allergic to bananas and pineapple, so that was out of the picture.   I'll definitely be back to try some other items on their menu

TbgZb5pCl5XVVBFPO1wY6w.text: This strip mall eatery did not disappoint. Southern comfort food done right! Do yourself a favor and come with a BIG appetite, portions are large! You seat yourself and order at the counter when you're ready. Unfortunately there was a mixup with our orders as the system for food delivery wasn't very efficient. I think they would benefit from having a table marker of some sort to ensure the correct order makes it to the guest.   We sampled the deviled eggs, ribs, chicken tenders, chicken wings, Mac & cheese, and fried chicken and waffle mac & cheese sandwich.  The star of the meal was hands down the Mac & cheese which  had crumbled saltines on top! So gooey, so creamy, and oh so sinfully delicious.  When I think comfort I think a big bowl of macaroni and cheese. All of the food was prepared fresh and tasted great.  If you are in the Southern Highlands area you have to give this little joint a try!

AgcWvnKAMhrFNYMdQoUurw.text: Very nice staff!  Great food!  I ordered the sausage gravy and everything biscuits the first time I was there.  Keep in mind that is one of my least favorite dishes so I figured if I liked it, then everything else would be good.  Well, I cleaned my bowl!  Best sausage gravy ever!  Best biscuits ever!  My son ordered the chicken tenders.  He ate them all!  The only thing I did not enjoy was the sweet tea.  I lived in North Carolina for 19 years, I know my southern style sweet tea and how to make it.  The tea here did not taste right.  Had a funny aftertaste like it was instant and not home made.  Fix the tea and you have a regular customer!

25R4-qOp_9w8I9NyEyKdVw.text: Dude the fried chicken here is freakin amazing! Just wanted to first get that out of the way. So on a random Monday we decided that we need to go to Mama Bird's. It was actually on my bookmark list on my yelp, but I never found the time to go so my girl and I decided that we were going to go on a Monday afternoon. Mama Bird is pretty easy to find since it's located in a grocery plaza with plenty of parking. When we went it wasn't crowded at all with only one more couple eating a late-ish lunch (3PM). We were looking to try the fried chicken and baby back ribs. Unfortunately they ran out of Baby Back Ribs since the day before was Father's day and apparently fathers love baby back ribs. The interior was pretty nice and tables were clean. Staff was pretty friendly and service was quick. Keep in mind we were the only people they had to serve. Here's what we ordered and what we thought: - Two Piece Boneless Thigh Fried Chicken with Mac and Cheese - WOW the fried chicken was amazing. It was crispy and not greasy. The breading on the chicken was done really well such that if you bite into the chicken ALL the crispy flavorful breading doesn't detach with your bite leaving the rest of your chicken naked and sad. You know what I mean? Like when you bite into a piece of chicken from KFC, Church's, or Popeyes, you could literally detach the entire skin from the meat on the first bite, enjoy that first bite with an incredible amount of the flavorful skin then the subsequent remaining chicken is all flavorless, depressed, unhappy, and probably a compulsive gambler. NOT SO with the chicken at Mama Birds. The skin and crispiness remains firmly attached to the meat like a toddler with separation anxiety to their mom on the first day of school. The seasoning of the chicken was so delicious. We also ordered a Boneless Breast Piece to try the white meat and it was just as delicious as the dark meat. I like me some good fried chicken and I often praise Popeyes and how they prepare their fried chicken, but I gotta say Mama Birds is a step above. - Mac and Cheese - This was alright. Tasted pretty standard like others I've had before. - Salt and Pepper Smoked Brisket with Collard Greens - Brisket was delicious and tender. Seasoned just right. We took some home as leftovers and they tasted great the next day after being nuked in the microwave. - Collard Greens - I thought this was okay, but not worth getting. My girl really liked it and thought it was flavorful so I guess it's hit or miss depending on your preference. - Everything Biscuit with seasoned honey butter - The biscuits were very good. Well made and super flavorful. If you like the buttered biscuits from Popeyes these Mama Bird Biscuits are way WAY better. - Wicked Devil Eggs - These were great. The bacon and jalapeno blended well and nothing overpowered the other in the flavor department. My Fried Chicken hierarchy from top to bottom is now: Mama Birds, Champagne Bistro & Deli (Newport Beach, Ca), Popeyes, KFC, Church's, All others (this includes the fancy smancy fried chicken I've had at other higher end restaurants, but they never seem to get it right and are not memorable in any way). Mama Bird hands down has one of the best fried chickens I've ever had. We'll definitely be back to try their baby back ribs that we missed out on, but we'll definitely order the fried chicken again. If you haven't figured it out by now let me just clarify.......GET THE FRIED CHICKEN! GET IT NOW! DO IT! C'MON! DO IT NOW! IT'S RIGHT HERE! GET TO THE CHOPPA!!!! youtu.be/dV5wbfFD9go
