DXrmBwB7XlzeLyMwX6TRJg.text: If you are seeking delicious southern comfort food, look no further! Mama Bird is a cozy, friendly  southern diner in Southern Highlands.  The food is absolute delicious. I usually can't finish most restaurant meals due to portion size. Because the food was so yummy I pretty much licked the plate clean. I ate the brisket and sweet potato hash, served up with two fried eggs and a slice of watermelon. I also had a watermelon lemonade. The watermelon was divinely sweet.   I asked them if my meal was gluten free and they said it was, but couldn't promise safety from cross-contamination. Make certain to ask them to omit the biscuit that comes with it if you are following a GF diet.   My boyfriend had the chicken fried steak. He said it was ok.   The only issue we had was the wait time between ordering and being served. If you don't mind a slower pace, and you can take your time leisurely, you will not be bothered. If you are in a hurry, this may not be a good experience for you.   The other problem that Mama Bird faces is space size. They can get busy, so finding a seat inside may be a struggle.   Regardless, I think this may be one of my new favorite places to eat in LV!

U6cPzolobMtzlClN2J-n6g.text: Came here for lunch and it was amazing. We had the brisket with a biscuit and the apple cole slaw. Simply delicious. The brisket just breaks off with a fork. The biscuit has seasoning on top with flecks of cheddar inside and is served with honey butter. We also ordered the wings - to die for. They are smoked and then fried. The flavor is insane and you really don't even need sauce but we got the cowboy candy bbq sauce and I was fantastic. The Mac and cheese is a must. It is close to perfect - creamy and had crushed saltines on top. The food and service is so incredible. Seating is limited so call ahead!

7zG4YrHJOhFVXCTDordjbA.text: One look at the Mac N' Cheese Chicken Tender Waffle Sandwich and I knew I had to drive down to Southern Highlands as soon as I could.  Located in the Smith's plaza, Mama Bird has plenty of parking and outside seats. Upon entering, you order at the register then sit wherever you'd like.   Seriously, this waffle sandwich needs to be shared. The pictures don't do it enough justice! The thing is ginormous. My sister and I ordered our own and we barely made a dent. I couldn't get together one full bite so I dissected the top of the sandwich.  The Mac n' cheese on top was gooey while the chicken tenders were juicy and crispy. I didn't realize there were pickles until later on when I was snacking on it again. Nothing bad, the pickles just surprised me. You can also get fries or watermelon on the side. I chose the fries which was both sweet potato and crinkle cut potato.  Overall, we had a warm and pleasant experience here. I'm already anticipating my next visit!

Wk2tkB0MQEeP6P_JwI-tdQ.text: First time customer here. It's a cozy atmosphere. The waitress, Serenity, is very friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed my breakfast. They put a mixture of veggies (a succotash) on the potatoes which has lima beans in it, now I've never liked lima beans, but I ate every one. It is a very good mix. Thank you Mama Bird for getting me to eat lima beans. The everything biscuit is moist, soft and delicious. Can't wait to try their wings. I'll be back for dinner for that. You should try this place.

88dGEReV45A9RYDYSxn7Zg.text: This is the second time I am here. I was so happy to revisit here because last time the food and service are both good. I ordered two salad one fried chicken, and waiting for 40 mins, they even did cook it, and they throw the receipt and forgot it. During the 40 mins, we asked two times about our food, they said they are cooking it. but finally, they did nothing. I will never come back. I am going to drive SF, we don't have this time wasting here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JkBpWDtKaW4DSnRQjhTYpQ.text: So I've been to Mama Bird a few times and am so impressed every time I leave. The food is so good and the service is so personable and really keeps me coming back for more. I have been at different times of the day and am always welcomed in and greeted promptly.   The set up is an open kitchen and a cashier where you place your order and pay. Then you can grab a seat at any available table and they bring your food to you. Now even though it's a casual spot it's still very homey and themed with chicken decor and the workers will check on you to see if you need anything after they bring your food to you.   On my various visits I've had:  Deviled eggs with bacon and candied jalapeno: creamy deviled eggs with a nice spicy and sweet kick from the jalapeno. Perfect starter while you wait for your entree.   Boneless thigh fried chicken plate with macaroni and cheese and an everything biscuit: juicy and tender chicken thighs battered and fried to perfection topped with pickles and onion. The macaroni and cheese is creamy and topped with crushed saltines for a little crunch. The everything biscuit is so flavorful and fluffy and served hot with salted honey butter on the side.   Salt and pepper smoked brisket with creamed corn and an everything biscuit: the brisket was so tender and flavorful and was served with bbq sauce. The creamed corn was a perfect blend of sweet and salty.   Chicken tenders plate: huge and juicy chicken tenders that fill you up. Ask for Mama's comeback sauce and the dill ranch for dipping.   Pitmaster's scramble: breakfast potatoes topped with juicy brisket and pork belly, eggs, cheese sauce, and candied jalapenos and served with an everything biscuit. These layers of goodness went so good together. I'm not a huge breakfast person but I would recommend ordering this at least once.   Chicken and waffles: on Wednesday they run a Waffle Wednesday promotion when they have waffle specials from $5-$9. I had the chicken and waffles and it was so good. One big fluffy waffle topped with two big chicken tenders served with salted honey butter and syrup and dusted with powdered sugar. A perfect blend of sweet, salty, and savory.   Liam's strawberry ginger beer: we ordered a growler which served about 3 1/2 mule cups so it was a good deal. Sweet and spicy ginger beer that went well with our meal.   Watermelon lemonade: sweet and tart fresh ice cold lemonade garnished with a watermelon wedge. Refreshing and compliments breakfast, lunch, or dinner entrees.   I highly recommend trying Mama Bird if you haven't and I can't wait to come back for more. Mama Bird has made my list for top foodie places and whether you're a local or visiting Las Vegas be sure to stop in and support a good local business that will have you coming back for more.

wD_xQZo4B7FSY0OYjc5Y5g.text: Why aren't more people talking about Mama Bird?! Stopped in today, ready to be underwhelmed by another restaurant claiming to be "southern". Well, y'all are legit, and I'm fresh from Florida, so my word in The South goes! Lightly fried chicken is yum. Dill ranch dipping sauce is perfect. Mac 'n Cheese is mind blowing. Now, the collard greens. Do you know how hard it is to make collard greens? I am the only person I know who makes them right, and now, here is Mama Bird, being added to my list of correct collard greens! I randomly found this place stopping in at Pineapple Park, and I am so happy I decided to come. My new favorite place. Come here to put the South in your Mouth! (Oh, and they got Cheerwine)

liTn8vO904XaywuRVFuV2g.text: Mama Bird... let me start by saying how many places you know still batter their chicken in the kitchen when you order it. The food is amazing and it's worth the price. The watermelon lemonade is just perfect and the everything biscuits are so so so tasty. Everyone there makes you feel welcome. It's a small place but so super cute. I absolutely love it and hope you get a chance to experience it.

HCB9tQZG2ZedUbE3jEFOcw.text: I'm sitting on a bench seat at Mama Bird's,  a touch dumbstruck - not to be melodramatic, it is just food after all, that being said, I just had my foodie bell rung.    A buddy recommended we meet here for lunch, he's getting a thank you card in the mail no doubt. I had a full rack of baby back ribs, I figured I'd eat half of that which I did because I was hungry. The other half I ate out of entertainment - pure and simple. The slaw was tasty, the biscuit was light a d delish - deadly.   I could wax on, ..but you got my drift.

G0Kww2W4Ol8wYj7TlydS2A.text: Amazing food, service and atmosphere! We will definitely be back!  I highly recommend for large parties as well they have great deals!

eE_fkygGg8goS673R4ONuw.text: We just needed a quick lunch On Our way out of Vegas, and this was close to our hotel and promised to be at least different from the burger/taco/Denny's offerings.  Just didn't want corporate food. Mama Bird offers seating inside and outside. Food is ordered at the counter and then served to guests at the table, so not "fine dining ".  However, the food is down home comfort food and our meals were above par for casual dining.  My wife and our friend (the FABULOUS singer, Shaunda Fry) ordered chicken and waffles and both of them were very happy with their meals. The waffles were "perfect" and the breading on the boneless chicken was dark brown and crunchy.  They shared an order of deviled eggs and gave two thumbs up, except for the pickled jalapenos on top.  I had biscuits and gravy and the biscuits were definitely southern style with cracked black pepper on top and if you've never had biscuits that way, get in your car and get this NOW.  I don't know any other place that does a good southern biscuit. The Gravy complimented the biscuits perfectly.  I appreciate The unsweetened fresh brewed tea and it sounds like a little thing, but you forget how satisfying just fresh brewed tea is when people put a little effort. It's nice to find a new place that does simple and delicious food. With a smile.

-L9rASTxH0qRJCUUBntq9g.text: I have been here multiple times since then opened and I still Love it. I told my friend about the shrimp and grits and she feel in love too. The brisket is unbelievable, the greens taste like they were made in the south, just about as on point as it gets. Even my 1 year old loves them but they do have a little bit of a kick to them. The Mac and cheese is good, that one is a bit hard to judge because everyone likes a different time of Mac and cheese. Back to the shrimp and grits... it's real shrimp stock not that fake flavor most restaurants use, so delicious. The chicken is so tender and juicy!! The watermelon lemonade is a must to wash down all this delicious food and last but not least you Must finish this all off with the watermelon ice cream that comes inside a slice of watermelon... epic! You can't go wrong with this place.

82LnExbUyelV8jhrtTrmww.text: This place deserves 10 Stars. I've came back multiple times. Super friendly staff. The food OMG  I get the brisket grilled cheese. Order it and thank me later. I will definitely recommend this place.

vYBCiKRyGYGwYRTXy1O2Qw.text: I love that this restaurant has opened in Southern Highlands. It's 4 minutes away with one of my favorite menus ever! They're everything biscuits are amazing!!!! 1WUmjZwhf02cCRwv9ze93w.text: Met these folks at a charity event for veterans. Already a win in my book! They provided some menus and promoted the bro k and mortar location in the south end of town. The brisket hash is absolutely worth the trip by itself. 28 miles one way and can't wait to go back. They also have house made ginger beer. Not too sweet. Not to bitter. Perfectly mixed with whatever you want. And the final price of the puzzle, fresh hand made watermelon soft serve ice cream! tIgVLwhYGBq6G-vLJm7TVA.text: The staff was very welcoming upon arrival. They all invited me to look at a menu and advised they would be right with me. A new staff member was arriving and she immediately took my order. I was impressed by how all of them were accommodating and happy we were there. The fried chicken tenders were so delicious. The breading was great and the chicken was super moist. The biscuits were out of this world. I wanted to take a dozen home! The watermelon soft serve was better than I expected. cP50EsIb93xGKdAlcJhhkw.text: Southern Highlands really lucked out with this Southern kitchen. It is a small, casual restaurant with order at the counter service. Mama Bird opens at 7am and serves a full menu all day, which was perfect for my post-work pimento cheese pick up. I ordered it without the bacon jam and it was a great snack and spread for the buttery homemade Everything biscuit. I only tried the cornbread waffle, watermelon, and eggs from the chicken and waffles, but it was an awesome looking dish.  One of the owners, Liam, makes his own ginger beer, which is a real treat for fans of this spicy beverage. I might need to stock up on some bottles of the version with real apricots.

I ordered the chicken fingers, mac n cheese, and biscuit and she got their BBQ brisket sandwich and sweet potato fries. We will be back for V-Day to try their BBQ ribs!!

mDlrQ-Jgrtt68Dnyr0lpxg.text: You know how sometimes you just walk into a hole in the wall restaurant, and you can just tell it's going to be a gem?  That's Mama Bird.    Now, my experience was far from stellar, however, this place has a ton of upside.  The environment is cozy but open, and the kitchen boarders the dining area.  There are no walls separating the two so you can hear the kitchen staff calling out orders, coaching, and generally enjoying themselves.  What can I say...I'm a food nerd so I love this kind of thing.  My meal was the tale of two restaurants.  I ordered the three piece thigh meal with a biscuit, and shrimp and grits.  The meal comes with a side, so I chose the white cheddar grits.  The cheddar grits were okay, they had nickel size chunks in them that needed to be mixed in, and lacked flavor.  I don't think they were intended to be like that because the shrimp and grits were smooth.  Shrimp and grits had big chunks of bacon and the shrimp were sliced in half down the back.  I'm no grit expert, but the shrimp and grits were also just okay in my eyes.  I won't order either of the two types of grits again.  Now, to the chicken.  I'm disappointed the pieces are boneless, but hey, if they taste good who cares?  The chicken pieces are huge, a two piece meal is plenty of food for one person.  The breading on the outside of the chicken is crisp and crunchy.  It's not oily, and the chicken is cooked well.  Maybe slightly overdone, but not dry.  The largest issue I had with Mama Bird was the breading on the chicken.  The first piece of chicken I had was perfect.  The next two, however, were inedible.  The breading at the surface of the last two pieces was crispy, however it wasn't cooked all the way down to the meat.  When I bit into the chicken, the batter squished into my mouth.  I threw two of the three pieces out because of this.  All in all, it's clear that the staff at Mama Bird know what they're doing in the kitchen.  There was some training going on while I was there, so I don't hold the chicken batter against them.  I'll be back to give them another try because if they can work out the kinks Mama Bird will be a diamond in the culinary rough that is Southern Highlands.  Tip:  The hot sauces on the table are delicious, I highly recommend them.

zrltxcpoyeuJsfitiwxvfQ.text: It's about dang time !!! Finally found a GREAT BBQ in Las Vegas. If you love meat go with the Rib and Brisket Feasr it fed our army :) Will be back!

QASZw_mlOJpVmDEB_qBBRQ.text: Oh my gosh! I don't like chicken wings, but I was sold upon hearing one of the servers talk about them to a customer and so we had to try them. AMAZING!!!!!! No need for sauce!  Actually, we came in for brunch and got the watermelon wedge, with a watermelon lemonade, and had the watermelon soft serve for dessert. We also got the Everything Biscuit sandwich and the Mama's Fry Pan Breakfast. All were awesome!!!! The chicken was a total afterthought and worth it!!

3rpVGiRoKCZ9KMz-58olJA.text: FOOD BEST. CHICKEN. EVER! This place serves boneless thighs, boneless breasts, and tenders. They are so juicy and crispy that you don't need to use any sauces with it.   Their fries are amazing! When I got the three-piece boneless thigh meal, I asked if I could have fries as my side since it wasn't under the side menu. You get a mix of crinkle cut fries and sweet potato fries that are seasoned with a side of sauce that appears to be thousand island.   Everything biscuits here are EVERYTHING! It's honestly like an everything bagel but in a biscuit form with a side of honey butter.   TRY THEIR WATERMELON LEMONADE. JUST DO IT.  Also their watermelon with soft serve was so refreshing! It's a perfect way to end your meal here!  CUSTOMER SERIVICE Cathy and Serenity were so helpful and so kind when I came in. I love their hospitality!   RESTAURANT They make me feel like I'm at home. Also the decor is very lovely. I love the rustic vibes. It gets pretty busy on the weekends but not so much on the weekdays based on my experiences. Also it's not a huge place so plan accordingly!  I am so happy that Vegas has a place like this. This is my favorite go to places for fried chicken!

myE69QF7ksWf_8pi2kly-Q.text: Found out about this place via Instagram.... gave it a shot... all that was ordered was beyond good   You have to try this place.. most other "southern kitchens " cook too greasy and messy, not this place... it's Clean and filling

O7zgJ3lnef0SjZV6FVGQvw.text: OMG, the best ribs and collard greens I've ever had. My husband had the fried bologna sandwich and said it was unbelievably good. I'm in Vegas for three days and I will be returning back to this restaurant to try more of the fabulous food. And every time I visit the M resort this will be my go to spot.

qYfL7NEFd6z0LnDlt1lhwg.text: I've  been wanting to try this place for a while.   Its much smaller inside than I expected.  Its also a restaurant where you order at the counter and then your food is brought out to you.  The food was good but the time it took for our food to come to the table was not up to par.  We ordered a mac and cheese, kids chicken strips, deviled eggs, shrimp and grits, watermelon lemonade and my husband got a brisket plate.  My lemonade was tangy and sweet with a nice chunk of watermelon displayed on the glass that my daughter took care of.  The shrimp and grits was probably the best I've had in a long time. It was a cajun style with a slight hint of spice. The only thing I would change is I'd like a bit more cheese on it.  They make the mac and cheese fresh on the skillet which is great but takes a while.    Why I can't give it a better score is because all of our food was brought out at different times. I finished my shrimp and grits before my kids and husband had their meals.  Our appetizer was brought out last instead of first. There was only one food runner on the floor and she was trying to do it all. There were several employees working in the kitchen so I'm surprised at the delay and differences in output.   I would dine here again but just order it for pickup.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon lemonade
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LeABBJL6y6plIcDjNlv1kA.text: I expected to find Mama Bird to be good southern food for Vegas, but it's definitely good southern food in general. Everything I ate here was delicious! I can't wait to return soon.   The restaurant is cute inside and has many details that give a southern feel. Food is ordered at the counter and then brought to the table.  The employees were friendly and on top of making sure everything was great from start to finish. When we arrived an employee greeted us and explained the ordering system. Our food didn't take too long to be prepared and employees continued to check on us until we were finished eating.  To start we enjoyed the Wicked Deviled Eggs. These were wicked delicious! The filling had a great flavor, some of the best I've ever had. The pickled jalapeno and crispy bacon were the icing on the cake.   With so many great drink options I broke from my usual beverage of choice, water. The sweet tea was perfect, sweet without being overly so. My husband's watermelon lemonade was refreshing.  The fried chicken was the best part! I had the 2 Piece Boneless Breast Fried Chicken Plate. I love that the meat is boneless to make it easier to eat. The chicken was juicy inside with breading that had a great tasting seasoning. The fried chicken wasn't greasy at all and had the best texture. I loved the flavor of the macaroni and cheese and collard greens. I'd order all of this again. My husband loved his Fried Chicken & Waffle.  A couple of small suggestions to make the experience a little smoother. The line to order forms from the back of the restaurant to the front. This isn't instinctive nor can the directions to do so be seen until you are past the register. It might make more sense for the line to form at the front. Second, food is handed to runners through or over customers paying at the register. This isn't just inefficient, but it didn't seem like a good idea to hand fresh food by other customers first.

Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wicked Deviled Eggs
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The back side of the menu.

wy4UfxqVzfwzzK0kIxnHYA.text: Yummy food and cute environment:)  Was a bit confused with the way to order but otherwise pretty good ! The wait was a bit longer than I anticipated but will be back.

5UVJ5h6Y5-_c4UibWnrs1A.text: I was just about to get off work and texted my friend to meet me for dinner. She suggested Mama Bird and it's been in my bookmarks for awhile so of course I was down for that!  We both ordered the 3 piece tenders with Mac n cheese and a watermelon lemonade. We split an order of the deviled eggs and I got the creamed corn cuz I had to try that too. Everything was delicious, except the creamed corn, I wasn't a huge fan of that. But, the chicken was crispy and perfectly seasoned. The Mac n cheese was creamy and tasty. The deviled eggs, awesome. And the watermelon lemonade, I'd go just for that. If you're a fan of southern comfort food you definitely have got to try Mama Bird.

I just expected it to be more sweeter watermelon-ey. The smoky baby back is very nicely smoky. And the meats comes right off the bone instantly. Would come back again for other dishes.

ZpiBta4gMh1GNCuWBQv34g.text: Only good things to say about this place ... Mama Bird does WORK ! Came here for breakfast . From the moment you're in the parking lot, you can smell the southern kitchen goodness.  Nicely themed little interior with some outdoor seating, friendly and very helpful staff. We ordered the deviled eggs to start (perfect mix of savory and sweet with bacon and candied Jalapenos ), fresh sweet tea, watermelon lemonade  . Entrees we ordered were the fried chicken with cornmeal waffle and brisket hash with sweet potato. EVERYTHING was BOMB . All flavors are balanced, go extremely well together and SO flavorful !  With a yelp review, you also get a free watermelon sorbet treat ! I'm stuffed but will try and fit it now .... haha . Thanks mama ;)

TZgxFqDqsBZkPvDjGWAI5Q.text: This place has a real southern feel. It smells really good when you walk in. I would say the setting is perfect for a small group or a casual breakfast date.   Supposedly they are one of the top 5 places to eat watermelon at. I'll have to try that sometime. It looks like they also serve different flavors of ginger beer which looked interesting.   We went for breakfast so we didn't really try any of that. We ordered the mamas pan fry breakfast which was eggs, shoulder bacon, fried potatoes and a biscuit.  I think everything was really good. My favorite thing was the biscuit. It was a little bit of sweet but also savory. Nom.

J8nuyWy7maQaqrGz4PO-7Q.text: Ok, this is a nice place. Food is great and customer service is good as well. We patronized this place earlier today. 5 min after we sat down the table next to us finished their meals and left. 30 min later we got up to leave and looked at over at the table and it has yet to be cleared. This is down right nasty. Also. The restroom smelled as if it hasn't been cleaned in a bout 2 days.

WPJKZ4v2u62oO99kOpGe-g.text: Wow! I am stuffed. My son and daughter-in-law treated me to lunch today for my birthday, and I chose Mama Bird. We shared the Ribs and Brisket combo. The portions were ample and well seasoned. The meal came with everything biscuits for each of us (plus one more) and two large sides. Collard greens and the Mac-n-cheese complimented the protein. And both of the proteins were fall off the bone, easy bite and coated with a great crispy dry rub.   We chose to have Liam's Ginger Beer with Apricot. Again top notch!  And since we got a bottle some LGB is going home with me. When I return with the bottle, I'll get LGB for a dollar off the price. YES!!!  Can't wait to return and try the hummingbird cake.

Definitely bringing my girlfriend back to try this place . Extremely friendly and nice place to stop for breakfast lunch or dinner ! Highly recommend this to anyone . vLBpybZYl5lrFBKVjYZo9w.text: Literally the best chicken in Vegas! The service and people working there were amazing super friendly. This place is a must try!!!

cV7uh0fgNbgKgJRCYngeaA.text: The ambiance is great and the food delish!! I'm glad we came here it's very family friendly and it's easy to bring the kids with you.

p3e3B3-yhS75v3sFtKb7sQ.text: I gave mama bird another try and this time it was great!!!! The brisket and ribs were amazing and so were the chicken tenders. I called the order in and was told it would be about 20 minutes. 20 minutes later I went to pick it up and my order was ready and waiting for me. The bbq sauce that comes with the ribs and brisket is amazing, the sides were great too! I recommend the white cheddar grits! The chicken tenders are really good, for being so simple I think it's hard to find good chicken tenders but mama bird does them right!!

ebGCstLj7h-g_D5ayIKLvQ.text: Being new to Las Vegas, I was incredibly excited to find a southern kitchen right in my own neighborhood.  Understanding that they're newly opened, I gave them a pass on how long it took to actually get my food.  Overall the portions were ok for the price, but I was disappointed in the quality of the food.  I tried a few different items so I could really get a feel for multiple things.  The brisket was absolutely amazing, but beyond that everything was mediocre.  The biscuit was dry, the potatoes were bland, and the "southern style" fried chicken tried way too hard.  It was vastly overbreaded, and when eating it all you could taste was flour and grease.  I'm hoping with some time they perfect their food quality a bit more, as I'd love to have somewhere better than KFC to get fried chicken.

vKVZzJvaDY8Gh0PGC6OtAw.text: This place was so good. Comfort food. Staff was so kind and accommodating. I love that they serve regular and sweet potato fries together... because I can never decide. The everything biscuits are a must too.  Yummy and so much food for the money.

UAxW5sa7gT4cVAiNLWt-fg.text: Great to have these guys in the neighborhood. So boneless chicken is really friendly, and if you love crispy thick breading, well welcome home. They seem to all be very proud, and it shows. Very friendly service. We ordered the family meal, 8 pieces, 2 sides (collard greens were a bit spicy in a good way, and man, mac n cheese had this green bell pepper finish), 4 biscuits (they almost seemed like pie crust with globs of butter in maple syrup). $45 is a lot, but it was equally a lot of food so ok.   We'll come back to try breakfast, but yea man, Mama Bird can cook.

wdbwXC8S5mUxPMZcOcvGhw.text: Stupid good bbq. Good enough to smack yo mamma. Seriously good brisket and ribs. Finally an option to the overhyped Rollin Smoke. ZACK PITMASTER IS A scholar of BBQ. Everything is perfect! I am holding out for a flintstone Beef Rib Zack!

Super delicious and satisfying! All the way from the chicken waffle to the honey butter they use in the biscuits. Overall food was GREAT, definitely did not disappoint, and the service was even BETTER. Very friendly and welcoming! You have to try this place!

h0uJhFnWkENRpf3RMez_NQ.text: Walking by the area it always smelled good. So today, I decided to get it for dinner. We got the 10 piece fried chicken meal. It is overpriced , under seasoned. Why is it so hard to put salt and pepper. Also, SO MUCH breading but a small piece of chicken inside. Mac n cheese has no flavor either. Come on food establishment's, take pride in your food. It will pay off if you do.

93CM6UPwriceCkVY4Qe-0g.text: Went for dinner, the food was really good! My husband said it was the best chicken fried steak he'd had anywhere in Vegas. I got the fried chicken, the breading was light and not greasy. The biscuits and mac and cheese were super tasty too! The thing I really enjoyed was not just the great taste but the fact that it wasn't too heavy or greasy. Often when I have southern style or bbq food I feel kind of sick afterwards because of the heaviness of the meal. I didn't feel that way after Mama Bird at all! I'm excited to go back and try more!

7Ri8IOCEhz1gRWhtfZeuTQ.text: We decided to try this place after popping up Yelp with very good reviews. We are on our way to Antelope Canyon and this was conveniently along the path. We ordered the Chicken and Waffles, Deviled Eggs and Fried Chicken Sandwich.  Service was very nice and fast, our food came out quickly. It is definitely good souther comfort food, the plates came with a very decent amount of food, I will have to say if you are in the area and craving for fried chicken this is your place. Also best devil eggs ever!

P-OYynQ60Wa0ErfbjNRxwg.text: I am so excited and happy to have found this gem!!! Cute place, great people and amazing food! The food definitely didn't disappoint. My 7yo and 2yo enjoyed the shrimp and grits!!! Will most definitely return to try everything else

8-EbGfr3OYXHWCTui4d4MA.text: Just moved Over to Southern Highlands and ran across this little gem. Great ribs is hard to find in Vegas especially close to your house so very happy to have this near us. Exited to go back and try the brisket and other menu items!!

--zCW_ZnCX0mzvf44rqftw.text: First time coming to Mama Bird and the food was delicious! Shawn was very nice and helpful with the menu and recommended the Mac n' cheese tender waffle which was great. Definitely coming back!

UJGX0e6tq1GMGhnUgRSSiw.text: Creative comfort food at it's finest.  Smoked Pork Belly & Grits - 5/5 Pork belly was incredibly tender and flavorful. Grits were well seasoned, nice and cheesy. Both complemented each other.  Salt & Pepper Brisket Grilled Cheese Sandwich - 4/5 Savory and sweet. Your typical BBQ sandwich, not quite as exciting but still delicious. Bread had great texture and a nice buttery finish.  Mac N Cheese - 4.5/5 Very thick and cheesy! Eat quickly while still warm.  Collard Greens - 4/5 Super flavorful, like a punch-to-the-mouth. A little sour, a little salty, a little spicy. It was great.  Everything Biscuit with Honey Butter - 4/5 Great texture, buttery and a little crumbly. Honey butter was a nice touch, but I think I would have preferred regular butter.  Overall I was quite pleased. Will definitely be back.

ykYFZo8UVbkkdQCoDvwMwA.text: Excellent southern food. I've had the white cheddar grits with scrambled eggs. My daughter loves loves the chicken fried steak with sausage gravy. They have excellent skills on the greens. Not soggy not too hard. Just right! I also had before the white cheddar Mac and cheese, . They crumble a saltine on top. Top 3 I've ever eaten. You have got to come, and early for the VIP booth!!

Very attentive, and made some great suggestions.  Everything is made scratch in house!    Can't wait to return, and try everything on the menu. xNgtkBv2djs8BxynWmE8rw.text: After reading a lot of reviews we decided to go check it out and we were not disappointed. We went for lunch and ordered the Fried chicken sandwich and the Salt &Pepper brisket grilled cheese sandwich. They were both excellent, probably the best fried chicken I have had in a while. The fried green beans and cake in a jar were delicious. The staff was very friendly and they are all very attentive. We will definitely be coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fg3AV4rExD5GJXKEc11GBw.text: If you havent tried this place yet, TRY IT! The food is fantastic! I highly recommend the ribs, the brisket, and the candied deviled eggs. To wash it all down the watermelon lemonade. The staff is very nice and extremely helpful. I have been there twice but cant wait to go back to taste the shrimp n grits!

cie1U_CoGn_KFueO0GITNg.text: The food is amazing but the staff is probably the best in the valley! If you want to feel welcome, almost like your in someone's home! Check this place out! WARNING: you may see the words Mac n cheese, waffle and chicken all in one order. Trust me, it's worth it!

3cO7eSXrkUzYPZ1yZ7R5NQ.text: So, we went to Hash House A GoGo for chicken and waffles yesterday and today went off the strip to Mama Birds. I have to say I love their chicken and waffles better. ( MAMA BIRD). The 2 chicken breast was light and not greasy. They also gave me a delicious chunk of watermelon. Very happy with the service. Also try the deviled eggs. They are so cute.

u6lR8OxGkO-tRPeISSoKzg.text: Southern Classics like Pimento Cheese, and Shrimp & Grits. Ribs are Surprisingly Good...Very Good. The service  was quick and fast everything came out piping hot.

B9rS-lvxh9m6wRaOIhMM8Q.text: I work as a hotel concierge for a major casino and resort on the strip. I recommend people where to eat, place and spend for a living. Let me just say, this place is awesome!!!!! Friendly service, clean environment, amazing and flavorful food. You won't find southern food like this anywhere else in Vegas.

G4cOZGFJwjsfkZy1YqVl9g.text: This place is super amazing and has super good and flavorful food. There portions are massive but yet so good. This was a amazing dinner place to go to I totally recommended coming here for any meal. This will be a meal that I will never forget !!

xgEi4M8X4OUFmaPShrQ11A.text: Great people. Great food. So unique. You gotta try it - order at the counter, and nice atmosphere.  Comfort food. Try mixing the grits and collard greens. Tonight I tried the beef brisket grilled cheese -Wawoo.

cNUIcwHhKMjJV_6wQMCt4w.text: I've been walking past this place for a year not knowing I was missing out on some amazing flavorful brisket, super tender and delicious coleslaw my two favorite things!!! Staff was very accommodating (i have allergies) great price for some quality food! Only regret is not stopping in sooner! Highly recommend!

RqIZjSniUFSNFjCnYF24SA.text: Great chicken, macaroni and cheese waffle sandwich!   The space is comfortable and inviting and so are the people here.  That fits with the southern food well.  I took the wife and kids and they were smiles all around.  I'm going to try the chicken fried steak next time as it was recommended by my daughter.

NEy3OEzaZDvCTF9GVDh7hw.text: This place is awesome! the inside is nice and the food is delicious. Chicken tenders with a side of mac and cheese is my go to plate, chicken is soft, juicy and just all around great!

u0UkN94KGIJyBfgjI4acSg.text: Friendly staff. Delicious authentic southern food. Comfortable and conveniently located.

A6ktde-Q6xEEqysK2iU5gA.text: I wanted to love this place so much. The decorations and adorable. The vibe is awesome. So let me give you the good pints first and then we'll talk about what I didn't like. I ordered 3 piece chicken tender plate with Mac n cheese and 8 oz salt and pepper brisket with collard greens. Once our food arrived, I loved the chicken tenders and the brisket. Both the meats were tender and full of flavor. I enjoyed the flavor of the everything biscuit. The way they did the honey butter was really unique they put honey in the bottom then a pad of butter in the middle of the container. It was awesome! I wish I could say more positives, but my experience was mixed. The greens were gritty and I could tell they had not be cleaned properly. There was no juice either they were very dry. The Mac n cheese was bland. The biscuits albeit they had good flavor were served cold. The food took a long time to arrive almost 40 minutes. It appeared as if they had only one person cooking and it was very overwhelming for her. Maybe I came on an off day.... however for this experience I had to rate it at 3 stars because the bad was more then the good.

JbDIecHSJSpKLGsOlc2Eqw.text: This place is incredible. The fried chicken is the best I've ever had and the fried bologna sandwich is so good I've been making the trip once a week to get one!

m9bNnxaG3JDSGCNzTKB8ng.text: The most amazing fried chicken ever!   I love the Mac and cheese, collard greens and homemade biscuits!  You have to try this place!  Food is delicious, so cute inside, a real gem in Southern Highlands.

O-39ENLBwyoaQHHZe99nsw.text: Went here on a Sunday after church service to try this place out. Not really a breakfast place unless you like chicken and waffles. Service was good, food was tasty.

bxyIrZL0e6Gr7EMJ8pcAQA.text: Been wanting to go to Mama Bird for months and finally got around to it. As soon as I walked in I took a moment to admire the modern rustic interior design. You order at the counter and seating arrangement is casual but the food is no joke. They serve hearty southern cuisine and I ordered a thick slab of brisket. It was very juicy, tender, and well smoked/seasoned. For my side I had the mac n' cheese, which was rich and satisfying. Their everything biscuit is light and has a really nice texture. I've been looking for a good brisket spot around my area and this is forsure it. Additionally, the restaurant's staff are very hospitable and Ryan, one of the head chefs, came out to talk to us for a bit. Give this man a raise, he's super chill. All in all, Mama Bird is a solid neighborhood spot and I will definitely be back for more.

Tdu9Fh9MbpHiRfmXXVHmbA.text: A nice little restaurant that focuses on Southern comfort foods.  Service was good.  Food is cooked to order and was tasty.  So why not 5 stars.  Two things the place is very small.  When I was there it was during the great blizzard of 2019 so it wasn't busy, but due to its small size I can see this place getting uncomfortably packed and there being a very long wait.  Also the prices are too high for what you get.  I'm sorry, but I can get many of the same meals for less money elsewhere.

X5kv0S1AvFPKAei2PaQbiA.text: wow what a nice surprise in the middle of the desert! we had the chicken tender waffle sandwich and a breakfast plate. great potatoes, great chicken, great waffle, all around yummy! ordered a side of cheese grits that came out a little cold and they happily remade them for us. will definitely be back to try other items!

iMdBIISS_SLkplGOtgnPXw.text: Go big or go home! Ordered the Mac N cheese fried chicken waffle and it did not disappoint. It's the stuff foodie dreams are made of. And those north n south fries are a must with the comeback sauce.

Y4UVRQeAfwIcjm6upiRrFw.text: I ordered the chicken strips and the collard greens and Mac with white cheddar grits and let me tell you everything was great I'm definitely satisfied the biscuits were so bomb.com and the watermelon lemonade just topped everything off perfectly. Another Food Favorite added to my list

wvRvA5JYT3rI-qiGkt9Dnw.text: This was suggested by a friend. I was not really a fan of the ordering process or how you went to get your own water. The food was average and the whole experience felt more self serve than I expected.

wTqJxABOkw-6zXisjYKgyQ.text: Great place. Super southern cooking!  Awesome desserts, ball jar and all. Don't miss this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Kinda Fries, Chicken &amp; Waffles w/ a drizzle of Mac &amp; Cheese.

dP8o2XiSzl16WvI3AiJwVg.text: I had a complaint, and the people who worked there really responded well to it.  I mean, they bent over backwards to make it right, and I can't tell you how much that I appreciated that.  I hesitated even to complain, but I just did not like what I ordered. Well, they took care of me above and beyond, and I left happy and feeling very good.    I cannot understate how good the customer service is here. They really care and it shows. And the fried chicken is bombtastic. I will absolutely be back and bring my friends.

31nr-t1RG7LtzvEvHvWuCw.text: Great food and service! It was our first time here and there was only one employee working when we first arrived but he was very friendly and made sure to greet us and give us the rundown of how to order. We got the shrimp and grits, smoked pork belly and grits, and the everything biscuit sandwich with bacon. All of our food came out quickly, piping hot, and super flavorful. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Pork Belly and Grits Breakfast Platter &amp; Everything Biscuit Sandwich
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits

QtPth9-Sj7mtG79bt_3HdQ.text: The staff is so helpful and friendly here! The menu has so many great options and the food is delicious! Clean and cute restaurant. Not far from the strip if that's where you're staying.

QoaDPD8ME3J-Zk5VOeUkYQ.text: We just left, found this place on yelp looking for a quick but good place to eat while passing through Vegas, off the strip and somewhat close to the freeway. We were welcomed immediately and told we could sit where we liked and order at the counter when ready. Great selection but not an overwhelming menu which is a good sign. We got pimento cheese, which came with candied jalapenos and bacon on the side. It was our second choice because they were out of deviled eggs but we were pleased none the less. I liked that the jalapeno came on the side so my daughter could still eat the cheese. However I wish there was more because they were delish! We also got sweet tea, and watermelon lemonade. Both were very good. For mains we got 5 piece chicken tenders with Mac n cheese, an everything biscuit honey butter, and ranch on the side. Everything was great. I liked that the noodles had bite to them, it wasn't just all one mush texture. Chicken was very crunchy. I would've liked more spice, but my daughter loved it, and she's a super picky eater. My husband got the pitmaster scramble with everything biscuit and honey butter. He loved it. We had so much food leftover we were able to pack it up for road snacks. The staff was super nice and attentive, restrooms were clean, parking was easy. What more could you want? Will be stopping in again when we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apparently there are 4 other places for good watermelon in Vegas?
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pitmaster&#39;so Scramble Everything Biscuit with Honey Butter
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pimento Cheese, after we already ate a bunch of it. Whoopsy! Not pictured, candied jalapeños and bacon.

fdgzevCT0_yKJWEtM5TkWA.text: Ended up getting free deviled eggs because of our large order. The staff here was extremely nice and helpful explaining some of their best options. The Wednesday waffles, on a Thursday, was given two thumbs up along with the watermelon lemonade.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time at this facility and the food looks great.

OqKuz_JO2EiprcwjR8Lv6g.text: Just went here and had the best food with the best service. We got the fried chicken wings, Mac n Cheese Chicken Tender Waffle sandwich, and the Biscuits and Gravy. Every. Single. Thing. Was absolutely delicious. I was full and just kept eating anyway. I couldn't choose a winner between the three if you asked, it was the best kind of tie. Staff gave great recommendations and were friendly and helpful. Even the jalapeno ginger beer and sweet tea knocked our socks off. I wish I lived in Vegas so that I could keep coming back.

K8Oz5HxodaozuGoh-wxjpw.text: MJ was a pleasure as soon as we walked in! Kathy is so kind and always in great spirits! Serenity is doing great in the back preparing all this yummy goodness! All around great place,  highly recommend!

1VMPkt5DyuH4XUjo066sYw.text: The food was amazing and Kathy, the runner, was really nice. Usually service is pretty good here, but this time around I was really disappointed. After our meal, I ordered their watermelon soft serve. Serenity had told me that it would be about 10-15 minutes wait because she had to work on it, so I waited. THIRTY minutes later & still nothing. They gave me a refund & that's it. If I knew it wasn't going to come out or if she had told me it was going to be longer than a 30 min wait, I could have cancelled it beforehand & not have wasted my time waiting.

vggpr5nN5yRy-OBo9qLbHw.text: This place is awesome!!!  We've been wanting to try it a while, but we just get a bit lazy.  We are in Henderson, and is it really worth it to drive 15 minutes for southern food?..(first world issues)  Ummm yeah it is!!   Worth it! Place is nice and cute, modern mom and pop feel with a southern hipster vibe, if that even makes sense.  Reminds me of on of my favorite spots in So. Cal (Realto Cafe)  Food was bomb.  I had pork belly and grits, and it was cooked perfectly.  We also had the chicken Mac and cheese waffle sandwich, the watermelon soft serve, and the kid had chicken fingers (which he actually ate and finished)  I've included some pics.  Go ahead, drool. It was that good.  Service was wonderful.  Staff was cool, checked on us, and just real.    We met Liam, who was our cashier/server/runner. We came to find out that he is the mastermind behind Liam's ginger beer.  ((Not sure how we cracked that code)). Try the jalapeno!   Mind blown. Anyhow he was rad, the whole staff was, and one day that ginger beer will be famous.

sdUt56Gd7kqmsIxa20308g.text: This place is amazing.  Don't let the size fool you.  All the food is made by hand and it tastes like it.  Honestly the most plain thing was the chicken and it tasted like really well seasoned juicy chicken.  The mac and cheese is a must.

Zo46pNSlutqZ9t8lvMS5fw.text: I don't about you but after awhile I get tired of eating on the Strip when in Vegas for business. Enter Mama Bird Southern Kitchen. It's off the strip and definitely worth the trip!   My faves were the Watermelon Sorbet, Mac n Cheese, and Pecan Smoked Baby Back Ribs. The Mac n Cheese was packed with flavor, I literally inhaled it. The rib meat just fell off the bone. I must admit I licked my fingers after eating all my ribs! To end the meal and cleanse the palette you must partake in the Watermelon Sorbet. My boyfriend liked it so much I only took 2 bites and let him enjoy the rest.  We also had the 2 piece Chicken Breast and Collard Greens. Both are on our "order again" list.   This amazingly delicious restaurant has a super friendly staff. Zach and Ryan were so kind. They answered all our menu questions and checked on us throughout the meal to make sure we were ok.   Portions are generous but it's too good to share an entree! Get your own plate and a takeout box.   Note to self: next time will have to try the Deviled Eggs and Fried Chicken Sandwich. Both look uh-mazing!

Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mood when your lunch looks like this.

EUF24vMYyE33RUMs6r9riw.text: I LOVE southern style food and Mama Bird definitely hits the spot! Incredible fried chicken, shrimp and grits is awesome, bbq is great! Can't forget the deviled eggs! Best thing on the menu has to be the brisket grilled cheese sandwich. Perfect way to celebrate national grilled cheese day!

KfK8Sv5R5RYkd_RKCVxwIQ.text: Ordered the baby back ribs and they were amazing. Fall-off-the-bone tender and the barbecue sauce complemented the meat nicely. A very nice char crust on the outside and the fats rendered into the meat. Very tasty.  The watermelon lemonade was delicious as well.

xremqnTEtzpOOfjli8O4Eg.text: Delicious! Friend and I went for lunch and we have never been this south of town before. Was surprised at how cute and tasty this place was. Had the Pitmaster's scramble and shared some deviled bacon eggs. Sooo good, I would like to put that cheese sauce from the scramble on everything. Definitely recommend and definitely will come back.   It does take some time for the food to come out and it wasn't very busy when we were there. If you're in no hurry, it's worth the wait.

C1G_jaWxwnMYJT6fruyk2Q.text: Let me start with this: THIS IS A STRAW FREE ESTABLISHMENT! What?! You didn't hear me? Let me say this a little louder! NO STRAWS!   This is my first time here at Mama Bird and I witnessed THE RUDEST customer ever. This lady ordered an iced tea. Staff called her to pick up. Lady asks,"Do you have straws?" Staff answered no. Rude lady slams the glass down and uttered, "UGH! I'm not drinking this!" And walks away...leaving the staff bewildered. I'm just thinking all in my head, " WOW! Wowowowowow! Who gets all worked up over not having straws. I commend the guy who walks all the way to Starbucks to grab this lady a handful of straws because I would not have the patience for it. I guess you can say this was the last straw.   Anyways maybe the restaurant should put up a cute sign saying it's a straw free restaurant or a BYOS. Bring your own straw. But, I on the other hand, had a lovely time here at Mama Bird. I would say it started out a little rocky but the food was definitely something worth driving down here for. Everything was well seasoned and flavored beautifully. Loved the rustic theme and super friendly staff.   Even though, this was a new restaurant I think they still need to work out a few kinks. First was the whole straw fiasco. And second maybe put a sign up right when you walk in to seat yourself. When I walked in I wasn't sure if I should wait to be seated or seat myself. I didn't want to be rude but after a minute I asked the staff and they said it was open seating. Also maybe make a bigger sign or explain to customers about coming up to the ordering counter. I witnessed a father and son leave the restaurant frustrated because they thought a server was going to come up to them and take their order. And lastly, I was a bit turned off by the sticky table and floor and lack of bussing tables. My boyfriend and I came in pretty much when they opened their doors. Half hour later, people started swarming in but had nowhere to sit.   Overall, a few kinks to work out but it shouldn't be a big problem because their food is so yummy and their staff is super nice. We should all be able to look past it. Unlike somebody... ahem.

CiIpSD4o3PeCZ1zKRyAw8Q.text: Found this gem while searching for brunch!  I ordered the waffle Mac n cheese chicken sandwich. HUGE!  I had to eat some of the Mac n cheese before I could take a bite. Really tasty!  Hubby had the 3 piece boneless thighs which he said was good. Next time I definitely want to try the cake in a jar!

It's obvious their deviled eggs and fried chicken is what they're known for. We had two orders of the deviled eggs, biscuits n gravy and a breakfast skillet. To say the portions are huge is an understatement. Watermelon served after is a nice touch. Will be coming back. =)

hxdVMVl0Tc6YLFOioVgz8Q.text: I don't like grits but the shrimp and grits served here blew my mind. The honey buttered biscuit was very nice. The energy here was very welcoming and made me feel comfortable. I'd suggest this place to anyone anytime. Whether breakfast, lunches or dinners.

bMuWbJi8hKB7PKaYHJGlyQ.text: This was our first trip to Mama Bird and it was excellent. I had the fried chicken sandwich with a slice of watermelon and my fiancee had the fried boneless chicken breast plate with mac n cheese. The chicken was perfect. It was juicy and fluffy with a great crunch. Price per meal was $13-$15. Took like 5 minutes for food to arrive. You can sit where ever you want. They also have carry out and delivery options available. Will definitely be back!

De3PgBY8Xz--ztSR01BByA.text: Yum! Super great dinner or breakfast! House made ginger beer in many flavors and fantastic watermelon lemonade. Chucked is moist biscuits and flaky! Pickled jalapenos so good.

8XWkCgMm4VTw9IGgrRCU5A.text: Food was very good. Cooked to order. Fresh, hot like you would cook at home. Definitely recommend this place and will go back again. Worth the wait for your food very worth it.

9Q1dnWBHb_IJJN3UCsftvw.text: Enjoyed the Biscuit & Gravy with some real scrambled eggs (not out of a bag). The "Everything" biscuit is very good. Gravy was also very good. Kinda missed some kind of potatoes (better for my waistline though). Will come back next time in Vegas.

l6nknuZBdd9WiNPjx1iVuQ.text: Love this place!  Great food at reasonable prices served with Southern hospitality.  Brisket and fried chicken were especially heavenly.  We came in with a basketball team with 20 people and they were so accommodating.  Highly recommended.

P4lAPw_0gXMUeaCPzdt-Vg.text: Brisket was amazing so tender falling apart. And biscuits were my favorite soft and yummy and flavorful. Will definitely be coming back and recommending to my friends!!

Chicken was missing that kick but was moist and juicy.  Best of all it's right down the street Will definitely be returning

07mI9tCQUu5qQdYlX-dIhA.text: Great family restaurant  I felt like it was too much going on too busy at that restaurant like you didn't have your own space at all it was just a bunch O hoopla too much I can even enjoy my expensive meal I felt like it was a lot because I didn't feel comfortable to eat

D8uTVUl88qZM8FT3oSSnYA.text: The best Fried Chicken in Las Vegas!! Pimento cheese, Mac and cheese was amazing. My favorite was the biscuits. I will be returning. Everything we had was delicious.

H2Uj45kvLA7StfG6KpMpxg.text: One of the best southern food in town! The brisket was super tender, the ribs tasted amazing, and the Everything Biscuit was the best biscuit I've had! We also tried the Spicy Fried Green Beans and the Sweet Cream Corn -  both were delicious! My husband did not know what to expect when he ordered the Mac n Cheese Chicken Tender Waffle Sandwich but it did not disappoint - it tastes as amazing as it sounds. Do yourself a favor and hit this place up!!

a4t-uYxCHPJNMOW84vRASg.text: My husband and I shared Fried Chicken + Waffles and Smoked Pork Belly + Grits.  The chicken was seasoned well and very moist. The White Cheddar Grits was the best I have had in a long time. Will be back. Yummy

oFm58xodEId5q-mqu6Uf0g.text: If you haven't been here yet, get in the car and drive!!! This place is absolutely delicious. Just keep the deviled eggs coming, the fried green beans are effing stoopid, and the brisket sandwich is an addiction waiting to happen. Staff is super friendly and helpful, I already can't wait to come back! Thanks guys!

vr_oqNXRZrF8lpa5jENffw.text: *UPDATE* Food is good: fried chicken crispy and tasty, brisket grilled cheese was fantastic, Mac and cheese flavorful, and deviled eggs were a table favorite. Shrimp and grits were excellent, but needs some aesthetic work so the shrimp aren't sunk and hidden. Front of house needs help, but kitchen puts out a good product.  Currently every empty table is un-bussed. They are out of multiple menu items. Almost walked out, but maybe the food will be worth it? I'll update afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Un-bussed tables more than 20 minutes after arriving. Sad.
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Un-bussed tables at 2:15pm. We walked into the restaurant at 1:55pm.

Kz1GhbyU38gbczYmhsqwpA.text: I'm glad to see another small business open up in Southern Highlands. The aesthetic of this place is very pleasing to the eye and something you should appreciate. Some items that we enjoyed consisted of the mac and cheese, their north n' south fries, the fried beef bologna sandwich, their comeback sauce, and especially their watermelon lemonade. If you're in the mood for good ol southern comfort food, this is the place to go! They have a hefty selection of chicken and barbecue plates that everyone can enjoy.   I took off one star because the breading on the chicken was just a little salty for my liking. Other than that, we enjoyed our meal! Thank you Mama Bird for the southern hospitality! :-)

Ipf4ELgW8bNPSm2d98KTTQ.text: I had extremely high expectations about this restaurant. Anticipating for weeks for it to open. They have had so many open and close dates, this past Monday night was the first night open that allowed me to be able to try the food. We were so highly disappointed by Mama Bird.   Let's start with price. The price of the food at this restaurant, is a different sort of ridiculous. Even if the food was amazing (I'll get to that later), I wouldn't be able to afford to feed my entire family at this restaurant. $45 dollars for an eight piece chicken meal? No thanks. $13 for two piece meal with one small side? My God. We got two chicken meals that came with just one small side. Our total was almost $29 dollars. The price is just outrageous. What distinguishes this place to charge two to three times the amount of any other chicken place for a meal? Maybe they're charging for all the extra breading that comes on the chicken? Or the very strange 'everything' biscuit.  On to the chicken. The chicken is deep fried, in layers of breading. Layers upon layers of breading. It was about 60% breading, 40% chicken. The restaurant offers chicken tenders, boneless thighs and boneless breasts. The way they achieve thighs and breasts to be boneless, appears that it's mashed up chicken cutlets that have been combined together. It really was the strangest chicken ever.  It was very greasy and oily from the breading. By the time we got through about a half pound of breading, my appetite was completely turned off by the look and taste of the chicken underneath.  This chicken was offered to my two kids, my husband and my mom. Each said the same exact thing, this chicken is oily and overly breaded.  I really wanted to love this restaurant, we really do need more choices of places to eat at in Southern Highlands. But I'm not sure who can afford $50-$60 to feed their family on just an average week night. To spend that amount of money I would rather go to a nice sit down restaurant.  We were not fond of Hot Head Burrito that was in the place of this Mama Bird restaurant first, but this experience literally had my husband say, 'I wish Hot Head Burrito was still there'. I send my apologies to the owners of Mama Bird. We truly wanted to love your restaurant. But over charging for chicken that has been over breaded and full of oil, will not have us returning there again.

pJrGNRm5oohQ6P7mNth0fg.text: Found this gem on Yelp.(Naturally) And they did not disappoint! From the moment we walked in until we left, we were treated with nothing but hospitality. The place was decorated beautifully. Clean atmosphere. Gave the Watermelon Lemonade a try. Yummm! Food wise, we got an array of food to give a little bit of everything a try. Wicked Deviled Eggs, amazing! Those pickled jalapenos were life changing. Spicy Fried Green beans, Full Rack of Pecan Smoked Ribs with Collard Greens, side of Mac n Cheese. And those Everything Biscuits with honey butter. I need that recipe! Shout out to Ryan and the girls for taking great care of us! Next time we are in Vegas, we will definitely return.

Ci1QzKe4XiZ5jTykLBplIA.text: I want to meet the "feeds 3-4" people who can eat the rib+brisket feast...because there was enough food to feed everyone in the joint! Brisket was tender and the ribs had plenty of meat...and a little kick of spice. Definitely get the deviled eggs and fried green beans (could eat those all day with beer). Grits were ok...Mac & cheese was traditional...and biscuit was a meal in itself. Watermelon lemonade was refreshing...didn't have enough room for the Yelp check in treat...next time!

JCHsW0ujqrrFUyz792fSmw.text: Chicken sandwich was great . Chicken breasts  and brisket sandwich were fine too. Appetizers arrived after entrees and that wasn't cool.

JpDHfOYaoTXEodiCmKd5Gg.text: My husband and I just moved into the neighborhood so we decided to try this place. We were completely blown away with the food and the customer service! My husband and I shared the ribs/brisket combo and it was absolutely fantastic. The ribs fell off the bone and the brisket was so juicy, sliced thick. My husband also tried the chicken breast and the first thing that came out of his mouth was "wow." Needless to say, I think we were both impressed. Even though we shared a plate I walked away full because the portions are huge. This will be my new go to spot. I can't wait to try everything else on the menu.

QWy4QE7paAW49gRzfNzF7g.text: This place is sooo good! The chicken tenders with their sauce yum!!! Also the biscuits and gravy is a must try!   Place is a little small. And gets busy fast. So be ready to wait but service is fast. It didnt take long to get our food.   Liam was super friendly to us and ready to refill drinks and get us any sauces we needed. Definitely a come back place!   As we were finishing up they gave us a sample of ribs. And they were delicious!

Kt-7TAApJnu8Ij63faayvg.text: We came in for dinner and were immediately greeted by the friendly staff. She explained the process of ordering and enjoying our meal. We ordered our food and shortly after, the lovely lady brought us complementary spicy fried beans. They were tasty as were both our meals. Southern style food with southern family hospitality. We will be making many more visits.  Colleen was very lovely. Thank you!

l-DcrLUIHdem9KWGDkLAew.text: Mama Bird is the mama of all fried chicken! Don't hesitate to come on in and try anything!   8pc Family Meal with All Boneless Mixed Chicken and Sweet Cream Corn and Mac n Cheese. The chicken was cooked to perfection! Crispy outside and juicy inside!  Our Sweet Cream Corn was so delicious! Its a meal on its own!  Mac N Cheese! Homemade and full of flavor!  Definitely a go to again spot!

Order to go the sandwich with fried chicken... wow... very good too. For breakfast I eat devil eggs and the waffle and eggs. Great place.

-DoLEIsuRFvDJrpyhfHEKg.text: Yummy fried chicken! Love that they have boneless options for the fried chicken! Portions are big. Son said it's the best Mac and cheese he ever had. Creamed corn was delicious. And hubby had fried chicken sandwich and he loved it!

m5AeWozD_OfCKDS5SF57xQ.text: Food was amazing. Great service. The fried chicken is tender and juicy. A must try. Met one of the owners and he was very informative and gave great suggestions

sqCoL0cuNPEzIxHeyYTdvw.text: I have been wanting to try this place so bad. My husband took me there so I didn't have to cook for Mothers day. We walked in and there were a couple people dining but every table both inside and out was dirty. We patiently waited to be greeted and for someone to clean a table for us but nobody ever said a word to us. They were all hanging out in the kitchen,  it wasnt busy so I have no idea why not a single person could bother to greet us. We would have been fine waiting for a table to be cleaned if they just said something to us. Maybe they thought we were getting take out but still they could have acknowledged our presence. Wost customer service I have ever had . So bummed because it smelled great in there.

lpNzRVHPQIxHGhM0N1nUxw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for awhile. I love barbecue. You can tell a lot about a place based on their local barbecue. When I heard they had brisket, I was definitely intrigued. I've been disappointed by dry brisket many times and I hope this place doesn't let me down. As we walked in we sat ourselves down and was greeted by NOBODY. Literally no one went to our table to greet us or hand us menus. So we grabbed our own menus and went to the counter to order. This definitely ain't the south when it comes to manners. I had their half rib half brisket special; my wife had the chicken and waffles with fried eggs; my oldest daughter had three chicken tenders with Mac n cheese, and my two youngings had the chicken tenders with fries. The food was good. The ribs were tender but the flavor was okay. Not mind bending or extraordinary. The brisket was moist and delicious. The Mac and cheese was really delicious. I gave some to my boy and he took the rest of the plate, LOL. My wife's plate was HUGE. The fried chicken was on point but the waffle was a little too crispy which my wife didn't care for. My kids all devoured their plates which were all good. Overall, good food but the service was almost nonexistent. Very not typical of most sit down BBQ restaurants. I don't mind serving my own water but for the price of the food, they could come around and get us water. The prices were high even by barbecue standards and I've been to outstanding four star bbq spots in North Carolina and Memphis that would murder this place. I'd recommend their chicken though for the taste and price.

J_04v2oiZonePxb8QQHSeA.text: I got the fried chicken plate with a side of Mac n cheese, the whole meal was delicious and reasonably priced. Will definitely be coming back.

TOarOJ2KXCEqT_gbGWZeZw.text: This is the best southern comfort place in Las Vegas! The food is amazing! My wife and I have been here several times and we will make this a weekly go to spot! The staff is very friendly and always make us feel welcome!! We get the pitmaster scramble and it is mouthwatering! Very happy we have found this place! Have been telling everyone about it!

HO4rGYrwUqIM9p_kWZQsjg.text: Great southern decor, friendly attentive staff and amazing food.  Portions were spot on and the prices are reasonable.  Thanks Mama Bird for a nice Sunday brunch.

4lL_-4oUz0agRth-gVg6Kw.text: The Food was so yummy! I had the fried chicken with a side of corn and biscuit and it was amazing! The staff was so nice and sweet and several of them came over to speak with us. I highly recommend this place and will definitely come back soon!

vdwcBNyhKj3nm3lNc_fUkw.text: #VegasStrong LAURA SHIPP  08/29/2018  my husband LaMarcA, mom (kay), & i decided to give mama bird a try today...the food is fantabulous!  the staff is super friendly & exceptionally accommodating.  i had the chicken & waffles w/eggs over-easy ; LaMarcA got a 1/2 slab of ribs, mac 'n' cheese & everything biscuit, he loved it all! mom had the fried chicken sandwich & watermelon lemonade, she had to force herself to stop eating just so she could take some home.  we live right here in so hi, & we always try the new places to see if they're what all the rave is about.  thank you for having us today for breakfast & lunch.  special thanks to savanna  tRacY sHipP

With the price it set a very high expectation, I'm imagining these chickens  massaged and pampered just living that free cage life. Hoping they fried them up tender like some cajan pro pioneer lady was the chief. However these bock bocks ended up tasting like a slightly above average run of the mill caged up chicka dees. The sides we're pretty solid Mac cheese and sweet cream corn, with some below average biscuits. All in all a average spot but with the price tag throw in on it, there is no way I could run it back as a regular family spot.  This is a one and done , hit it and quit it spot, check it for your self I'm sure you'll agree.

Food quality is good, homemade.I ordered the 3 tender combo fyi these chicken tenders are gigantic and ALL the chicken options on the menu are boneless thighs and breast I prefer bone in I feel like it holds more flavor and juiciness but their chicken still is good the batter on it is alright but kind of thick. But seriously, the chicken was amazing. Crunchy & juicy all at the same time. Here was so much food I had to bring a breast home. Hubby had the chicken sandwich with north south fries. Let me say, I can't remember the last time he at everything.   Like I said, Mama Bird is a hidden gem in Southern Highlands. Service is amazing and the food is off the hook!! But SHHHHH!!! Don't tell everyone!!!

We ordered the chicken and waffles, mamas fry pan breakfast, and chicken fingers with fries for our kids. Serve was great and we loved that they had country music playing to support the awesome vibe that was going on ! Definitely recommend this place and will be returning soon!

4R08MQmNZnY4Ifn99fIDpA.text: Food was excellent. Quick and super friendly service.  Our waitress, Kathi was so fun, knowledgeable and awesome.  Good portion size. Brisket was so good and so was the fried chicken. Will definitely be coming back.

289T7GhbzaiTAYzH6g207g.text: Holy moly! If you're on the fence about coming here, jump on the side of "showing up here for a phenomenal meal." Delicious comfort food is so hard to come by these days but Mama Bird is here to help. I recommend the fried chicken and the mac + cheese. I can't wait to try other dishes here, too, especially breakfast!

BEKsRLnEAsPefYtB4YBT2w.text: First time in this place. We got the chicken and waffles, fried chicken sandwich, deviled eggs, 3pcs chicken tenders with mac n cheese. I would rate the food 4 stars. Food was tasty and decent size. I liked the fries coz it's mixed sweet potato and regular fries. The everthing bread was good too. We got the deviled eggs super late. We were already done with our food when we got it. Going to customer service, I would rate it a 1 star. The lady staff was yawning while I was giving my order and seems like she doesn't want to be there. Maybe she's tired? I don't know but you are in a customer service work my dear. I noticed she asked the table beside (on my right and the one one tsble hidden at the back) us how was their food but never asked us how was ours. If you are doing table touching, make sure you do it in every table. Maybe she knows I was upset already because we haven't received our deviled eggs at that time. When I asked her again about the eggs, she said they are still making it. I told her the other table got their eggs but I ordered before them. She apologized at least and offered soft served watermelon which I declined because we are not in the dessert mode yet. Finally got the eggs, nothing too special about it. When we were going out, passed by the same lady staff, she never thanked us or say at least have a great day. She pretended to not see us i guess which I doubt she didnt see us coz we passed right by her at the door. Now talking about prices,  it is expensive for self serve place. It is more expensive than babystack or eggs and I or rise and shine steak and eggs (which have servers that tend to your needs).

65CIaEUZ7O92Q4QzhwZVdA.text: Some creative and amazing food! We found this place by accident, and it's one of the best accidents that we've experienced! Definitely will be back because there's is too much good stuff . Service is amazing; quick and delightful! Many mahalos

4r9eY9OTWSdWlN8q-UJjIQ.text: We had been here once before, but I got sandwiches to go a few months ago. I remembered they were good, but we'd never gone in to eat. Tonight we finally went in because we wanted to eat somewhere casual and close to home. HOW we bypassed this place for so long is beyond me. So So good. I got the 1/2 rack of baby backs with mac n cheese and the husband got the Brisket plate with creamed corn. We shared the sides, and I have to say that there was not one thing on either plate that wasn't absolutely delicious.  Weirdly, my favorite thing of all was the everything bagel with the butter and honey on the side. The perfect blend of creamy real butter with deliciously sweet honey. Open up that biscuit and slather that stuff on and it's pure heaven. I might have to go back and get just the biscuit when I just want a quick snack.

FimhQBsvBek5ySe9FMUQmg.text: This is what we city folk call comfort food that the country folk eat!  The food has been consistently great each time that I've come here. The highlights of the menu include their chicken (in any form really) their bbq (brisket and ribs just melt right in your mouth) and the sides are excellent. Mac n Cheese is amazing! For desert I like to top it off with any of their watermelon offerings, like the soft serve!

W_VW6E_rNtIyOQyKLXytJw.text: Food was delicious.  I had the pitmaster scramble, my brother had the chicken fried steak.  Both were awesome, skin on the steak was perfectly cooked.  Quick and friendly service as well!

I don't know a better value in town and aside from that, they are the most amazing fried chicken I think I have ever had at a restaurant. Did I say biscuits friendly team. Just plain great!

wGJIKBvaw8UVSsSZzLcS-g.text: Had dinner tonight at Mama Birds. The chicken and waffles were fantastic. The chicken was moist and breaded crust crunchy. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Would definitely be back soon!

Such good food that hits the spot every time. They do forget to include items when I order on postmates, so make sure to be specific when ordering.

Msr6ZnB8HDoiIlIxxZk4mg.text: First time here and very delicious. I'm always looking for a great chicken sandwich and it doesn't disappoint. Delicious Mac n cheese. My wife had the salad and it was great too. Plus this biscuit that came with the salad was amazing. Highly recommend.

Oe-uj344trAYLkvRQY8fog.text: Decided to try this new location out, located in the plaza where Smiths is at. The restaurant itself is small and quaint. Which could be difficult for people that need to navigate there way out of the booth seats. I think it would be hard to accommodate anyone in wheelchairs, especially if it's busy. I wasn't too thrilled with the service it's not your typical check on your table and make sure you got everything you need. The waitress only came once to drop the food off, but luckily we didn't need anything badly. I ordered the grilled cheese brisket sandwich and the two piece chicken thigh, The portion is great, there is enough to go around and to get you stuffed. I was a lil worried about the pimento cheese but the brisket took over and it was a nice sweet tasting sandwich. The two piece combo portion was pretty good, enough to get you stuffed. We couldn't finish our sides. Overall I will be back for that Mac and cheese and ribs!

Fq_dNCi-J91X3rVxruXH1A.text: I had their boneless fried chicken and it was a game changer for sure. It was so crunchy but the inside was juicy. Like juicy juicy. Also, you don't have to worry about the bones. I didn't even know this was such a thing. The biscuits were also really tasty. I recommend macaroni as the side, I wasn't a fan of the coleslaw. Really great staff too.

fPvTvYjdtAajGOS5YKcumQ.text: Mama Bird definitely hit the spot when it comes to soul food. I had the Mac and Cheese Chicken Tender Waffle Sandwich. It was very well seasoned. I definitely enjoyed the sandwich, but as soon as I picked it up it dropped all over my shirt. So I recommend disassembling it before eating it. The waffle gets to soggy to hold it up as a sandwich. Sweet Creamed Corn was extremely basic but it was sooooo delicious. The only flaw keeping it from being a 5 star for me is the Collard Greens were just to salty for my liking, but it could've been an off day for the chef. I will be back! All my food was $26 that was including tip, and I left with a doggy bag. Next time I'll get a chicken dinner!

Y0rEIcIyJIO2S4Iop70G6g.text: A great spot for foodies. Kinda weird they only serve wings 3 days a week but the fried chicken is very unlike many others. Very crisp breading and moist chicken.   Definitely will be back

__ea-1d3-aBJ5jlOsy0jpA.text: Some of the best if not best chicken tenders in the world!!! Not exaggerating. Come try. Biscuits and waffles are amazing. People are wonderful and serve with real happiness. A must come and see

9U4xxNuFdWYGaiYsK8Pogw.text: Mama Birds is a little place tucked away in a super market strip mall.  It's not fast, but everything we tried was well worth any wait!  Cathy and Scerenity were super friendly and made some great suggestions.  The deviled eggs were super good especially with the candies jalapenos.  The smoked brisket was super smoky and it really goes well in the grilled cheese sandwich and the scramble.  These are some of the best chicken strips we have encountered anywhere.  The cowboy candy BBQ sauce added a sweet and slightly spicy contrast to the fried chicken.  Mac N cheese was super good and creamy.  Even the sweet tea was top notch!  If you can drop by Mama Birds, add it to your Vegas trip.  It's well worth the drive and could tide you over for the drive all the way back to LA.

bTB2U3LbfDnc3G6p3K2zGA.text: Amazing barbeque! This place is the best food in town, I would highly recommend the brisket!

OsLM0zyD9GTG4eLvuQxKkA.text: We used to go to Yard Birds for chicken and waffles but not anymore. This is our new favorite chicken and breakfast spot. Love, Love, Love! Don't miss this gem of a restaurant. Also, Mac n cheese is BOMB. Zach one of the owners stopped by our table to say hello. He is warm, kind and genuinely loves this restaurant and his customers.

i6ujoupfv-SxNh-2g0nXCw.text: Another restaurant finally opening up in this neighborhood! I was hoping they would be awesome...and they were! Area residents are very particular about their cuisine choices and not too forgiving of poor service or mediocre food!  Staff and service here is very friendly, welcoming, and comfortable. They give you a warm welcome and answer all your questions regarding the menu. My gf and ordered the Fried chicken sandwich and Chicken Tenders. BOTH were delicious!! And I definitely recommend eating it HOT and fresh. The fried chicken seasoning is delicious! Perfectly crispy! We will be back!

Mz-4TnvKGnYSOfoX6TPNWA.text: Ryan, Liam and Kathy ROCK! The food is delicious and the service is outstanding! We had the fried chicken, shrimp and grits, deviled eggs, watermelon lemonade and jalapeno ginger beer

FwtUYY89TinUiy276beqrw.text: The yardbird meat was really good and cooked to Perfection, the breading-crust on the chicken was average. The fact you don't serve chicken with bones in is just straight up disappointing,

3cix2K93D0Lz2CE2yJEA7g.text: I'm not sure how everyone had a 5 star meal but mine was barely 3 stars. We had an order of chicken and waffles and a Here Piggy, Piggy omelette. The food came out at different times. Mine (the omelette) came first. My omelette itself was good and it was hot. The potatoes were barely luke warm. The biscuit was cold and was like a hockey puck. My friends chicken and waffles was ok. The eggs were under done and the chicken coating was so hard you could barely get thru it. He gave up and just ate the waffle. It's a shame, because I think mine would have been good, had it not been cold. His was overcooked maybe? Just too hard to eat thru. He did like the waffle. I don't think we'll be going back. It's far from where we live, it was just on our way home from Cali.

M2BAnkKnE0xuIAJFnFK9EQ.text: Love love love this place.We are on vacation and decided to give this place a try.We saw it on IG.We would definitely be coming back here.Everything was great and the customer service was even better.
