ascxbPIf71EIVjqRCKcKkg.text: With a continuous influx of folks looking to escape winter up North or the high prices of California 2018 was a banner year for dining off-Strip, and although accolades came for spaces across town many seem to have overlooked Mama Bird Southern Kitchen which opened in Southern Highlands at the peak of Summer.  Located at 10550 Southern Highlands Parkway in the same plaza as Spaghetty Western, an area not far from owner Robert Chiti's own home, it is inside a long and narrow space that the UNLV Graduate and TAO Group Director of guest relations has built a tribute to the South, an Instagramable interior at the same time warm and inviting as guests are welcomed with "Ya'lls" and pleasant smiles.  Open at 7am daily and serious about both Food and Beverage, a native-Ohioan named Zachary performing double-duty as General Manager and Pit Master, it is from laminated menus and overhead boards that guests are invited to make selections, the counter-style ordering a bit cumbersome given the breadth of choices and in particular during peak hours when indecision can create a logjam in the waiting area.  Playing music at appropriate volumes, appropriately southern but mercifully not all country, guests are encouraged to begin with nonalcoholic Ginger Beer from Liam's, a variety of flavors including Lime and Jalapeno each intense from Mule mugs and a nice compliment to Appetizers such as housemade Pimento Cheese or fried Green Beans with Cayenne in the Batter.   Featuring signage that reads "Wicked Chickens lay Deviled Eggs," and rightfully turning the phrase into creamy Yolks with subtle heat beneath Candied Jalapenos and Bacon, Entrees include both lunch/dinner and all-day Breakfast from which Pork Belly that is smoked four hours is a highlight, the Fat rendered and everything else almost as supple while Grits with White Cheddar, Sunnyside Eggs and Watermelon marinated with Citrus round out the plate.  Obviously gunning for "the Gram" with a fork and knife Sandwich overflowing in Macaroni and Cheese plus Chicken, Lettuce and Tomatoes - both the fried Strips and Cheesy Noodles better on their own while a crispy Cornmeal Waffle proved difficult to assess as a result of its toppings - Sides including two styles of Fries plus Cream Corn and an "Everything" Biscuit all performed well with the latter in particular quite enjoyable as Cheddar Cheese is folded in and plays well off house-blended Herbs and Spices.   Originally not having planned to order any Barbeque, but convinced by Zach that the 12+ hour Brisket cooked over three woods and Pecan smoked Pork Ribs were worth it, it is for $25.95 that diners receive a half-rack that easily slips off the Bone plus a mix of lean and fatty Beef, the smoke not as deeply penetrating as Big B's though nonetheless very good while Desserts such as the Hummingbird Cake and Oreo Red Velvet are delicious bargains for just $4, as too is Watermelon Soft Serve though if Mama Bird was being honest they'd list it with an asterisks giving Dominique Ansel credit.    FOUR STARS:  With no website or marketing budget outside of Social Media Mama Bird is looking to make a go of it on quality Cuisine and word of mouth, the former largely accounted for at fair prices while the other seems to be spreading, though the counter-style ordering should be gotten rid of to create better flow and items built for Instagram should be skipped in favor of the good ol' fashioned stuff.

vxM1Y4CBhMuh3dSA0d8ISA.text: This is our new favorite spot for our sister lunches! The decor, country music and vibe is so relaxing. The staff was exceptionally nice and helpful. THE FOOD WAS AMAZING! The portions are huge and they have a nice variety of all southern favorites !

_RvzBdapL9bPTHyTFB5Yew.text: I have had my eye on this place for a while. Decided to try them out today.  First thing to know is this place is small. They do have tables outside and the front sidewalk is really big so they are not all crammed together.  Zack, one of the owners, was running food, seating people, and answering questions.  You can get food togo so I offer that as an option as well. There was a large group of people that came in after me that did that. They too were in awe of the food.  I got the everything biscuit and gravy. Came with scrambled eggs. I also got a side of pork belly and brisket.  The lemonade that they make is flavored with watermelon. I had that mixed with sweet tea. Everything is house made. The tea mixed with the watermelon was great!   The group of people that came after me got two refills.  The eggs were very fresh and seasoned well. The sausage and biscuits were not overly salty, which can happen. Even in the gravy they retained their shape and density.  The brisket was delicious.  Not too fatty and had a great texture.  The bbq sauce was good but really not needed. Also the big wedge of watermelon should have been sliced on the plate so it could be enjoyed as a refreshing after meal treat.  The pork belly was not fatty.  If anything one might think it was over done, but it was really delicious and a bit different than most pork belly I have had in the past. I recommend it.  The only negatives I can report is the manner in which they take the orders and deliver the food. They need a more organized method. When you walk in there are some bar seats but there were so many people waiting that you really couldn't sit there. When I ordered they said they will bring it to you or you can come grab it. They have only been open 6 months so I am sure they will get it under control. Zach the owner is incredibly motivated and eager to please and serve everyone. Watching him honestly and earnestly work the room was a treat. He just needs a bit I'd help in the floor.  I'm looking forward to a return trip. The fried chicken was flying out of their kitchen. The ribs looked pretty amazing too.

XWisH18cLgOWMSk48rrmRw.text: I got to say that this place is amazing with great food, amazing staff and the best Ginger Beer in the world. I ordered the Brisket and the Ribs and they were tender and juicy. Don't miss out on this amazing place .

pIEPM3MzlSxl1WnYILY2rA.text: Fantastic Southern food! What a delicious treat from start to finish! Smokey ribs, tender brisket, cheesy grits, fried chicken, the everything biscuit (think an everything bagel meets a cheddar bay biscuit), and a giant wedge of watermelon with lime juice and honey! Plus some really great sun tea (unsweetened, I just can't do it lol) to polish everything off. We almost came here for brunch, and now we definitely will! Best Southern food in Vegas next to Lola's! P.s. they need some banana wafer pudding and peach cobbler!

4t3OD9jEJrGqPjYbVvjjEg.text: Just bought a house down the street. Wanted to meet up with a Texan friend for brunch. This popped up in my searches and the reviews were so great I decided on it. Y'all they pleased a Texan with this southern style dining! Daisy was incredible. The food was even better. This will be a regular spot going forward for all of us. Thanks Mama Bird!

eqzwQCmVGAtfROPiZ5MNxQ.text: I had the pit master scramble and it was delicious. Also had an order of wings and it didn't need any sauce.  Chicken and waffles were moist and flavorful. The sweet tea tastes just like grandmas. Would come back for the food and service. Ryan has a great place going here.

MdDGFuShnMOkZOmr-WuzUA.text: Super yummy food. Has some of THE BEST Mac and cheese I've EVER tasted. And their biscuits? Unstoppable! Definitely worth the price, my one meal was so big I had leftovers lol.

szKRFOT0f8KIweUGDXR0Ow.text: If you love mac n cheese and fried chicken then you must try this place!!!!    We had the chicken breast and the tenders with a side of corn and Mac n cheese and for starters the deviled eggs.  Ask for some of their dipping sauces to go along with your food.  If I were to pick a favorite it would have to be the cheese biscuits with honey butter my mouth is still watering. We loved the biscuits so much we bought an extra 2 for the road home.   Best part of our visit was Kathi's hospitality!  Kathi was very friendly and knowledgeable and took the time to share details about every dish and some of her personal favorites.

9qWw42GAsZnkOYCVvO0sOg.text: This is literally food for the soul. Their sweet corn is personally my favorite, and their hot sauce goes amazing with the chicken. Serenity, who put us on this mix of drinks - I don't know it's a mess but it's a beautiful mess and it tastes delicious. It's caked "muddy water", and they mix sweet tea, watermelon, and lemonade altogether. That was the best thing on the menu. It was a non-alcoholic beverage laced with crack. On God, that shit was amazing. If my hype disappoints you, I'm sorry. Serenity won't disappoint though, she's amazing.

ascVo9izb0RxIpew0cKzbQ.text: Not too impressed.  For $22 got three pieces of cold very salty raw chicken, a small lemonade and two half full mac and cheese cups one with soggy crackers and one without no cheese sauce just noodles.  The chicken is all pre-cooked and not made to order.  Nothing Southern about the taste at all maybe Southern Nevada.  We are from the South and this is not even close. The biscuit was even stale.  Maybe a bad day or just always like this.  Fell short for sure today.

F0gr_tpOZmdN8vGNXtCxbg.text: What can I say, Amazing food.  The Fried Chicken Sandwich with a fried egg.  Yum.   The mix of fries and sweet potatoes off the hook.  Watermelon lemonade that's delicious with a refreshing hunk of melon.   Breakfast rocks, love the hash.  Will be back again soon.

Sz9aBgDYFpDBGG8dC1Zpew.text: Chef Ryan & Sebastion whippin it up!  Got the half rack of baby back ribs and a side of bacon. Oh my, so bomb and I've got some to take home! My lady got the shrimp and grits, there's none to take home so I assume she loved it.  The watermelon lemonade is a definite must try.  We'll be back tomorrow for waffle Wednesday!

Z8lEDJxCRZaVnfbQpPxW7w.text: I've only heard great reviews and amazing pictures from social media & yelp! I was so excited to finally try it! It was a Saturday afternoon, it wasn't too busy. We ordered the pecan braised ribs & brisket with the sweet creamed corn. I also ordered the deviled eggs because who doesn't want to try them?!   MUST TRY their ginger beer! I loved the strawberry one! But if you're looking for a kick, try the jalapenos one! The staff was nice and helpful, they greeted us right away and broke down how the restaurant works. You order at the counter and pick a seat, easy peasy!   The only downside and upside to eating here is everything is seemingly prepared to order. We waited about 25 mins to get our deviled eggs and another 10-15 mins for our main meal. But I did realize they had multiple large pick up orders so that may have been the main reason for a longer waited time.   The serving portion for the ribs and brisket was large, enough to feed 2-3 people. If you really want to try the biscuits I would order another one since it only comes with one.

KDZB2Pq0Nuu64j_U6g-qPg.text: This is definitely a hidden local gem! You have to try this place! The food is so freaking delicious, you won't be disappointed. The service is so friendly and personal. My favorites include the fried chicken, brisket, chicken wings, deviled eggs, and the watermelon lemonade.

9osUeBFjk9tk7BB1lFbLOw.text: My gf and I stumbled upon Mama Bird driving in the neighborhood. The place is like a cute country diner. Everything we ate was a hit! The 2-piece boneless thigh was perfectly crispy and juicy!! The deviled eggs gave us life. Highly reccomended and will definitely be our new go-to.

x3Oo4IJVze2TrolR93hOYg.text: My food hasn't even arrived yet, but I'm already giving this place 5 stars for one reason... This glass of iced tea.  As a Southerner stopping in, I was excited to find proper sweet tea.    Y'all.  It's done right.  Sweet, but not too sweet.  Perfectly brewed sun tea, so none of that burnt, hot brew flavor that so often gets passed off as tea.  Delicate, simple, beautifully refreshing.  A lemon for garnish, but not a lemon tea.   Heaven.  UPDATE:  Food is amazing. Cheese grits are done right.  Friend chicken is beautifully crispy with just a hint of spice.  Bravo.

hCilFS4HJRJLdB2Fgi9HJQ.text: First timer.  Should have checked the menu out more but I saw pork belly and grits and came just for that and it didn't disappoint.  The pork belly was tender and had a great flavor.  The cheesy grits were nice and cheesy.  Not a lot of breakfast options.  The restaurant is small, about 10 seats.  Not a fan of the order and get your food and going back to cashier for coffee refills.  So probably better suited  (for me) as an order and pick up vs sitting down and eating.  Dad had the brisket hash, which was good.  He didn't like it, thought it was salty and it had sweet potatoes.  The staff was nice and friendly.

spyX5xG5lNsSiO-lEusMOw.text: WOW one of the best unique breakfasts I've had in a long time. Had the pork belly eggs and grits. Grits were easily the best I've ever had but I'm from NJ so it's not my specialty but these were fantastic. Pork belly was on point. Almost crispy outside and beautiful inside. I stared at the menu on the wall the entire time I ate, mapping out my next attack plan. Can't wait to try the ribs, wings, and the ridiculous chicken waffle and macaroni & cheese creation the guy next to me ordered!

QZO6FN3PXFxw4n4vq6jo3Q.text: Honestly, totally outstanding in every way. The food is something special, the service is great, the place is very cool.... the only thing is that I wish I had another stomach.

Wc0gF5GarGZhDj6LCyNT2A.text: Stop by for lunch, was greeted promptly by the 2 men working behind the counter. Ordered the 2 bbq meat combo which came with brisket, baby back ribs, a side and a biscuit. Brisket had great flavor and was served in nice thick slices. Decent bark and smoke ring but it prob could have smoked a a little longer for give it a deeper ring. Ribs were great and pulled right off the bone. Lots of meat on them too. Decent sized half rack compared to other places in town. As for sides we had the greens and Mac n cheese and both were tasty. Mac could have been a little bit more creamy but still tasted good and the greens had a nice kick to them.   First time here and won't be our last. Will def have to come back and try the chicken or some breakfast.

JUsnau8yjIKjzb5RZXH28w.text: Had an amazing experience twice with them. Ordered on uber eats or door dash I forget which but the food was hot and fresh! I was amazed! They gave my plenty of condiments, cutlery, and napkins. They packaged everything so that it stayed in tact and it was really well presented even as take out! I will be visiting soon to experience them in person! Great food!

Q0HrRqwS_B-l6Rx7gGzY8A.text: Accidentally stumbled into this place. What a nice surprise. The food is awesome and the service is great. This is not a traditional full service restaurant. It's an express style, not fast food. You order your food at the cashier and they will bring you the food. Everything we ordered was great but the Deviled Egg is a must try. We'll be back soon envoys to try some of the other menu items.

WX9stut99JhIuIIlpoqBvQ.text: Ryan & Davey are totally awesome and took care of us. They spent time helping us order and even sat with a family to explain the menu. Amazing customer service!! And delicious food!! Thank you! We'll definitely be back.

ie_KthobDzW1YvlAEc8ZTg.text: We actually meant to go to the grocery store but the appeal of Mama Bird looked too good to pass up. And we were not disappointed! Being new to the area we are constantly looking for good places to eat and we're so happy we found one! I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was the best chicken sandwich I have ever had. Crispy, great flavor and the chicken was cooked to perfection! We also ordered some Mac n cheese that we'll be back to order again and again!

m0ggtwm8MTyVnNRFbRij4g.text: This food is amazing and sooo delicious. The shrimp and grits is probably my favorite but the fried chicken and waffles are pretty amazing too. They have a special sauce for the chicken make sure to ask for that. The sweet tea is some of the best I've ever had. I need to mention as well that the customer service is on point. This place will definitely have me coming back for more. P.s awesome deco

I-K174h3Wf-UJCkiHEooqQ.text: So amazing !! The brisket is tasty and the biscuits yum yum yum . We have been twice and will go again ! If your in the mood for southern food this is where you should go !

iQrbOn408wc3UzDZQ-kGwQ.text: Food was good but too pricey.  The biscuit was small  should have had two biscuits. Place is small and it was cold sitting under the air vents.

hmNis0m4qpAa4VNv_ZclqQ.text: The food was amazing. Our table of 7 tried so many different items and every one was good. Standouts were the deviled eggs, the chicken and waffles, and the watermelon soft serve. Service was great. The only down side is the place is small so it might be hard to get a table!

4FLJwwgti9xfvQMg7GGVbw.text: First thing you'll notice is the friendly greeting as you enter this funky eatery. The decor is rustic with a flare of refinement. I can't speak to the bbq options, brisket and ribs, but I stand by my recommendation for the chicken. This is the best fried chicken I've had in years, most orders come with a lovely biscuit. Back to the chicken, the outside isnt too crunchy,  the tenderness of the meat is tops. Yes you must come in to enjoy the best fried chicken around.

kkjIkkDZTrRp_myQF5MoMA.text: Absolutely incredible food!!! This is my third visit to Mama Birds and it continues to be incredible! Best fried chicken sandwich in town!! The Ribs and Brisket are smokey and tender. The Mac n cheese is creamy perfection!

6NfWhsyrWLsCnDE1BQgPHg.text: Really was a disappointment. Lacked flavor in the chicken tenders. The biscuit was a little hard and had cheese, Popeye seeds, and was paired with honey butter. (The honey butter was the best part) The mac n cheese tasted bland and like there was more milk and other herbs than cheese itself. Coming from the south, I was really hoping for something close that would be up to standards to the many other southern food places that I'm used too. Besides the food not being good. The prices are a little ridiculous. There is a place called Joella's chicken in Kentucky that does the something similiar(if not the same) dinner style that this place did, and it was better priced AND tasted better. I'm not sure if they are taking advantage of being in"Southern Highlands" to charge that much for subpar southern food, but I would go somewhere else or look up a recipe for what they serve because it would probably be cheaper and taste better.

J0V0660dQyBHTzQ-7o72yA.text: Great southern feel and hospitality!!!! Good food, first item I tried was the watermelon soft serve and it was amazing!!!!! The atmosphere  and people make you feel like you're at your grandmas house for a nice Sunday meal!!! I will be here every time I visit Las Vegas

2qqoc7hEcTuhy5I56RIL1g.text: Had the chicken thigh meal and as I cut into it I asked my husband "where is the meat"?  It was covered in breading with small pieces of chicken for $15. I love friend chicken but was surprised to see the breading was more of a dark brown than a golden crisp. Almost as if it stayed in the oil too long or it was in old oil. Thought I had a bad batch then saw pics, nope it's the norm. The biscuit was pretty good and buttery down side is I ordered two but got one instead. I am glad to see folks like it but it is not my kind of friend chicken. I'll stick to homemade, blue ribbon or churchs when I'm in a time crunch

5dk7C3foaBrGgk1Y5sKy9g.text: I'm excited to finally have something different to eat in the neighborhood. If you live in Southern Highlands area you know the struggle of finding close eats. Decent food for a decent price. I come from a family of southern food cooks so I can't give a 5 star but I would definitely come back again.

-LHPu-qB08AdreH7NHsHsQ.text: The food here is amazing. Just like coming from your grandmas kitchen! Highly recommended

8RiAFtiW8-wF_1gug94ytw.text: The best southern cooking in Vegas!  Large portions, friendly staff, GREAT food!  Shawn made our experience even better with his vocal style and positive vibe!  My new hangout!

pSzn4my-Utap9XY4Lqnfvg.text: This is for sure one of my new favorite spots. The food is amazing and the atmosphere and customer service is phenomenal. Super cute inside and everyone is so kind. I will be coming here again!

kQcpA3MG1cvyv82_8MmwDw.text: I loved the food here probably my favorite family breakfast shop. The mac n cheese here is to die for

xX4UA-L1Jg3BNDhk1U9cdQ.text: Southern Highlands has needed a place like   Mama Bird for a long time. Fair prices, great food with southern hospitality! We shared the chicken and waffles, smoked brisket and pecan smoked ribs which were all fantastic. Will be back!!

zS3zJpErCSSYL6AUfEgQiQ.text: Awesome new spot. The fried chicken sandwich was delicious. Service was outstanding. The staff was very attentive and polite. This restaurant is number 1 on my favorite places to eat in Vegas. Can't wait to come back and try the chicken and waffles.

XxHYf3NnihlPGRk9RphSaw.text: Finally a great place to get fried chicken. Kids loved it, will be back. Chicken was delicious, Mac n cheese fantastic. Great spot

ahKHZkIOlu-Z20wHi8Mq-A.text: Chef Brian is so friendly. Service is good and the food is awesome! I highly recommend this place.

nu1r5T2L4jmEYGcUk11dgw.text: I recently visited this restaurant and loved everything about it. The food was great. I ordered half slab of ribs, the BBQ sauce was awesome, a little spicy just the way it should be! My fiance ordered the fried chicken sandwich, which is pretty much his go-to whenever we eat anywhere. The staff was friendly and helpful and there to answer any questions. The BOH staff came out to touch tables which I think is great coming from the hospitality industry. My only concern is that, I believe it was the head chef, maybe the chef/owner, talked to other staff members like they we're children. Explaining to them how to clean out the fresh juice machine made my skin crawl. I get that he probably has been working with these guys for awhile and he knows the way they learn the best or they understand how he teaches... It was just a little off-putting that guests could hear him belittle the staff. Just a observation. Everything was great otherwise.

neLHLXT3qIrlYk_H0iOX8g.text: This was my first time eating here and it was amazing! The food was cooked to perfection, and the staff was extremely friendly! The fried chicken sandwich was delicious, and I got it within 5 minutes of ordering! Will definitely be back again soon!

jFFjsAznUtkyA9lT5vYE8w.text: Best place to fill your tummy.  Everything is delicious.  Fast service and helpful server.  Will definitely recommend to other friends looking for place to eat.  Smoke pork belly, watermelon with honey and lime and smoke brisket ham are my favorites.

sCfFa2L8s2IcVo8V40U-Nw.text: An unexpected Gem here in south-west Las Vegas! This place is better then most restaurants on the strip. Their fried chicken melts in the mouth. 2 Mmmmm's up!!!!

-BdAkb5jXSMl8CnudcqfZA.text: I'm impressed, chicken was hot and fresh. Collard greens  were tasty, roll was soft and delicious. And I'll be back, right around the corner.  Always good to have a wonderful new restaurant close by

i4nXI9fuMVO__IrVFr1keQ.text: By far the best southern I've found in Vegas. Best fried chicken Tenders. There cake in a jar is great too!

QanANwKqaV9cDRowLOb4Dw.text: This place is amazing for Southern Highlands!  - Great Home'y Atmosphere - Amazing Menu - Something new to Vegas - Great Music - Southern Food +++  Definitely need to check out Mama Bird ASAP before it starts getting busy! New and AMAZING!

iN47qGva17INUqKpzt4Fxg.text: This place is awesome! Food  portion Is huge.  Definitely go on an empty stomach. Nice and clean. Staff  greeted you at the door said thank you when you left. Fantastic customer service. The chicken here is so good.

7N-74TffuG-wQAt2JQUTzg.text: I'm from New Orleans and has to check it out. I had shrimp and grits and my husband had the chicken. It was really good at a decent price- will go back soon.

wvgHr51E4MshAYdT_Hk0Gw.text: So I really really wanted to like this place!  I haven't thrown in the towel but we're not off to the start I hoped for.  We live across the street and my husband and I like to sneak away for breakfast when the kids are in school. Today was the day.  Here's the break down:  1.  No vegetarian options and a very small choice for breakfast.  Husband had to order ala carte.  2 waffles and 2 fried eggs was $16!!!!!  Really??? No meat, no cheese, nothing fancy.  Eggs and waffles should have been offered for $9.95 at the most.  And before we all come with our pitchforks and say "it's a southern chicken restaurant" they have to understand that not all families are vegetarian and we want options so we can dine out as a family.    2.  I really wanted the chicken and waffles or chicken fried steak but I can't bring myself to spend $15+ on breakfast....that's dinner pricing!  So I ordered the biscuits and gravy for $11.50.  Now I love all things biscuits and gravy so I was happy to choose that.  But I'm still kinda hungry.  The biscuit came in a small dish with gravy on top.  Um, I'm still hungry.  Ok, not starving but it was like a half serving of what I'd get elsewhere.  And I think the gravy was flavored with sausage because I all I got were tiny crumbles. Flavor was good.  My over hard eggs were runny.  They did offer to fix it though.    3.  Date breakfast was dampened by the price.  Now we're off to work and I'm wishing I would've packed a  lunch.  4.  I will say the waffles and honey butter were good.  My husband did devour it.  Just not $16  dollar good.  5.  I do want to try the chicken and I will be back to give it a try.  And if I love it it will be my guilty pleasure.  Because we're a family of 6.  My kids think dinosaur chicken nuggets are the bomb so their is no way we will come here as a family because my husband can't eat here for a reasonable price and I can't bring myself to spend a $10 on two chicken tenders for each kid.  My kids would want ribs too and $15+ for small kids is nuts!  Suggestions: 1.  Offer some vegetarian options (you have everything there to make some killer menu items!!!) for a reasonable price.  His meal should not have cost more than mine.  2.  Offer a kids meal.    3.  Broaden your breakfast offerings.  Again, you have everything there already!  Hash browns, bacon, and sausage would be a great addition!

6pLIxVytaGRrbS-mqGPpfg.text: Great place to eat! Loved my breakfast  biscuit sandwich!  I will be back!!!!!! Husband is so picky and he also loved his breakfast. Great service.

ZcdIqIhC3-kLr_-qOy7Juw.text: Decided to check this place out today and was not disappointed I ordered the fried chicken sandwich with a side of watermelon and the deviled eggs the sandwich was really good they give you a nice piece of chicken for the sandwich fried perfectly and steaming hot. It's very clean and well kept overall great experience will definitely be coming back. Also Ryan was very friendly and gave great service and made a good chicken sandwich!

G9CdqOE5snsb7bqAFfvHQQ.text: First the good...pleasant, helpful customer service, excellent presentation along with generous portions. Great Southern Highlands location, which is where I reside.  Now the bad...Overpriced fried chicken limited to breast & thigh meat, which was disappointing. Chicken was bland (unseasoned) and over cooked...that becomes a problem when cooking white meat vs dark. Drastically over floured.  The sides were mediocre at best. I can throw down in the kitchen, and have Southern lineage but this place was a complete miss for me. The biscuits were just plain awful. Not light & fluffy...heavy, tasteless and dry.  I opted out when offered to-go containers.

LhTETQqew3M3fPRZk6KVVw.text: Saw the reviews and was excited to try. Got the food and was disappointed.  Ordered the chicken tender waffle sandwich. The portion offered for $14.95 was very good, It was a lot of food. However the mac and cheese was relatively flavorless, and the breading on the chicken tenders did not stick well. The waffle could have spent a little more time on the iron...it was soft and soggy and the bottom fell out pretty quickly.   It came with a mixture of crinkle cut fries and sweet potato fries that looked very good and seasoned well. unfortunately, they were greasy.  I also had the everything biscuit with honey butter. The biscuit was soft and tasted good, but was heavy on poppy seeds up top. The honey butter was not mixed well-or at all. It was butter next to honey.  I did enjoy the watermelon lemonade. It was pretty refreshing.

DDwhFV6p08uR44O5uqiBpg.text: Only place that I know that does boneless thigh plates!! Amazing crisp on the chicken and the shrimp and grits are to die for!   The collard greens can have some improvement. It's more spicy than savory. I'm used it being more savory like it was cooked with a ham hock.  The waffle can use a little adjustment to the batter. It didnt have that nice crunch to it. It was more soggy than I'd like it to be.

rRBiSRIVCV1qOwpdve3GMQ.text: The sweet corn is perfect and you get whole corn kernels, not the normal mushy corn soup like everyone else does. My expectations for country fried steak has been surpassed and now I can't have it anywhere else. The gravy is served on the side; GENIUSES!! I absolutely love this place it's a must AAAAND SHAWN IS REALLY AWESOME!

7VJ-gKp_ul94XUn6kgZHjA.text: Seriously though...have I died and gone back to Virginia (either the right one or the West one)?  Fried bologna sandwich, cheese grits, collards. MOIST fried chicken.   Don't even get my dogs started on the dog treats...

QrDu7e8exiz3AP3wLScvew.text: First time here. The staff was friendly and the place is clean. The misses and I ordered the boneless chicken and a salad. The chicken was seasoned well (no spice which would make a nice flavor blast). If i had a bigger stomach I would have got the Mac and cheese which looked yummy as well.

hLu6AsfUeurv2fzhrnXP1A.text: Home made southern food!  This place is such great comfort food.  Had apple coleslaw & creamy sweet corn, omg felt like I truly was in the south in some one's kitchen!

iOXitLzznTzZ6AQwAM_HbA.text: We've been here two times and everyone in the family loves it.  The deviled eggs are the best ever,  the fried chicken is perfect, and the bbq is top notch as well.  We haven't tried the wings yet but we're looking forward to it.  The service is very friendly as well.  Great stop for a family breakfast or weekend lunch.

Hpk73R_thNqHhcmbDWfQ6A.text: My first thought of Mama Bird is that the Chicken & Waffles is much better than the hipster DW Bistro and of course its right by my house so that is cool...and and and I have a close friend who eats here all the time and absolutely loves it...not perfect but a quaint change of pace....

Z0ZJJmQZRtOkvWLcyFGRjA.text: This restaurant is a small country themed diner. It is absolutely delicious. The fact that they dont come to your table to take your order is odd - but the food is so delicious it makes up for it. I had the biscuits and gravy and I was not disappointed. I will definitely be back!!

dHodVyLWBCT2hmn2gijimw.text: AMAZING! The best brisket EVER. Great chicken, great Mac n cheese, great fries, and AMAZING DESSERTS. Would recommend this to anyone looking for good home-style cooking. Staff was very accommodating and had great southern hospitality. Make sure to visit on your next Vegas vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G_c-fMNYd_v2fK5BBm7F2A.text: Visited this hidden gem on our way back home to San Diego!  First off the decor is absolutely Farm house style I loved it! The food was plentiful and delicious! We ordered the 3 piece Fried Chicken thigh meal which comes with one side and an "everything biscuit" and Omg that was so amazing the chicken is super crunchy and delicious! The 1/2 slab rib meal also comes with the same and the flavor of those ribs is on point! The LGB ginger beer is perfect not overly sweet at all and comes in a cute jar served with a Moscow mule mug very refreshing and delicious! The Chefs greet you upon arrival and even check on you to see if the food is ok loved that! We ended our meal with that super delicious watermelon  soft serve  this place is a must try! Thank you Mama Bird we will be back.

FWfvs0rcMzzTOWo-12Hjmg.text: Very friendly staff. Real sugar drinks. Going to have to try all of the bbq and chicken and desserts on the menu.

17Z6FyVNgYtEaNoe4oF5hw.text: This was our first trip to this place and it is already a favorite. Our favorite meat was definitely the pork belly, and the honeyed watermelon was delicious.  Highly recommend trying this place out.

mjcOk7i_sx9KfGdssFJ7uw.text: Brazil and Brian are wonderful! Great customer service, amazing food, and comfortable atmosphere. This place screams classic southern breakfast. Highly recommend! 5+

uL-FvBRVEMORBYL3TKBn6g.text: Zack is the man, and the food is unreal. They gave us bacon deviled eggs (for free)while we were waiting to order. Service was perfect and The brisket was phenomenal!  Please go if you want amazing southern food, if you don't like amazing southern food then go to Denny's

k4JjHhf2wqm7j9YjFQtP5A.text: Trendy new restaurant! Love the decor here. Great food served for breakfast, lunch & supper! I had the Mac N Cheese Chicken Tender Sandwich and it was one to remember!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4U2oWqpIvbDIWNWK1e57lA.text: Generous portions of tasty food! Kitchen crew was definitely working hard. Staff was attentive as well

mc3QKdmMYszVkF9j6vZFVg.text: Amazing food and great service!!!  BBQ is so flavorful and I'm very happy me and my friends came here for our little get-together!

1md9aYb1Jo8BQLhQHSLfeg.text: The food was outstanding. The price is a bit high but I don't mind for a quality meal. Definitely a gem in the SW of Vegas and it will be sad when its hard to get a table because everyone has found them. But the ones who know about Mama Bird are smart, they order to go, pickup and use an app for delivery.

cD2WQI-Y42LrDUQljwBVng.text: Yum! From breakfast all day and watermelon self serve ..nice home feeling inside, cute decor! And nice and friendly employees from when you first walk in.  5 stars

1yOKPoxlSrn8CXCCjOHCvw.text: Had an excellent lunch here and the food was fabulous!! We had the chicken strips and the brisket. Fresh and moist ~ great flavor. Staff was warm, welcoming and engaged in making sure our experience was the best. Look forward to returning soon.

mARxhQ5SL0lksS36Ztzx1g.text: This place is so cute! My chicken tenders were amazing. Mac and cheese was creamy and delicious too. Staff is super welcoming and friendly. Cozy little restaurant. I love that it's locally owned. We need more of these in Vegas.

looo5gMD4Rsiue40rhUMbA.text: Mama Bird is such a cute, refreshing addition to the Southern Highlands community. When you first enter the restaurant, it's like you're walking into a southern style home. The theme was kept all throughout from the tables and chairs to their glassware and of course, their hand crafted ginger beer (non-alcoholic)! It is open seating so space is limited especially during busier hours. We came in during their lunch rush but was able to grab a seat that we split with another couple. It wasn't a big deal, we still had plenty of room to get in and out of the booth seat. You order at the cash register and subsequently grab your food from there when done. It was a little crowded at the register, again it was a lunch rush, so it probably would have been easier if they had a number system where they could bring out your food to the table instead of everyone hovering around the register. It took about 15-20 minutes for our food to be ready but it was well worth it! I ordered the spare ribs and my boyfriend the smoked brisket. It came with their everything biscuit and a side of your choice. It was a decent amount of food so we had to take our Mac and cheese to go lol. We also decided to try their original lime ginger beer and watermelon lemonade which went perfectly with all of our food. All in all, we had a great experience and plan to come again to try our their sandwiches! I would recommend coming if you're around the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon Soft Serve
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Brisket
Photo of Mama Bird - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spare Ribs

eFkYxipeUO102Ed5BNzs9A.text: I thought church was only on Sundays? My trip to Mama Bird was on a Monday and it was a small religious experience to say the least! Walking into this small spot I had some good intel on what to expect...good food and homemade. The building itself is small and it fits the vibe of the place. Blake Shelton was playing and friendly faces working made me want to throw back a shot of whiskey as I waited to order. The menu is tight but has a nice variety of things to try. It's almost like the team here got a big bag and dragged it across the south picking up some of southern cuisines greatest hits...then adding their own twists.  My gf joined me for this meal and being a southern girl her opinion reigns supreme when it comes to southern style food. We opted for the spicy fried green beans to start. They were light and crunchy paired with a dill ranch like dip. The snack section here is a lineup the Golden State Warriors would shiver at. For mains we had chicken tenders and the boneless thighs. Perfectly seasoned and juicy like a peach inside. The comeback sauce has a flavor similar to another beloved chicken establishment. That might "Raise" some eyebrows comparing it but it's that good. Being the glutton I am I saw the meals came with one side but ohhhh boy were they big! I had the cheese grits which were just the right amount of slutty cheezy goodness you would crave. My gf opted for her regular side of Mac and Cheese. The saltines on top of the Mac n Cheez seemed like gilding the lily but the Mac is amazing!   Do not pass on the drinks here! Hey liquor board give them a license already! We had the watermelon lemonade and the LGB ginger beer both were unique and great!   You can feel and taste the soul in this place. As cliche as it sounds typing that ...it's True. I live close by but this would be a place I would make a food pilgrimage to on occasion. Hey postmates F**k you for delivering this places food...but hey I can eat this at home yet it probably tastes better in the warmth of the place itself.  Check this place out!

kZqDUfUD4CNIYhQSqCFeSQ.text: Absolutely amazing!! Hard time choosing what to order therefore will be returning soon!  Never had chicken and waffles let alone a chicken and waffles with mac n cheese sandwich.  OMG delicious!!  Sampled their homemade pimento cheese and it's the real deal.  Can't wait to go back!

8YA7_70lllmxI5xXc5GiYg.text: I stop by for Mac and cheese and chicken fingers, I was amazed with the food, the chicken was perfectly cooked moist inside yet crispy outside good flavor, the Mac and Cheese was delightfully creamy and excellent flavor. Overall I think it was excellent and still want to try A few things I saw in the menu and Im curious about the ginger and jalapeno beer( non alcoholic)

taXGNNI1_1sY0rqIznS97Q.text: I can't even put into words how good the food is here! The chicken, creamed corn, Mac and cheese....yummmmmmmm. The staff is friendly and welcoming-it's like walking into someone's house.

Q-VVBscnm4Wum9hjjCfIww.text: We started with the fried green beans and loved the dill dip. Then got the pimento cheese with candied jalapenos and bacon jam, well put together twist on a southern classic. Then we sampled the brisket slider on the everything cheesy biscuit, simply put... phenominal! Then we moved to the entrees. I had the brisket and ribs combo with mac n chee, the brisket was so tender and intensely smoky as were the ribs. I rarely use any bbq sauce and while it was very tasty i didnt feel either meat needed it. My wife got the fried chicken and collard greens.  Chicken was expertly cooked and very crispy and served with a sauce that was incredible! My son opted for the chicken tenders and dries. These were some of the biggest tenders i have seen, same as the fried chicken very crispy and delicious! The fries were a blend of crinkles and sweets, very nice touch. Well worth the drive and we will be back again soon! My new favorite BBQ joint!

FgCtfOk5GbUqo-3LDwXp7w.text: Stumbled across this little gem whilst running around for work today.  First thing I noticed was the  cozy, comfortable decor.  I was greeted by the chef with a friendly hello and a smile, as well as the young lady who was cleaning off a table.  They accommodated my special food request with no objection.  The brisket is DANK, tender and fatty served with a nice smoky bbq sauce.  Fried green beans were simple and delicious, served with a nice thick dill ranch.  I don't eat a lot of bread these days, but the everything biscuit was too tempting and I took half of it down.  Yum, I'll be back.  Oh yeah..  TOPO-CHICO!

LCo7IU5tOHn8vzV59prkPA.text: Had a great first experience at this restaurant that is a much needed addition to the Southen Highlands area! Chicken was  fresh and delicious! Our son had the brisket and loved it Busy place but we found a table. The service was good and they kept up with the demand! The water melon dessert was a delicious ending to our dining experience! Warning-  no kids menu but you can mix and match the single items like a strip of chicken or a small side for the kids! I just hope they stay open full time now! Pricing may need a bit of adjusting on a few items! Definitely worth a try!

F-Kcp86pN7jzeZtz426y6w.text: It was mine and my family's first time eating here at Mama Bird and it was a very good experience overall. The workers were very friendly and when we asked questions about their menu they informed us very well on it. The food took a little long to be made but it was definitely worth the wait because the food was really delicious. We ate the mac n cheese chicken tender waffle sandwich and it was a big portion that fed two people and it was a great combination and tasted very good! We will definitely be coming back to taste the rest of their menu!
